review_body: The room was tiny, that didn't bother us, was very warm, fabulous location, on the last day we were checking to make sure we had everything, got a massive shock as the bed base was very badly bloodstained, looked like someone had been shot...complained got nowhere...definitely never go back to this " hotel "

I rarely write reviews, but this place is so bad that I feel the need to warn others. I'll start by saying that the pictures are not in any way, shape or form an accurate depiction of this place. Filthy bathrooms, tiny, dirty bedrooms with doors that don't close properly, as well as other guests that appear to be using the place as a half-way house would be much closer to the truth. While we did pay less than what other places in Manhattan are charging, the price that we were charged did not give us any indication that we would be staying in a dump. I was traveling with my two daughters, and because we arrived at 3 am, we stayed until 9 the same morning. We slept in our street clothes, with a table jammed against the door and prayed that in the event of a fire, we could find our way out of the maze that is the hallway. Please do yourself a favour, and stay elsewhere. Due to the lack of accommodations in Manhattan, we ended up going to New Jersey. We definitely paid quite a bit for Uber's and PATH, but the peace of mind was worth it; we also found it to be a nice break from the chaos of Manhattan. Having stayed in the city during previous trips, I assumed that the travel time would not be worth staying anywhere else. I was wrong, and my next trip will be booked in either Brooklyn or NJ.

I've now stayed at the Morningside three times and would come back again. Yes, it's a budget hotel with pretty basic accommodations but if you're visiting NYC for pleasure and just need a place to crash, this place fills that need. The Upper West Side location can't be beat either, with quick and easy access to the subway and bus lines. Just have realistic expectations of what you're getting (hint, you don't get fancy champagne on a beer budget) and you'll be fine!

In a good neighborhood, this efficiency hotel is a great bargain for New York City! Staff is caring and concerned about guests. Rooms may be small, but you’re not going to spend your day in your room when you’re in New York City.

I made the mistake of booking this hotel. When I arrived, they said they were sold out of rooms with private bathrooms (which is the room that I had a confirmed reservation for). They offered me a room with a shared bathroom or a refund with an attitude as if being sold out is a natural reason not to honor my existing confirmed reservation. There was no apology or reparation. I wrote to management, but received no reply. Unless you do not mind possibly spending a night on the street, do not book this hotel! The person at the reception told me they couldn't help me but that I was free to complain. Overall, the hotel is a dump. Other aspects are just as mismanaged as the reservation system. Rooms, furniture, and toilets are in disrepair (e.g., sign says don't put toilet paper in toilet or it will clog), sheets and floors are stained, the shower walls are yellow with residue that makes you think twice whether you really need a shower. The most astonishing aspect, however, is the staff's complete lack of acknowledgement of responsibility. "We are sold out" (of the room you already reserved) seemed like normal business to them. This hotel does not belong in the hospitality business.

The owner of this place should really do something about the manager he has!!! he is HORRIBLE!!!!!!!! A LOT to go into details but BEWARE!!! the pictures you see on the website is nothing as the real thing, the place is old and dirty. Trust me you do not want to stay here.

For starters calling it A room would be stretching it it.Dirty sheets, furniture that looks like it’s been taken out of a charity shop basement.Staff don’t care.Any problems seem to be your fault.Even a door sticking after 5 minutes of you getting there.It says a two start hotel.It’s not even a one.Communal showers and toilets,Covered in mole.Avoid at all costs.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!After being foolish enough and staying at this hotel for MANY YEARS, I can honestly tell you to avoid this place at all costs. Spend a little more for a better place. I have learn my lesson the hard way. (stubbornly learned)Keep in mind I travel to NYC roughly 6-8 times over the summer months and have given these people thousands of dollars in business. I book WAY in advance, usually in January.THE GOOD:First of all, its a great location, close to the subway, plenty of places to get food, Duane Reade around the corner. Its generally very quiet. I don't think I have ever had to wait for one of the shared a bathrooms.THE BAD:Most importantly..... YOU MAY NOT EVEN HAVE A ROOM WHEN YOU SHOW UP!!!The people who own and work at this place don't care about you, and are not helpful in any shape or form. Not helpful at all.2017: I usually book though hotels.com but for this particular trip I saw a lower price on Morningside Inns website. I go to check in and that's when the person at the desk informs me "Oh you booked through the website, you shouldn't have done that, it doesn't work" and "Sorry we are full booked" And pretty much, so what, don't let the door hit you on the way out. He didnt give a damn.You would have thought I would have learned my lesson.....2018: Labor Day weekend, after a long day I was exhausted. I go to check in at 9:30pm, this time I'm informed that the day before there was a flood on my floor, so I have no room. What?!?!? So why didn't anyone call me to tell me? Again the person at the desk really didn't seem to give a %#%. He did let me use his phone to call hotels.com since my cell phone was dying. Gee so nice of him. Luckily this time I booked through hotels.com and after hours and a lot of work they helped me get a hotel by 1am!!!!!!! This is NYC and Labor Day weekend of all times, not easy to find a room last minute (it cost me 5X as much money for this new hotel, but hotels.com reimbursed me back the extra cost, I cant tell you how relieved I was)Again, I should have learned my lesson......big time...but noooooo2019: This year I made it a point to call the day before to confirm my reservation. I called 2 weeks ago on a Friday for the following day, it was confirmed. I even asked if my other reservations were showing. Yup. Everything was fine. However when I got to my room it wasn't even cleaned. Good thing there was a spare available. (even though they claimed to be booked)Now my next trip comes. I called last Thursday I was told my reservation was confirmed an all set. Shortly after I get a call back and the girl tells me no, that my reservation had been CANCELED. And cant give me any reason why. On top of that, she had NO RECORD of my other 6 upcoming reservations!!!!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?This year I have booked through agoda.com and they confirmed that my reservations were active and confirmed. They called Morningside Inn Several times and told me they couldn't reach any manager there and the people they did talk to at the desk were rude. (agodas words) They have tried to reach the hotel manager by phone and by e-mail, and as far as I know now (Monday Night) no one has responded to them.As I said I book well in advance to save money and to ensure I have a place to stay as NYC is such a busy place. They completely screwed me over and now its going to cost me much more money to re-book 6 more hotels for the rest of the summer.If you don't learn from my mistakes, well good luck to you. Perhaps you will get lucky and enjoy it. Or perhaps you will show up and have nowhere to stay. If you like the save money and are a gambler type..... go for it!!!

Upon arrival the manager was very helpful with us all, the room was clean & beds were tidy. Very much “you get what you pay for” being just a standard room, but more than worth the low price you pay! Working TV was a bonus. Would definitely visit again.

I am writing this to set the record straight. You don't need me to tell you that this is one of the cheapest places in Manhattan, almost amazingly so because it's on the elegant upper west side just a few blocks from St John of God. You probably also don't need me to tell you that in the past it got some pretty terrible reviews, which are still coming back to haunt it, because things that people write in 2007 or 2008 seem to stay permanently and rise to the top of the google page when you type in the name of the hotel. We looked at those AFTER we had booked, and, of course, had second thoughts about the whole thing... who wouldn't? Maybe that's why it's still so cheap, because a lot of people might be turned off by a negative appraisal and not even notice that it was written eight or ten years ago. What you DO need me to tell you is this: we decided, with some misgivings, to go ahead with our booking, mainly because we couldn't find anything in the area remotely near the price Morningside was charging, so we turned up, hoping for the best but prepared for the worst. And what a surprise! The people who wrote those bad reviews back then might just as well have been writing about something on another planet. Our room was spotless, the facilities very good, and the staff just wonderful to us, In fact, on leaving I asked both of them their names so that I could mention them in this review. We were so thrilled with Nina and Tanya; I doubt if you'd find anyone in any hotel who appeared to be more interested in, and delighted by, their guests. They treated us like friends, not one-night tourists. Well, the bad reviews were from a decade ago, but here's the story in 2019: my daughter has decided she is going to New York in December on her honeymoon, and the first thing I said to her when she announced this is, "You just HAVE to go to Morningside Inn, and I will write to Nine and let her know you're coming." I don't think I have ever said that before about ANYWHERE. I guess if a few more NEW reviews get onto google they will start to put their prices up; so my advice is, simply, don't leave it too long if, like us, you like a bargain!

I would give no stars if I could. Small room, dirty sheets, small communal bathroom with mildew in the tiles, carpeting that screams for a cleaning, rude staff at the front desk. I checked out 20 minutes after I checked in. A hostel would've been better than that.

For the price of the hotel don't expect Hilton.It is a nice budget hotel, rooms are small but OK. Rooms are clean, every day new clean towels.Location is good, between two subway stations. If you travel from/to La Guardia Airport, there is a bus stop nearby, and the ticket price to the airport is only 2.75$.

It's now downtown but you can get there in 15 minutes o to take the Ferry to Staten Island in about 25 minutes. The Upper East Side of Central Park is near too. We stayed at a private room with our own bathroom so that option was ok. Place was very warm even though we went there in one of the coldest days. Would recommend if you don´t mind not being downtown. They provided a room to store our luggage the day we had to leave so that was very nice of them.

Booked through AGODA.Air conditioner didn't work. Telephone didn't work. Mould on carpet from leaking fridge. Room not as described...Spacious 32M squared? Less than 15M squared, couldn't put our bag down and walk around bed! Dirty vacuum cleaner left in elevator!We could not stay for the health reason of the mould alone due to asthma. Didn't want to risk getting sick in the middle of our holiday!We were told we would be given a refund so we booked an alternate hotel. Didn't happen! Been charged the whole amount and the hotel has now lied and said we stayed???Provided multitude of proof to AGODA that we did not stay, including Uber receipt & alternate hotel receipt along with photos of the offending room.AGODA are not interested in supporting us and we are now out more than AUD$1200. Now pursuing other avenues for refund or compensation.

This side of Manhattan had all the amenities that a traveler would need, including a Postal Office within 3 blocks.We visited the Riverside Park. It was clean, green, peaceful and friendly people walking their dogs. It was very secure too. The hotel facilities need some improvement. The header did not turn on and when we asked for extra blankets none were available because the housekeeper services end at 6pm. We waited for transportation pick up time sitting at the stair steps because the hotel lobby or hallway had no furniture. The hotel receptionist made no effort to provide a chair for my 84 years old mother.

This place is grubby and dangerous. The only plus side is that the bedsheets and towels were clean but that was it!! The towels often had holes (clean holes). The bathrooms were disgusting with rotten doors presumably eaten away from water damage at the bottom. The tiling (floors and walls) were gross and needed to be scrubbed at least but realistically needed ripping out. The carpets in rooms and particularly corridors were dirty and sticky (you certainly wouldn't walk barefoot anywhere!). Paintwork was the brown paint which you get when you mix all your left over paint together and then let a child paint the woodwork. Truly low standards.Plug sockets hanging off walls. curtains dirty and difficult to open/ close as rails were mucky. Windows did not look like they'd been cleaned for years.Beds crinkled due to plastic sheets on the beds (although as previously said the sheets were thankfully v clean)No window sills just painted but dirty / stained concrete.Really grim.Staff ranged from disinterested to really friendly which was OK but I'm guessing its hard to have pride in your workplace here.

Wow! This is by far the whorst hotel i ever booked! Super unfriendly childs at the reception. Please dont stay here! The bathroom was terribel. Dirty Dirty Dirty! My friend an me got sick by staying in this "hotel" Low Budget yes but this ......

We arrived on a Saturday night around 11pm to find a group of people hovering around the reception desk. We were told that there were no rooms available as they had been flooded the night before, despite us having a booking. We were not informed - nobody had reached out to us or any other guest to tell them that the accommodation was uninhabitable before we arrived there. The only representative at the front desk was in his own words "overwhelmed" - he got very short with the understandably frustrated group of guests now having nowhere to stay for their holiday, coming up with ridiculous solutions (like moving into a hotel he knew about 45 blocks further north out of the city with a shared bathroom...). Nobody else was there to speak to. We never received an apology. We had to book into a new place at last minute New York City prices for our stay and lost a lot of money in the process. Due to this, I would never recommend anyone stay in Morningside Inn because even though flooding is out of their control, there was no process in place whatsoever to look after their customers in this event.

If you like towels with holes in them, narrow corridors, a tiny noisy lift, toilets for 4-feet tall people like the mirror in the room and a sound asleep nightmanager, then The Morningside Inn is perfect. I knew we'd have a shared bathroom, what I didn't know was that it seemed to be shared with all the other guests. Nothing positive? Well the Upper West Side is quiet and both Broadway and Amsterdam Ave offer lots of places to eat and drink. The Subway is on 103rd. And there's a church nexdoor. And the price is love. A tip; check the text on your doorsign. We didn't see it had Do not Disturb on both sides, so we didn't get new towls until next day.

This place is central and near the subway however the way they treat customers is terrible. I arrived with my family but they had given my room, which I had booked and paid for online, to someone else. Had to find alternative accommodation.

Well, don’t over look this slightly tarnished gem. Rooms are small but adequate as a place to sleep, shower, and enjoy the city. Convent to public transportation and airport buses. Lots of OK places to eat and easy to get to and from.

I booked a room last night, was very tired to get to bed. They didn't have my room, and neither did they have for the people in front of me. The person in the front desk was very unintelligent, confused and this was horrible. I waited 1 hour before deciding to book somewhere else, losing my $130, go somewhere else. It is a run down, stinky place that is not worth it, for few dollars more you can book at an actual hotel, not this hostel/hotel/motel or whatever they are

The hostel was clean, I’ll give them that! It was also cheap and it was actually $100 cheaper than expected when we checked in which was great. It is however cheap for a reason, but to be honest I think you get what you pay for and we were happy enough. The bed collapsed every time we sat on one side and the shower had to run for literally 10 minutes to heat up - it was quite a comical experience! The ceiling fan didn’t work either but they fixed it as soon as we notified them and they offered us another room after the bed saga. Staff were generally friendly too and it is in a good location. Good for a few days’ cheap(ish) stay in New York.

Reception staff really need to work on customer service. Just be nice to people and be happy to see them, no matter what the issue may be regarding their reservation.The rooms are indeed in bad condition as many reviews say. This would be less of an issue if guests felt welcomed.

I thought I'd get a place that would be all right, but not too good as it was priced fairly low with okay pictures. Compared to the other places I stayed in NYC, the standard was really low and the prices fairly high. There are way too many good alternatives in Manhattan to stay here.

After reading the reviews i will be honest i wasnt looking forward to this stay however, on check-in i was greeted by a friendly member of staff who explained how to get to my room etc. myself and my friend were situated on the 5th floor and while our room was on the small size it was clean, we didnt notice until quite late that the A/C wasnt working, we forgot to mention to reception the next morning however, when we returned we found it had been replaced and been switched on (which was a blessing) yes we had a shared bathroom and after other people have used it, it will be hard to keep clean but everyday we saw housekeeping around. on our last day the bathroom was closed which i assumed was for maintenance but we were told where other bathrooms were. overall if you are looking for a small budget room that has friendly staff (my experience is if your friendly to them they are friendly back) which is a few minutes walk from a subway station that you dont mind being 20 minutes away from times square then check this hotel out. my favourite thing was whenever we walked in the main doors it smelt clean!

This hotel is basically one big scam, the photos you see online are nothing like the actual rooms, they cost a fortune but the rooms are so disgusting that even bed bugs stay away...Front desk is a window with a rude girl who was too busy on her phone to serve us, the showers and restrooms if you can actually define them that, are shared and absolutely disgusting.Bottom line, stay away at all costs, sleep in your car if you must, just don't waste a dime on this dumpster. Management - if you are reading this and actually care, do something about your business before it's too late.

I booked this through Hotels.com which described it as a boutique hotel and had the fact there were shared bathrooms buried deep in the description - which I only discovered after checking in.From the front lobby where you walked into booming rap music to the 2 non-working and utterly disgusting bathrooms on the floor, I checked in out of exhaustion on a forced overnight due to travel issues and regretted every minute I was there. No A/C on a hot steamy night in June, no television, there was a hole in the floor in my room that was covered by carpet. DISGUSTING. There should be a negative star rating. Ultimately I slept for 2 hours on top of the bed and left back to JFK.

Stayed at this hotel for a little NYC adventure on a shoe string budget, it was my first time staying at one for these ”shared bathroom” type hotels, after reading the reviews and going into this with the knowledge that my expectations should be non existent I don’t have anything really bad to say about this hotel, yes the inside of the hotel has seen better days, the staff does not cater to you necessarily and having to share the bathroom does get annoying.Having said that, the bed was comfortable, (although you could tell the sheets didn’t get washed) towels were provided every day without asking, the shared bathroom even though small it was kept clean and stocked with toilet paper, the location is very convenient for getting from/to LaGuardia, easy access to the train/buses and overall a very nice area with lots of stores and restaurants.Basically a place to sleep at night is what you are getting and nothing more, if you want to do NYC on a budget this is an option.

I booked this hotel for one night as my flights were changed and no availability at my original hotel for the additional night. We arrived around 10pm and were shown into a room behind the reception desk via an employees only door?? Down a narrow corridor that was cluttered with paint pots and cardboard and was full of dust. Could barely get our luggage through.The only decent thing about the room was the bed was comfortable. Other than that I have nothing positive to say. The room was dusty, the heater made a loud hissing noise every 30 mins and lasted for 5 mins (was told by staff this is normal??), TV didn’t work, bathroom was filthy - to the point where I didn’t even shower in the morning. Was woken at 6.30am by some sort of church service going on next door and then at 7.30am the guy in the room next to ours started playing ridiculously loud music and singing at the top of his voice. The lady on reception in the morning was so rude. Couldn’t have been any more obvious she didn’t want to be there. This is marketed as a hotel but I would barely call it a hostel. Even for the price (I think I paid around £60 for the night) it’s not value for money. You couldn’t pay me to stay here again, and I’m so glad it was just to sleep for the one night as if it was any longer I wouldn’t have been able to stay there.

This hotel on 107th just off Broadway doesn't look like much. You can walk by without noticing. Inside, you might see a group of European backpackers checking in. This hotel has an excellent UWS location for a bargain rate. Note: bathrooms are shared. I thought I was opening the bathroom door in the room, and it turned out to be the closet. =) Three or four hotel rooms share each bathroom. The bathroom has a lock: it has just one shower stall and one toilet. I never had to wait. My room was clean and quiet. It had a very nice tv and coffeemaker. If you don't mind "tourist class," this is a great place to stay. There is a locked luggage room in the basement to stash your bags before check-in or after checkout. Note to Sabbath-observant Jews: all rooms have manual keys. You can stay here over shabbos and yontif. Mile walk to OZ Shul on 95th Street.

I stayed for 5-days in december. Convenient place walking distance to metro mc donalds nd KFC,but hotel rooms are in poor standard One cant even make a coffee or tea, since kitchen had nothing to warm or cook. Fridge in the room.Good wifi.but not worth for money.

Very poor. I even thought we wouldn't have hot water considering one of the taps from the sink doesn't exist and the one that was there had a C on it.. The room só oooooohhh small! Don't get fooled by the pictures... It's nothing like in the pictures! Yes they were okay they were polite and all but.. Honestly we talked to many polite people in the city during the whole trip so it doesn't compensate the poor quality (or lack of) of the hotel.. It shouldn't even show up in TripAdvisor...

The hotel is located in the Upper West Side section of NYC. The hotel was very basic. The elevator was so tiny and so slow. It is best to just walk up the steps. The room and bathroom are both tiny. The hotel is accessible to the red line subway station (few blocks away). It is an OK hotel for a one night stay if you intend to be out and about all day/night. When I checked-in, the front desk staff gave me a room that was not even completely cleaned. I also requested if I can extend an hour for check out and they did not allow that. Wifi stalls at night when everyone is using it.

What started as a fun trip to the city quickly turned bad when we checked into Morningside Inn. After driving through the night and going all day around NYC we were looking forward to getting to our "hotel" to relax at 2pm check-in. As soon as we walked into the building we were greeting by questionable people milling about and or yelling, and the less than friendly receptionist. We handed over the room fee of $155 in cash along with a credit card to hold as a "safety deposit" and we were pointed to our room with the exact words "just go through that door over there", an unmarked door that led to a sketch narrow and short hallway. By this point when we even opened the room to the door we were not in any surprise to what we found. The radiator appeared to have been leaking for quite some time covering a majority of the carpeted floor, the room was FREEZING because the bathroom window was open and would not close due to being broken, stains all over the sheets, walls, floors you name it, a door that barely locked and no towels or cloths to be found anywhere. So not even being in this room for 30 minutes we went back to the main desk and politely asked if a refund was possible especially since we paid the fee in cash. The receptionist's response was "it's not very likely but you can call the manager, he isn't here right now". After debating what to do for quite some time we decided that we would walk away from the ridiculous fee of $155 that we paid for that dump and try to find something much more clean and safer. Huge waste of money, would never recommend to anyone, unprofessional staff, hardly even a real business/hotel, will 10/10 guaranteed ruin your trip =)

We booked a room for 4 days in December, 3 month before arrival.After 13 hours travel from Germany we arrived and the impertinent lady in the desk just meant: „Sorry, your room is broken and there is no ohne left.“No help to find a new hotel. She was just hanging on the phone.Dirty, undriendly, can‘t beliebe that. I hope she will be fired soon.

Worst place I ever stayed at! FILTHY! Everything was broken including at least one of the two bathroom that was shared by at least 15 rooms. Was first on the sixth fl when the elevator broke. Asked to be moved to lower floor, gave us 2nd floor and it was in the same disgusting shape. Rooms has musty bodie odor. They should be ashamed of there advertising which says “newly renovated”! Well maybe after WW2.

We stayed here a while ago. It was a dump. I never reviewed it then. Checking hotels for a trip to NY next year, it came up on my screen. I recognised it straight away, although the place has had a bit of a face-lift. Think Jocelyn Wildenstein though if you are going to stay here. The room was so small that we almost fell on the bed when we walked into the room. The view from the window? A brick wall about a metre away. For some reason we paid more than the Canadians and Americans staying there. It is in a really nice part of NY, with some really good restaurants and a fantastic deli, Garden of Eden (had to google it) a few hundred metres away on Broadway, and a bus that goes to JFK just outside the door. Stay somewhere nearby.

We paid for 4 nights for a double room with a private bathroom. From the outside it looks ok, but once inside its dark and dirty. Upon checking in the first think you notice is the reception lady clearly didn't want to be there and was miserable. We were given the keys for room 602, we had 2 cases and went to use the lift but found it full of cleaning supplies and cleaner made us wait while she went up to a higher floor. Eventually we squeezed us and our cases in as it was still full of cleaning trolley and other supplies. Once in the room the first thing we noticed was the bed was on an incline, it looked like the room hadn't been cleaned in weeks with thick dust on the skirting boards, windows sills, etc. Tried to plug in a charger and the wall socket fell forward exposing the mains wiring. We were about to go out for a quick look outside when we heard a noise and red hot water sprayed out from the ceiling near a large pipe covering our suitcases, luckily we hadn't unpacked yet so they were closed. Not that there was cupboard to put the clothes anyway.I went to reception to ask to change rooms and was complained at that it was after 4 and the cleaners and maintenance person had left for the day, we had just seen them a few minutes earlier. So we had better not have slept in the bed or made a mess because they were fully booked and someone else would have to sleep in the room. I couldn't beleive they were just going to put someone in there without fixing the hot water leak. The lady said some people don't care, which was exactly her attitude. Reluctantly I was given another room key and we transfered our cases. This room was slightly better than the first with a little less dirt and at least the bed wasn't on an incline and no leak. This room was still bad, with a massive gap down the side of the room door where you could view most of our room from the outside, it would have been even worse if they hadn't screwed on a bit of metal to try and close the gap slightly. There were holes in the blinds, towels while clean were dropping to bits. The electrical sockets in this room were also dangerously falling out of the wall. The shower had screws sticking through from presumably the next room. Talking of the shower, only 1 time was the shower hot and the wall was so thin you could hear next door having showers at 1am and 5am each night. While mentioning the thin walls our new woom 402 was next to a kitchen area with a microwave, which was in use right through out the night. Being woken up to the constant noise of the microwave ad pings when it finished, then the neighbours showers doesn't exactly make for a good nights sleep, which is all we tried to use the place for.We unplugged the fridge which we had no use for due to the noise it made.We often had problems opening the doors from the stairs/lift to the room corridors, I saw half a dozen others with the same problem and helped a couple of them open the doors. I dread to think what would happen if there was a fire.When we checked out we asked if we could leave our luggage and were just handed the key which is kept on the reception desk and left to put out luggage in the room in the basement. The place was very dirty, full of rubbish and other peoples luggage. We were extremely worried about leaving our luggage as we had read that others had things stolen, which isn't suprising when anyone is allowed in. When we returned 3 hours later we were told we know where the key is just help oursleves. Thankfully everything was still there.I have stayed in some really bad cheap places over the years, but this by far the worst. It was booked as part of a package holiday so wasn't chosen directly by me. Please do not book this place unless you are expecting extremely basic hostel accommodation and just need a roof over your head. Most of the building is hostel accommodation with shared bathrooms. The pictures of the rooms must have either been taken a long time ago or maybe somewhere there is a couple of not bad rooms hidden away.The only positives are it's location and WiFi. The surrounding area is quiet, about 10 minutes walk to 110th street station and about 15-20 minutes to Central Park.

My daughter had a NYC night included in an airfare-this was 2 stars-but unbelievably ragged, unkempt, noisy neighbors, minus a 1 star. One can find a much healthier accomodation. Front desk person, however, was very good.

To describe this place as a dump is being generous. I agree with all of the negative comments. The carpets are filthy. Not sure the last time they were even vacuumed. When we arrived there were no face cloths. I had to ask for them. We stayed 2 nights. No one cleaned our room after the 1st night. I had to obtain clean towels. The front desk girl said she would tell her manager. Not sure what he will do. Probably nothing based upon everything else. Also I originally called the hotel to make reservations and they would not take them. They referred me to an online service such as Priceline. Thanks to ensure they are paid. I've stayed in cheaper hotels that were MUCH cleaner, larger and had better service. I will NEVER stay there again and I wouldn't advise anyone to stay there. The pictures are definitely misleading. Not sure when/where those pictures were taken??? A rate greater than 1 is TOO generous. Can we do negative??

This hotel is economically good and rooms are always available. It is also good for family stay. I would suggest if anybody have low budget. I stayed with my wife and my daughter and they also like it.

On setting foot inside the room my wife and I turned around and checked out again. The hostess was wearing her pajamas and is apparently a private residence masquerading as a hotel. My concern is that because of Booking.com’s non-refundable reservation policy the proprietors of this listing are making quite a bit of money from a very unprofessional enterprise. And yes, the photos are very misleading.

Room was clean, quiet and wifi great, so better than feared. The hallways though could really do with a revamp, totally depressing, and for $100++ per night shared bathroom was a shocker, at least by Asia standards.Walking distance to Columbia's campus.

Worse than the bad places I have stayed overseas, I would not stay here again. Hallway smelled of urine, Shared bathroom was not cleaned regularly, room smelled of mildew and did not seem clean. Avoid this place!

I went there with good expectations from the reviews That I had read. I pre booked a room with private bathroom. On getting there I got my key and went to the room, I was presented with an 8x8 sized room only. On going to reception I was not the only person with the same issue (3). The man on the desk was very abrupt and asked for proof I had booked one and on showing him the booking he got on the phone to argue with I guess the manager??? The 2 other people asked for a refund but I couldn’t do that as I have no credit card etc to pay elsewhere. The man said to come back the day after at 11 as a room would be empty by then. I viewed my opinion on this saying now I’m wasting a valuable day which I had a very busy schedule to keep to. The SHARED TOILET on my floor was blocked!!The day after I turned up later that the 11o’clock time and was told the room was empty but I couldn’t have until 14:00 so it cou;d be cleaned... doh! I repeated my conversation but it was still not available. I was told to check out of my room and at 14:00 I could have my room, I couldn’t keep my room I had so I had to pack and go into an insecure besement room to leave my case etc. Please bare in mind you are based at least 20mins subway ride from Times Square. I took this time to walk to Central Park until my time was up. Once i got the room I had booked it was.... what I paid for. Basic but clean.The towels were clean and every other day they were changed plus bedding.The TV had plenty of channels and WiFi throughout the building and was very good.To be honest I was only there to sleep,so with my own bathroom HIGHLY RECOMMENDED it was very acceptable and worth the money I had paid. Bare in mind you are at the top of Central Park area and to walk to places like Times Square will take approx 1 hour, Subway is about 20mins.

I had a great and relaxing time at Morningside Inn. Friendly staff and great area to be in! 15 minutes to Times Square. I felt safe and taken care of. Would definitely recommend to any of my friends..

Don't judge this place by the photos. It is nowhere near that good. As we are 2 adults and 2 children we needed 2 rooms. They were on separate floors. The shared bathroom toilet facilities were badly needing renovations and grotty. Carpets in the rooms need replacing.I wouldn't stay again.

The Location of this 'hotel' is excellent, near Riverside and Central Parks and in a great area of the Upper West Side.When we arrived the lift was broken so we had to get our cases and bags up the narrow stairs with no offer of help from the staff.On entering our room, there was no toilet paper in the room, and there was something dead and crusty but unidentifiable on the floor covered with ants.Halfway through our stay, without warning, the bottom half of the window, the heavy metal and glass part, crashed inward into the room.Minutes before my 13 year old son had been sitting in the place where the window crashed down.The window was not able to be properly fixed for the rest of the stay and was propped open by a toilet roll by the guy who came to temporarily fix it!The WiFi was spotty and kept dropping out.The price is cheap for NYC and the accommodation reflects this.Positives are great location, interesting old building but there is much room for improvement in many other areas.

This "Inn" deserves a minus rating. Problems: Old dirty, tiny room, slept on springs; vulgar rude reception, no breakfast, dried blood on bath towel, did not credit my account as promised, filthy elevator.

One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. Unprofessional staff singing songs about "crusty vaginas" on reception whilst we waited for them to get our keys. One of two bathrooms on the floor broken so everyone on the floor shared one toilet, one sink, and one shower. The shower was broken and the whole room was wet as a result of it being constantly on. The flush on the toilet didn't work so we had to put up with the stench of its contents as well as look at the lidless bin full of bloody sanitary products and stand in years of accumulated rat faeces whilst brushing our teeth.The room itself was extremely spartan, and had peeling paint on the dirty walls, but the bed was fine.Slight concern about safety as there was a patch on the wall where the smoke detector used to be and several fire doors were jammed open with rusty air freshener cans.On the way out the receptionist glared at us for making her look up from her phone. Two stars my behind. One would be generous.

No ensuite bathroom although each block had their own bathroom. The bedroom had a new carpet and the bed sheets were clean. Dated room and the Aircon needed cleaning but for the price paid it was ideal for travelers as you're not in the room much.

I have nothing inherently bad to say about Morningside Inn. Very conveniently close to the subways, and easy to walk up and down Broadway. It had great scenery in the neighborhood. The hotel itself was pretty basic. Just a bed, dresser, and tv, which was all I needed. The bathroom and the toiletries are things that could be upgraded a bit, but overall, my experience wasn't bad.

I booked this hotel on the position that it was close by for my daughter's pick-up point for camp. My daughter travelled solo for 2 nights in NYC and I trusted that this hotel would be a safe and clean location for her to stay. Quite the opposite! Shortly following my daughter's arrival, I received a phone call from her in tears. The welcome on arrival was far from friendly. She was told 'try this key on this 2nd floor room, if there are other people's belongings in it then come back and ill assign you to another room' - which she was left to do alone with her heavy luggage. Luckily for her it was an empty room. The corridors on the 2nd floor smelt like cannabis and the hotel had an overall gloomy feel. The shared bathroom was beyond disgusting (see photos) - surprised my daughter didn't catch something. The shower knob fell off as soon as she attempted to turn the shower on and the flooded floor was complete with empty sanitary towels for extra decoration. My daughter explained how she never felt so unsafe in such a location. When closing the curtain before bed, she was pleasantly graced with the curtain rail falling on her head. On hindsight, I may have been better booking her in a YMCA - which would have been cleaner. I did try to move her, however all other hotels nearby were booked up.

Staff was incredibly rude, the room was dark and dirty, and they don't provide shampoo and conditioner. They barely supplied us towels! When we arrived in the room (which 3 out of the 4 lights were out on the shaking ceiling fan light), there were no towels provided. A rude woman came to the door and handed us towels without saying a word. Speaking of the bathroom, ours was private and the ceiling was falling apart.I work in retail and I understand that its not easy to keep up a smiling persona all the time, but the lady at the front desk was miserable. Aren't they there to make people feel welcome? She barely gave us mind when we checked in. Thankfully it was one night that my boyfriend and I stayed before we went to our other hotel (Belnord). The difference in service was ASTOUNDING. Going from a dirty room with loud beds and doors into a respectable institution was like night and day. The rest of the group who were staying at Morningside joked that they would rather sleep on our floor than to go back to that dump. The amount of money they are charging to stay at the Morningside is far more expensive than the service you receive. We even witnessed someone give their room away because they were so disgusted by what they got for their money. They would have rather booked another hotel than to deal with the crap Morningside serves. If you have a high tolerance of awful service and disgusting rooms- go for it. However, for the price they are asking for, it is definitely not worth the money. The nicest place in this hotel is the lobby. That is it.Pros:There is a refrigerator.The subway station is a walk away.The M60 bus is right on the corner that takes you to La Guardia.Cons: The room was stuffy, dark, and the AC was barely working.The ceiling was falling apart and there was a pipe that ran down the side of our bed.The room service failed to even make one of the two beds.Better ask for towels, because you most likely won't get them to begin with.No decent soap provided.Terrible staff attitude.Slamming doors.Disgusting carpet.Loud and springy beds.Suspicious dark liquid dried on the walls.

Day 1: at our arrival around noon, all the welcome we got was "you're early"... We just asked to store our luggage so we could return our rental car. We got the key to the luggage storage room in the basement, help yourself. The "lady" at the reception did not even bother to get off her seat. When we entered the room, we saw what is meant by a "basic hotel": dirty carpet, tiny room, no mirror in the bathroom, no towel hanger, mold on the bathroom walls and dito smell, whole in the bathroom door, airco shoved under the window, electric cable of the airco hanging loose along the wall,... see the pics.Day 2: when we got back to this place in the evening, we saw that we got no towel change. When I asked the "lady" at the reception for new towels, I got this answer: "housekeeping does not start until 8 a.m." Tx again for the immacualte service.Day 3: we were woken up at 5.30 am by water pouring down the bathroom doorframe. Then the lights started flashing and the water started to pour down through the ceiling on our bed. I ran downstairs to inform the "lady" at the reception while my wife grabbed everything together so we would not have any damage to our belongings. After 30 minutes waiting in the lobby, we got another room. This was probably an upgrade: there was a towel hanger and a mirror! All the rest was as dirty and smelly as before... Nobody did even bother to make an apology or ask if we had any damage or if we needed any help. When we came back in the evening, we saw that we had no towels in our "new" room. Surprisingly the "lady" at the reception could provide us with 2 towels this time, although housekeeping did not start until 8 am the next morning...Day 4: on our new floor the door between the stairs and the hallway lacks a door pump... all night long you here the door banging when someone is coming or going...When checking out, the "lady" at the reception did not even bother to put down the phone to say goodbye or anything. Which was no surprise really after this horror stay.This is why I prefer to book our stays with airbnb in big cities: if you get ripped off, you get your money back. This is just a rip off and a disgrace for people who do take their job seriously and give you your money's worth.

I reserved a private bathroom room and got a tiny room with shared bathroom. The shared bathroom was dirty and did not even have toilet paper. The service in the front desk was terrible and disrespectful. Just an overall terrible experience.

We had a private bathroom so we cannot comment on the facility with respect to shared bathroom. The private bathroom was spotlessly clean.location is fab - walking distance to subway. The subway is on the line that takes you straight to times square and wall street and greenwich village. Not even a change of subway is required!!! Room is small but decent size. You get to move around as the luggague can be kept in the closet space.The front staff is courteous and available at all the times. For our needs, it was the perfect find.

The webpage of this hotel is very misleading: "newly recarpeted and refurbished" not at all. The hallways are gloomy and the carpet certainly hasn't been refreshed in decades, neither has the painting on the walls I was staying in a so-called "superior" room; so I don't want to imagine what the others are like. It llooks ok from the outside, but it's really the worts place I ever stayed at in NY or elsewhere

This hotel has only one thing going for it . . . location. Rooms were smelly, bathroom not attached or clean, and hallway felt like I was living out a Hollywood B movie. Reminded me of a hotel in northern Uganda I stayed in a few years ago for $5 a night . . . and that was overpriced.

The room was small and didn't offer many amenities, The shared bathroom was a challenge to use at times.The room was clean and well stocked with towels and what not, the staff was reasoably friendly but I was grossly over charged for my room, my online reservation rate was $75.00 a night, I was charged $106.00 a night, tried to reach the manager multiple times to no avail, I'm still attempting to have the difference refunded back to me.

Very basic accommodation, shared bathroom had poo smeared on the sink. The Tv was wonky and there was a constant smell of Cannabis in the corridors and faeces smear on the sink in one of the shared Bathrooms that didn't get cleaned for several days The Tv was wonky on its stand. The breakfast offering was Coffee and Cookies. Overall would never stay here again. That said it is very close to broadway and a lot of good local eateries and subway. I'm giving one extra rating for location purely otherwise would have been a terrible.

I have stayed in many hostels throughout the world, and I'm sad to say that Morningside Inn is the worst I have stayed in. I am embarrassed at the quality of this New York hostel compared to hostels in other countries, and embarrassed that Moringside is a reflection of our quality of hostels in this country. There was a big fight our first night there, where some guy punched holes in the walls, and thrashed the room. The police were called so late, the guy walked away. Then the room was left open in that condition for everyone to see. The shower handle kept falling off. In the basement where coffee is supposedly served (either cold or not brewed), a rat ran across the floor, and the floors are dirty, windows wouldn't open and the floor was dirty. The night staff were pleasent, but watch out for the manager, he will rip you off. He would not honor my initial deposit of $186 that I paid to HostelWorld., and told me I should be paying a lot more for the room. He was rude and condescending. So I ended up paying a lot more than I should have. Morningside is deplorable, beware if you stay there.

I stayed here because I was travelling on a budget, and everything in New York is ridiculously expensive. So I put up with this for the 6 nights of my stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, as New Yorkers are in general. The decor was tired. A previous guest had pulled a bed fitting out, leaving nails exposed which I manage to push back. The toilet cistern kept flushing until I learn a trick of lifting the lid and turning it off. (I suppose I could have gone and complained to the staff about that one, but did not.) There is breakfast of muffins and coffee down in the basement. Everything basic.

Very Basic hotel. Nothing wrong with it, could do with the bathroom being cleaner. Free Wifi but it only works in certain areas. Staff are friendly & helpful. Guy that checked us in said he would give us a room with 2 beds even though I already booked 2 x Double beds, got a room with 1 Double & 1 single bed. Personally if staying again I would pay more to get a nicer hotel.

Fantastic and nice place, good position, close to the metro and very cheap.Highly reccomended place to sleep if you don't want to spend a lot of money ( compared to the NY media) and if you want to stay comfortable.

I get there ate at night. From the street Idid to see any sign. There is a carpet at the entrance that has their name on it. As this is New York this is an older building. I thought that the entry way could be cleaned better. I think they'd the after the first night. The desk is open 24 hours a day and is helpful and friendly. They appreciated that I was there. The room was basic and clean. I asked for help for operating the cable TV. It worked well once someone went over it with me. The provided refrigerator was not on. I did not use it so I did not ask for help with it. The longer I was there the more comfortable I felt there. i was there for four nights. It was very content less than half a block from Broadway. There was a nice natural food store on the corner that had a good variety of food. It is close to Columbia University and the subway stop.It was the most affordable place I could find in that area. It worked fine for me. There was a broken blind in the window that would probably be better removed. The window shade does a good job by itself. I could have rated it a two but with helpful staff, a clean room and a good location I gave it the benefit of the doubt. There is internet but it is sort of slow. The first night I could hear a baby crying in the distance. The other times it was overall pretty quiet.

Stayed here for 4 nights and it suited our needs perfectly.it was basic but clean the staff were all friendly,nice neighborhood and close to the subway.rooms and bedding clean with beds made everday and clean towels.shared bathroom but we seemed to have it to ourselves and there was always hot water!

This hotel may not be a Hilton or a Westin, but it is a very nice place to stay in New York! This was my first time visiting the city and I spent the week before looking up rooms in New York that would fit my budget, and guarantee I didn't have any miny travelers coming back with me. This hotel's rating were not incredible but it seemed like a decent place to stay.We arrived at 11pm on a Monday night. The room we were in is small, but all we wanted to do in there was sleep. This hotel is a 20 minute commute on the subway to Times Square. It is a 20 minute walk to the Northern end of Central Park. It is surrounded by small businesses where you can eat on any budget. It is located next to a gorgeous Church. Along with being Clean, cheap, and convienent, it also feels safe at night. If you are visiting New York on a budget and want a quick and easy place to stay, this is your hotel.Oh, small thing, in the cheaper rooms you need to share a bathroom, but there are sinks in your room for daily hygiene stuff like washing your face, and brushing your teeth. The showers were clean, despite being shared. I brought lysol wipes so I could wipe down the shower if someone went in their before me. I do believe they have rooms with private bathrooms... they just were not on my budget. Oh final thing, eat at Henry's around the corner on Broadway. It is super cute inside and the food was amazing.

If you are looking for a budget place to stay in NYC go there. Friendly staff, the rooms are simple but clean. Book with private bathroom! Close to Metro 1 110th Street. Very quiet. Safe neighborhood. Really ok for a short stay

This place was actually terrible. My team had booked 4 rooms here and received a confirmation email, but they were going to pay in person. When they arrived, the front desk girl said they had no rooms for them, and so they had to book a new hotel on the spot. My boyfriend and I had already paid for our room so we went up, the room was so small that we couldn't even open the door fully because the bed was in the way. There are communal bathrooms, and only a sink in the bedroom. They had no way of turning off the heat, only a tiny ceiling fan and a window. We asked the front desk girl if she could turn off the heat and she said no just use the fan. Excuse me?!!?!? Even with the window open and fan running the heat was intolerable. Also the walls were paper thin. Like I mean paper thin where we could hear the entire conversation of the room next to ours. Worst service I've ever experienced, rude employees and disgusting/dirty bedrooms. Spare your money and time and do NOT go here.

I wanted somewhere clean and comfy for a short sightseeing break, and that's exactly what I got. The staff on the desk were polite, the bed was fine, no issues with the Wi-Fi, it was incredibly quiet, and ideal for getting to the subway, but also not that far from Central Park. I liked being away from the hustle of downtown, and since it's slightly off the beaten track that made it all the more interesting. There is a good jazz bar close by and some decent restaurants too. I could also leave my suitcase in their storage area before I got my flight home, very convenient. Only drawback is the shared bathrooms, yes they are in need of updating, but they are all clean, serviceable. A/C could have been a little bit better too as it got a bit warm at night, but you can live with these things. Quite frankly if you're going to visit NYC, you're not likely to spend much time in your hotel room anyway!!

This hotel is cheap and is close to the subway which is great but it was so horrible and dirty! Their 'free Wi-Fi' didn't work in our room so we had to go stand in the stairwell two floors up. Their cooking facilities include a microwave only that didn't actually work properly. But the worse thing was seeing they had taken $100 US off our credit card for no reason a few days after we'd left. When I called I was told it is a mistake and will go back into my account. This didn't happen so I emailed and called again and again and always got a very defensive manager. I ended up having to go to my banks dispute department and eventually got it back 3months later. I wonder though , if they do this in the hope that every so often they get away with it?? Anyway, I would recommended paying a bit more and finding something better and not give these people the time of day!

Budget hotel with a really good location. It was really nice to come back to the area after busy days in New York city. Would recommend both the area and the hotel. Worth the money if you compare the prices..

EN: They gave us a room that had not been remade and the person to whom I said have it changed immediately. The second room was clean but very very small. Essential. The neighborhood is pleasant and very well connected by metro and buses. It was not expected breakfast but every morning there was always a choice of cookies with Tea and coffee.IT: Ci hanno dato una stanza che non era stata rifatta e ce l'hanno cambiata subito. La seconda stanza era pulita, ma molto piccola. Essenziale. Il quartiere è piacevole e soprattutto molto ben collegato da metro ed autobus. Non era prevista la colazione, ma ogni mattina c'era sempre una scelta di cookies con The e caffè.

Quick check in. Many rooms in the hotel so felt like little maze. Towel is provided. Decent clean room for price. Friendly staff. Location is "ok" elevator in hotel for convenience. Bedding wasn't that great, so it may not be the great sleep you get out of this place.

You got exactly what you paid for. The room was cheap so our expectations weren't too high. The location was great, just off Broadway and not more than 2 blocks from the subway or bus. The room was very small and basic but in saying that it was clean. It wouldn't be my first choice for a couples getaway but it was ideal for us as we were going for a night out on the town. Staff were friendly and overall we had a good stay.

the room not was clean, the services was terrible, and the 1first time I say there and was frustrated for me, the person make me the check out was concern of all my situation in that place and they help me and give to me a disccount

We booked a room with a private bathroom. We can't stand shared bathrooms and we knew in nyc where most building are ancient it was best to have our own private bathroom. The room is certainly tiny but it was clean and tidy. We couldn't expect more for a standard nyc hotel for $95 a night. Every night our wall panel heater will make this loud noise and that threw us off the first 2 nights then after that we just ignored it. It is a basic hotel, staff are not friendly, so your best off using the free wifi and doing your own research. Overall, we would not stay here again. There's 2 good points in terms of location of this hotel. It's close to a subway and there's a deli/fruit market around the corner of the hotel as well as a bagel shop called Absolute Bagel which serves delicious fresh bagels in the morning...it's a must to try!

Staff werent very friendly at the hotel. Didn't acknowledge our deposit so our total was $150 instead if the $125 advertised. Wifi worked well in the room and rooms standard as advertised on the website

I knew it would not be fancy, or average, and it was not. But, that's ok. It was cheap and that was more important at the time. The room was fine, not dirty that I could see, but old and basic. This was my first time sharing a bathroom, I think there were 8 other rooms but I don't think the floor was full, so it was never a problem. Again the bathroom was old, and not the cleanest, but i expected that and it wasn't so bad as to freak me out. The walls are thin, i could hear the tv of the neighboring room quiet clearly. I will say the staff were not outright rude, but the made you feel as though you were inconveniencing them and they couldn't really be bothered to help you. My only real complaint was the breakfast, again i had very basic/low expectations. There was free coffee which was nice but the only food was cookies. I love sweets and everything, but not for breakfast. I'd have preferred stale cereal (which i've had other places). A tray of cookies just seemed odd. If you have time to shop around and get a deal there are many better hotels than this one. But, it suited my purposes as it was cheap and in a good location. There is a nice bagel place and pizza place nearby. I also lucked out with free street parking for the whole weekend. Traffic in the area is pretty reasonable if you're driving.

Our first thought was "oh god no" but honestly give this place a chance. Our room was always super clean.. thanks to the great lady who clearly appreciates her job and therefor reflects it in her service.. peeps at the counter were not always super friendly but hey.. if u know the hospitality industry.. u will understand why. Coffee was great.. and if u are on holiday.. u are only there to sleep and shower. So who gives a cr#p. I give this place a thumbs up for anyone visiting nyc on a tight budget. Ps. Great area! Not to loud but not too quiet either! Thank u morningside inn.. we had a great time!

This hotel was disgusting, more like a hostel. Was not clean, one door handle held on with sellotape. Smell of "weed" through corridors. Room awful, no ensuite, shared bathroom which I distinctly stipulated to Expedia I did not want. Horrible ,with plaster falling of ceiling over bath. Rats running around outside. Please do not recommend this "hotel" to your clients. We took one look & left!!!

I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The sheets wasn't clean and it looks like the place needs a full renovation. I stayed in a single room and I couldn't open even my handbag like a normal person. The towels wasn't that clean and I could hear anything happening around even when the person next door entered the bathroom. There is a microwave and an opportunity to cook in the floor. Few people did use it and my room had a smell of a kitchen the whole day. No shampoo in the bathroom and two small pillows was given only. I would recommend the place only if you are on a small budget.

When we arrived our room wasn't available. We did get a room with a dirty shared bathroom. We had a small room with a very dirty carpet. The firearm beep every other minute because it was out of battery. We felt very uncomfortable. The manager told us not to charged for the first night. We booked an other hotel and got a refund of our paying.

This place is horrible, the area, the building, the staff and the cleanliness. We left after only one night, (should have stayed for 3,) we felt unsafe and unwelcome. Would never recommend this place. I have stayed in far better backpackers, it is a grotty hostel.

It was exactly what I needed a place to lay my head get a shower ( Dont forget shower shoes). It was good and convienant to all the places I needed to be. On,a real quaint and quiet street for Manhattan
user_location: Mount Pleasant, South Carolina, United States

review_body: I would categorize this place as a Hostel, not a hotel as it was listed on Expedia. Entire building was filthy dirty. Shares bathroom/shower with other guests. (Also not mentioned in Expedia) Bathroom did not have hand soap or paper towels. Have had better accommodations pitching my tent in the woods!! You get what you pay for when traveling to New York.

My fiancée and I booked this hotel through budgetplaces.com in May 2016. We specifically wanted an ensuite/private bathroom and paid extra for this. We paid our deposit and considered it sorted. We arrived for our three night stay at the very end of September 2016. We arrived in a hurry (because we had yankee tickets booked) and were told that they no longer had our room available. They offered us a room with a shared bathroom- shared with 6 other rooms. We were shown a tiny unmade up room on a dark corridor with a bathroom that looked like something out of a horror film. I am seriously not a major snob, but I would not have set foot in that disgusting hole.We were obviously distressed but kept being told that they had 'given our room away'! A room booked FOUR months prior!!!! We luckily managed to find another room in a different hotel which cost us an additional $200 and having to get there cost us an hour and a half of the yankees game.The guy on reception PROMISED me that I would get my deposit back through budgetplaces.com when I returned home, However now I've been trying for weeks and the hotel refuse to refund me and budget places.com have washed their hands of the issue.I can't stress how awful this service was and I can't even list the amount of reasons I have for you not to stay at this hotel.

Most of the staff were great, the maid service were friendly and did a good job. My only gripe and it's a big one is one member of staff. Please note it was only one out of the 7 I encountered.On arrival there was a mix up with our rooms so they gave me a double for the night and asked that I moved the following morning which is fair enough. The room they gave me had not been cleaned, but I suppose they weren't expecting to use it that night. I went to reception to ask for fresh towels and linen as the ones in the room were clearly not fresh her response was why didn't you ask for these earlier when the maids were here?I'd been at the hotel for less than an hour not that I should have to explain myself to her.She then got towels but said the linen was fine and she couldn't get any anyway. That night I slept in my clothes between my own towels. The bed had hairs in it- eurgh!If she had been the only staff member I'd be telling you all to go elsewhere however the lady in the morning was wonderful, pleasant and polite.I'd say go if you're planning on be out most of the time

Simply put: you get what you pay for. I'm used to hostels and I didnt mind the place, but my friends are used to hotels and thought it was a nightmare. Upper West side, which is a nice neighborhood, close to Central Park, with plenty of bars, diners, restaurants and coffee shops around, which was great. Subway stations are within walking distance, but hotel itself is on a quiet street, which is definitely a plus. Rooms are very outdated and simply practical (no decorations or anything added), but clean. Clean towels are provided and beds were made everyday, which was a nice surprise. Reception is 24 hours, although you shouldn't expect anything from the staff: i have never met a staff as disinterested as at the Morning Side Inn. Only thing that was a massive inconvenience was the fact that there was only one bathroom on our floor (which housed 11 rooms!!) and when i say one bathroom, i mean literally one toilet and one shower in the same room. Which meant we basically couldn't use the toilet, brush our teeth, let alone shower, anywhere between 8 and 11 in the morning.

Not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, but certainly not the worst. The hotel is close to the subway and easy to find. I found the staff a little standoffish but they checked us in quickly. The room was small and basic, but sufficient and was cleaned every day. The hotel allowed us to store our luggage on the last day in their luggage room, for no fee, which was much appreciated as we had a late flight booked. There is a good bagel shop round the corner too!

Location was excellent. Noise from other tenants was disturbing at nights. Heating / AC of room could be problematic. Was unnecessary during our trip. Very good value if you are just looking for a place to sleep

Unfortunately, this hotel had absolutely ruined our first family holiday. The hotel and room does not look like it does in the pictures advertised on the website. The staff were not only rude, but unprofessional from management through to the front of house staff. As with any place, not all staff were rude, some did help us with the misfortune we had encountered. One of the issues that stood out was the manager said that if we complained to Budgetplace that they would kick us out of the hotel. How a manager can call a tourist a liar when there is video evidence of us paying them the price they quoted to us?I really will not be recommending this place to anyone as I feel they way we were treated, it would and has happened to many others. whether distant or local visitors to the city.

Very noisy, old building so everything creaks, the bath tap leaked the whole 5 days I was there even though I had notified them the very first day I was there. People in and about at all hours so make sure to take earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Luckily for me I just slept there, so I wasn't affected too much. Location is pretty good

staff was very nice.my reservation was in the system. I had no problems. Rooms was very clean. The rooms was affordable. Nice neighborhood .I will stay there again. Its close to train. every thing is near by, central park. grand central.

Nice place, nice Location, nice people work there. Front desk help with daily trips, we have always clean towels, at night you can sleep well the street is quiet. Metro station is ř minutes walk and food market is on the corner. great to stay there

The hotel was basic, but was good value for money. Thankfully my reservation was in the system - as the receptionist said a lot of people had arrived and there was no record of their reservation! The receptionist was really friendly and dealt efficiently with check in. The room (budget single) was comfortable with a double bed, tv, fridge and small closet. The bathrooms were adequate although very tired. There was no hairdryer available, even though it says on the website 'available of request' - the receptionist said there was only one and another guest must have it. This was disappointing, but not the end of the world. It was a little noisy during the night, both within and outside the hotel, but nothing too extreme. In essence, this was an acceptable stay and good value for money given it is New York!

when we arrived they said we don't have a room because they tried our credit card and it got rejected. strange. on the same day we paid with this card and everything was fine. after they found a room for us there was a problem with the water and they blaimed us saying we broke the tap. I wonder how can one do that, never heard about it. they shut-down the water in our room for a day and still charged us for a room with a private bath. terrible!!

Much more youth hostel than hotel. Compare to European standards: incredible high price for very poor, noisy room. Air condition was so loud that could be switch on only for short periods - no chance to sleep with. But, to be honest, it was the cheapest hotel we were able to find in Manhattan and rooms were clean and acceptable to stay there :-) If you do not expect too much, it is OK with good position for exploring NY.

Small room, yet clean. If you are young Travelers looking to save some money and not spend a lot of time in the room it is fine to stay here and then you can also get the bathroom out of the room. if you are older couple like parents, get the ensuite bathroom and try not to expect too much from the room. It is very small, tiny air condition, yet everything was clean. Skip breakfast, there is a bagel sandwich place around the corner...

If you're reading this and you're planning on staying here then don't be put off but the title of this review.You don't go to New York to sit in your hotel room.Yes it has a communal bathroom and isn't the nicest of areas to stay but it is definitely worth the money.The location is not great but it's not the worst either and taxis to and from centre of Manhattan are around $20We had no problems with this hotel, the beds are actually really comfy, we stayed during February and the temperature outside was around -7 -10 and the rooms were nice and warm during the night.New York is New York, you shouldn't have a hard time trying to find something to regardless on the time of year you visit.Of course you'll want to see the city from the top of the Empire State but it's also nice to have a history lesson and take a tour buss around Manhattan which you can hop on and off of all day!If you're on a budget then this hotel is perfect just be weary of your surroundings and don't go wandering alone at night.

Pretty good budget stay while in NYC; considering summertime and all!Gotta check it out! The neighborhood is awesome, very cheap options for eating, drinking and even meeting some celebreties!The room was alright, not the fanciest, but I wonder if there's any better option, pricewise, in Manhattan today!

Great location. Staff were rude and generally unhelpful apart from the one young lady on reception. Toilets smelt of urine. Poo stain on the wall for the whole duration we were there. Shower knob not secure and kept falling off whilst showing which hurt my toe!! Doors really heavy and slammed by guests would wake you up during the night.Breakfast was poor. Limited supplies. Get there within the first 10 mins of opening or nothing left.Bed was comfortable but left with bites on my body... If more effort was put into the upkeep of this place, it could be really successful. Would I stay again? No.

We wanted a place to stay for a couple of nights near Columbia University that wasn't expensive. So our choices were limited in that regard. We were put in a room on the street...very noisy. You needed to walk sideways to fit through the door to get down the hall to the room. Our daughter went to check out the free continental breakfast and saw a roach on the way and turned around. I was brave enough to go but there was no coffee, creamers, tea, only pre-packaged muffins. Got a $115 ticket for parking less than 15 feet from a hydrant even though the city didn't have painted lines or signs about the distance.

The service was really bad and awuful. The internet was very weak and I couldn´t get through. I got locked up twice in the room. The telephone room never worked, I told the supervisor though. Unfair charges

nice place in manahattan, has quite street and simple clean room. I suggest nearest Absolute bagel for breakfast. 10-20 minute walk to subway. if ı come again, ı would definitely choose here. Especially I choose cause suitable price.

in short,PRO: well located for a decent priceCON: NOISY, SMALL, staff not approachable, desperate need for refurbishment spend 6 nights in June 2016 for our holiday in USA.The Morningside Inn is easy to get to with the metro. From the stop (103rd or 110th) it's just a few minutes walk. The hotel is in a convenient location with plenty of shops and restaurants and bar in the area.When checked in the receptionist seemed bothered that we arrived to check in, no smile not friendly but not rude either. just needed a credit card for payment and that's it, no registration to complete no need to see id/passport. Got a room on the 3rd floor 308 I believe. the whole hotel is in desperate need for refurbishment everything looked so tired. The room was very small for 2 persons, a small wardrobe, decent size fridge, aircon, tv and a sink. No place to leave your luggage than in the wardrobe. barely able to walk around the bed. The hotel is very noisy No this isn't from the outside! I was expecting some noise as it is a city centre hotel. No the noise came from other rooms, opening and closing doors. All the doors are slamming loudly. so you wake up everytime someone went to the bathroom or when other guests got back in their rooms.The hotel did provided towels and even got serviced every day. The bathroom wasn't always clean and tidy as it was a shared facility. I got only cleaned once a day, which is far too less as it is a shared bathroom by many other hotel guests.Complimentary continental breakfast was coffee, serials and muffin. Nice touch, only too bad we found out the last morning it was available.Would I come back if i was in NYC again?! Don't think so, unless they have a massive refurbishment and everything else in NYC is fully booked.

Price was right, and the rooms are nice and bright. Very pared down, old building. Beds are hard as bricks though, and skip the "continental breakfast". It's served in a basement boiler room and is prepackaged junk. There's a great bagel shop around the corner that's a thousand steps up. Location can't be beat, and definitely check out the late night Indian cafeterias and Bob's your uncle- which is a super chill bar.

I stayed here on 3 separate occasions in May with my mum. The first stay was good although I only managed to get hot water. I did mention it but nothing changed and I didn't get the same room so it wasn't a problem again. The room was comfortable and they had a mini bar and cable TV which is a bonus although I didn't watch it. The final stay there was a problem with the booking and I only got a room with one bed. They couldn't fix it on the day but next day they moved all the luggage to a deluxe room plus I got a refund of the difference back without any drama. Ive stayed at moringside inn in 2014 and my mum has stayed previously. They have improved the rooms and they are pristine and cleaned daily. Overall I'm happy to stay there again although NYC is becoming so expensive due to all the taxes that are tacked on. I had 5 additional taxes added to the final bill. I checked it out and it was correct. It appears NYC is bleeding tourists to pay for conference centres. I will think seriously as to whether I go back there anything soon. So while moringside inn appears reasonable in comparison to other hotels it's actually quite expensive now. That's not their fault and they have always been responsive and helpful.

we were put in a superior triple room with private bath...the most expensive unit offered. it was on street level in the front of the building so you heard all the noise, smelled the smoke through the AC. the beds were horrible, felt like coils. The property boosts continental breakfast but they ran out of coffee and half and half, offered no tea, only had pre-packaged muffins.

In this hotel you get what you pay for. Being a budget hotel in New York, we weren't expecting much, our room was small, but perfect to put your head down after a busy day in New York. The hotel was clean and friendly, and the room was serviced every day. The location is quite far out for most attractions in New York, but with only a couple of minutes walk to the nearest subway, it is easily accessible :)

Morningside in wasn't as expected, it didn't see as clean as I thought it should be. There was no screen on the window which allowed for bugs to come in & there was mold in the shower. The bathroom shower also did not have hot water and the toilet wasn't properly working. The room lighting was very dim & hard to see. The bedroom was decent but the sheets didn't seem very clean because we woke up itchy with bites every morning. The staff who was supposed to greet us seemed to be under the influence & acting extremely "slow" & "lost" for getting to give my phone back. The free contenital breakfast from 8am-9:30am, was never available, always running out at 8:15am. The free wifi provided to us never worked even with the multiple attempts with different codes.

The location was great, super close to one of the main subway stations. A short 20 minute ride to Times Square. The hotel is located in a more quiet area and it is walking distance to Central Park.If you are looking for just a place to spend the night, this hotel is perfect as it is very affordable. If you are looking for luxury then this is not your hotel. The walls were very thin, bed was not the most comfortable and it made noises every time I would move and the pipes made a lot of noise; but for us it was perfect for what we needed. The room had a mini fridge which came in very handy. This hotel is also a hostel and they have rooms with a shared bathroom, so if you don't want to share a bathroom make sure you request a room with a private bathroom when making your reservation.
