Everything was very clean and staff was friendly... I would definitely stay here again.

Finally having made it to the Big Apple, my booking pointed me towards Morningside Inn for my budget.The Location:New York City is BIG, and location is the biggest thing I can commend Morningside Inn for. If one is flying into LaGuardia (and I don't envy you if you are) simply take the M60-SBS bus all the way to the end of its line. The Broadway/106th stop is just around the corner. There are several good chain restaurants and even Tom's Diner (Monks Cafe) from Seinfeld is three blocks north.The Lobby and Staff:The reception is quite barebones. The hotel is in a pre-war building, and you have to know the address as the sign for the hotel is hidden behind a tree on the front steps. Some staff are more chipper than others. Check-in time is at 2pm, strictly enforced but there is secure luggage storage one floor down in the basement if needed. The Room:The rooms are older than they look on the website. Rather small too. Mine only afforded me a view of the alley and fire escape but there was a closet and a mini-fridge. What I was most surprised with was the upkeep. For being an older, barebones facility the cleaning service was impeccable. Most hotels anymore encourage reusing the towels but this trend has not made it to Morningside. They replaced them every day, like clockwork.The WiFi is included, they have around five or six routers going throughout the building but only one or two will work from your room and it can go in and out quite a bit.You have the option to either take your key with you or leave it with the front desk for safekeeping. The bed was not excellent, it was sagging in the middle and the pillows were quite flat. My room could get a bit stuffy, however there was a ceiling fan which made for better sleepingThe Toilets and Showers:Not numerous. There are two bathrooms per floor, one with a tub and shower and one with only a shower. You will receive small bar soap in your room. The bathroom upkeep could be a bit better as the drains ran a bit slow and were cleaner at some times than at others. The Atmosphere:This hotel seems to be popular with overseas school groups, so be aware of the possibilities of noise from adjoining rooms or floors. The doors also slam easily so this may wake you up early or during the night. You may have to wait a bit for the bathrooms during peak times, as there are only two per floor. I suppose one could always venture up or down one floor though. BreakfastThere is free breakfast in the morning from 8-11, but this was too late for me. I would suggest they do something to start it a bit earlier.Overall, convenient location and inexpensive for NYC.

Everything was all good, we possibly just didn't see the note that the bathroom would be down the hall lol (pack your shower shoes and all of the stuff to prep in a public bathroom) :-)All in all, all was well for the cost and location.

Couldn't believe we found a hotel at this price. The room was clean and had the necessary supplies. If you want a Marriott experience go to the Marriott this won't be for you. For the money this was a bargain. I look forward to returning when we visit again.

This hotel is just the basics. You don't even have your own restroom. There are communal bathrooms on each floor, which are not kept up very well. The showers spew water all over the floor and the drains don't work well, so you are standing in a few inches of water by the time you are finished showering. There are pipes in each room that rattle, and the cable tv doesn't even work. Beds are very hard. Only stay here if you plan on spending every waking moment elsewhere

As a budget hotel, this place was neat clean and very functional. The rooms were very small (hardly space to walk, but then why would you?), and clean and were cleaned daily. The microwave is available and is down by the hallway next to where you can get drinking water from. Buses are available at 106th and the subway at 110. Buses are great to travel to Columbia University and to places beyond. And then New York is a place to walk, so enjoy long walks to Central Park, the riverside park and the morningside park...Breakfast is free for all, and is coffee, fruit and muffin. Daily. Considering that you are living on the 107th it is a great deal. . Overall, a very satisfying stay, though I am hoping that the front desk becomes more guest friendly over a period of time. For someone coming to the hotel the first time, I felt unwanted.

This was our worst decision ever! We booked 10 days in Morningside Inn and we arrieved at 10 p.m. The woman at the front desk asked us for the payment of the room and we paid for the whole stay before seeing the room (BIG MISTAKE!) when we arrieved to the room it was stinky and totally different from the pictures they have on the internet. The sheets were dirty (see the pictures). The morning after, we tried to talk with the manager (Patrick) but he said he did not believe that the woman didn’t show us the room. So he called her to check it, the woman lied and I, suprised, started to tell him that it was true but he became very rude with me and started to call me NASTY. HOW COME YOU CALL NASTY TO A CUSTOMER THAT SPENDS HIS MONEY IN YOUR HOTEL?!Take my advice and DON’T GO! There are millions of hotels in New York with awesome and polite staff.

The room was basic but comfortable. The bed was also very comfortable and the bed linen clean and fresh. The showering facilities were excellent with plenty of towels, soap etc. The small fridge was extremely useful and much appreciated. Members of staff were courteous and helpful at all times. A wardrobe for hanging shirts, coats etc would have been useful. If I visit New York again in the future I will certainly stay there.Val.

The hotel is very nice staff is welcoming location can not be beaten stayed here visiting new york from texas and am very impressed with how easy it it to get to the subway and and get around Manhattan also the things around the hotel are great good food good restaurants 5 mins from the Seinfeld diner its the best location around for what you pay had a great time beds are comfy shower nice and hot nice ild style pre war feeling Amber Gonzales

Me and my girlfriend stayed here last summer for 5 days, the one thing we could not fault was the location, its a great area with lots going on and the Irish pub around the corner was brilliant. We did have some problems with our neighbours who were very loud all night drinking with loud music, the walls are very thin so we did not sleep at all. After complaining about this twice during the night nothing was done. The receptionist in the morning was a lot more helpful and put us in a new room which was great and peaceful after a busy day/night in New York! If you are like us and just want a clean room with all the basics you need to crash at the evening then for the price it is perfect, close to the subway and shops and the majority of staff were very nice. Just cross your fingers you have nice neighbours because those walls are very thin!

Like a lot of people on here, I was pretty nervous about this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews but booked it anyway because of the near-unbeatable price. I consider myself to be a pretty practical person and don't have super high standards when it comes to hotels. My friends and I were pretty much just after a place to sleep and thats what we got.We chose the 'shared bathroom' rooms. Our rooms were very basic but clean and spacious enough (although that could be because we had 3 person rooms for 2 people). The beds aren't all that comfortable but they replaced our pillows with nice new squishy ones a couple of days in and that hugely improved the situation. The rooms have TVs in them with cable which is good.The shared bathrooms were pretty average, definitely recommend wearing thongs in the shower. Some friends said the hot water would run out at 'peak' periods but we never had an issue. The hotel has several free wifi signals, some of which seem to work better than others. It would mostly work well but occaisionally it was slow or difficult to get connected.Despite being quite far uptown, the location of the hotel is actually fairly good. It is just off Broadway (not the theatre part, obviously) which has a good selection of restaurants, fast food shops, a Starbucks and grocery stores. There is also a really good (maybe famous?) bagel shop very close by on Broadway which we got breakfast from a lot. There are a couple of Subway stations close by (the 1 or C trains) which allows you to get downtown (or wherever else you might want to go) easily. There are lots of laundromats nearby as well which was very convenient.For anyone wondering (like I was) we booked with Agoda and didn't have an issue with our booking.Overall we were satisfied with this hotel. If you're not fussy and mostly just want a decent place to sleep and shower, this hotel could definitely be for you.

My partner and myself arrived on the 11th of December 2015, after a long day of travelling we arrived at the hotel only to find that the hotel had no record of our reservation. After presenting the receptionist with an itinerary and proof of booking, she was helpful and put us in an empty room over night. The next morning we returned to the reception desk and the matter has been resolved overnight. (The booking had been placed with a spelling mistake by the travel agents.)We were moved to another room on the 6th floor immediately. The rooms are very clean yet basic; personally I'd say it's ideal for a cheap city break as long as you're not expecting anything special. It had all we needed and did the job as we were out the whole day. The (shared) bathrooms were clean but slightly outdated and needed a bit of work.However, this would not stop me from staying there again. Both bedrooms and bathrooms were cleaned everyday. We checked out on the 16th of December by 11am, our flight was not until late at night. The receptionist gave us a key to a luggage holding room downstairs where we stored out cases while we spent the last day exploring. Overall we had an enjoyable stay and would recommend it to anyone trying to visit New York on a budget! You get what you pay for..

We needed a place to stay for one night because we had reservations closer to Times square but it did not include our first night in the city. It was reasonably priced online and the pics looked ok. We are pretty modest people and don't need a fancy place nor do I generally write bad reviews. But be warned.This was a terrible place to stay and was not worth the price we paid. It really looked, smelled and felt like a homeless/drug shelter. I could write about how terrible everything was but not enough space. Don't be fooled by the price or the pics.

I was going to give this place the benefit of the doubt. We stayed for 3 nights and it's basic, cheap and has the feel of a hostel about it. The rooms are small clean and sparse. The thing that really turned me cold was the constant door banging and screaming and shouting. On the final night at 6.40am some woman screamed like she'd walked in on a murder scene. I've heard screams in horror movies but this was really frightening. That kinda put the final gloss on things. Oh the single ply Toilet paper in the on suite was a nice touch.

I recently spent one night in this hotel: the location is convenient : 5 min walk from Cathedral hill subway and less than 10 min walk to Central Park ( N-W corner); there are shops and various restaurants in the area and it is a pleasant neighbourhood.The hotel building is old but clean. The room I was in was small but fine. The only downside was that I had to share the bathroom. One positive aspect is that there is a small kitchen that one can use. It is a good choice for traveling on a budget. I would probably go back.

Disappointed when the private bathroom I reserved was not available when I arrived. I ended up sharing a bath, but it was a minor inconvenience, and the price was changed accordingly. Room was clean and quiet, shower hot, staff friendly. A step above a hostel, with a fantastic location.

Let me start out by saying I don't usually write negative reviews of budget hotels -- I know you can't expect fancy amenities or super service. But you do expect the fixtures to be maintained and the place to meet a minimum standard. I'm sorry to say the Morningside Inn did not live up to even low expectations. The toilet was clogged when I arrived (late in the evening) and rather than call for maintenance and wait, I just used the plunger to fix it....but I really shouldn't have had to do that! The room should have been inspected and the problem caught before I arrived. Also, the toothbrush holder was falling off the wall, the faucets at the sink were loose, the blinds were broken, the carpet was ancient, worn, and dingy, and the radiator made the room too hot but there was no thermostat to turn it down. The ancient pipes made a banging noise, too.While I'm complaining (and really, I don't usually complain very much....just read my other reviews, which are mostly very positive!), I will add that there was no bedside lamp in this dark room. While there was room for a small nightstand and a lamp between the two beds in the room, there was just empty space -- and the nightstand with a lamp, and a lampshade still wrapped in plastic -- was on the opposite wall.Oh yes, and the wifi worked only sporadically. It kept going down to such low strength that it was unusable.On the plus side (since I always want to be fair to places like this), the inn is in a quiet but interesting Upper West Side neighborhood, 3 blocks from the 110th St subway, and if you don't spend much time in the room and you get it at a good price, it would be a good place to stay, IF some basic repairs, maintenance, and sprucing up could be done. And definitely get rid of that horrible old carpet!

Great location. Room size is not too bad. We had our own bathroom so things were good there too. However the staff are not the friendliest. If they're so miserable then they shouldn't be working there. Customer service is everything!! Their wifi connection is not always the best, and it's bad enough their towels are so tiny, you only get one per person. Apart from that. It really is ok. I could even recommend and maybe come back someday

I would never, recommend this facilty to anyone. My experience was horrible. The service was awful. The room did not have sufficient towels, the shower was leaking on the floor. The shower valve was broken, the bathroom did not have a supply of toilet paper...overall, terrible. My worst experience ever!!!

We stayed here for a couple of nights over the weekend. The outside and hall is clean and "hotel like", we were very surprised. The room was also unexpectedly clean and tidy. Considering the little amount we paid we were not expecting anything fantastic but the bathrooms were just disgusting and nothing can justify that! There are 2 shared bathrooms on every floor which is fine with us, but people are just disrespectful and dirty. After a shower you felt like you needed another one. Besides that, the hotel is very close to Times Square (10 minutes on the subway) and there is a great diner a couple of blocks down on Broadway for breakfast. We'd probably stay again but no shared bathroom this time!!

Hotel was very basic, but clean and tidy. And rooms we're good size. We we're located on ground floor so was quite noisy so i would suggest to request an upstairs room. Location was good about a $10 cab far into times square.

We booked the hotel through hotwire for three adults and a child for two nights. To start with, the hotel had no place to sit not even a chair near the front desk. We got the keys and were shocked to see there was no bathroom inside the room,only a shared one located outside the room. We were totally unaware of this even after booking. The room was very small for three people and suffocating amd no mobile signal. We called up the front desk to ask for a room with private bathroom and they charged 130$ extra in addition to the 200$. Now coming to this room, the door had no proper lock. Even this room was very small, just a TV and a small fridge,no microwave. The beds were very hard. There was a phone but no connection. It was not fixed even after reporting. There was a bedside lamp with no bulb. The bathtub was small with no proper shower. The knob fell off the first time we turned it and had to take bath in cold water since it wouldn't fix properly. We somehow worked upon that but the water was either very hot or very cold. The second night after 2am, we heard rattling sound from the pipe inside the room and was very hot when we touched it. We had to be very careful since we had a baby. Did not expect such a worst stay and very bad deal from hotwire.

The room was honestly pretty clean and was of average size. The only downside was the shared bathroom but it really didn't bother me all that much. Hotel is in a great location within walking distance to Central Park or Morningside Park. For the price this is a great deal.

Room size was decent for the rate paid however there were hot water pipes in the room that burned you if you touched them and made the room unbearably hot. The bed had some sort of bugs in it as I woke up bitten all over my body in the morning. Thanks for that Morningside

Very very little room, very little bathroom without a door, old, not very clean, we could hear to much sound from the neighbor's quarrels in the night, extremely noisy water pipes when other guests were bathing, also in the middle of the night. We will choose another place next time. We were there 6 days, oct. 2015

The room was clean. The hotel is very close to subway access to get to the city. It was small, but enough for when you come tired from th city. Staff is very very friendly. Quiet to sleep at night. I would recommend it for a night or two.

Well, let's start with the good things about it: 1. Location. Very nice area on the upper west side of Manhattan. Lots of restaurants, pubs, coffee shops close by. We walked around late at night and didn't feel unsafe. 2. Close to public transit: bus stop is within a 2-minute walk and subway a 5-min walk. 3. Bedroom is clean, sheets and towels smell nice and the cable works well. Shower has great water pressure, bathroom was clean as well.4. There is a fully equipped kitchen for guests' use. So if you're on a budget, you can buy frozen food or whatever and cook there. Now for the bad things about... 1. Rude staff: I never had such a bad first impression of a hotel before. We got there and without even greeting us, the gentleman at the counter asked for our reservation number. We gave him. He said "your room is not ready, come back in 15 minutes." And that was that. My husband and I were looking at each other, baffled, not knowing how to handle such unfriendliness. We left, and came back 40 minutes later. Our room was ready, but the staff (a different person) was unfriendly and unhelpful once again. We only stayed there because it was a busy weekend in NYC (Pope visit and Global Citizen Festival) plus we'd driven around for 30 min trying to park... otherwise we would have left. 2. Noise!!!! If you enjoy sleeping past 8 am, find somewhere else to stay. You can hear people talking, laughing, "having fun" in the rooms surrounding yours; you can hear people's footsteps in the hallway and you can certainly hear the staff yelling at each other in Spanish! 3. Room was super small (the bathroom sink was right beside the bed, IN the bedroom) and furniture was outdated; no mirrors, no closet. 4. No parking (there is, however, a parking garage on the same street for $25/day or on the next street north for $20/day)5. No breakfast or room service (not a big deal to us, as there are SO many options just down the street, but if you're super tired and don't want to change from your pj's you're out of luck).

Myself and 2 other friends stayed here after finishing our work as camp counsellors over the summer in the states. Being students we weren't wanting to spend most of our wages on a hotel so for the price that we paid, we didn't expect much. However, the staff were friendly and the room was exactly what we expected. Cleaned everyday with fresh towels and bed sheets. Room was small but had a fridge and the TV had plenty of channels including British sport to watch.The area was fine with no bother at all. It is quite northern compared to Times Square but it is only a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest subway station in either direction and plenty of food such as McDonalds and Dominos to eat. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone with the same expectations.

We visited USA in July 2015, and booked 6 nights at Morningside Inn hotel, it is Bed only, it is clean and OK for travelers who wish to explore NY. Hot showers and clean rooms, most of the bathrooms are for share! if you wish to cook for your self, the kitchen is there for you! restaurants are near by for breakfast ect... I like it and will stay there again.

I came across Morningside Inn as me and a friend were visiting New York for a week and we needed somewhere fairly cheap to stay but still wanted to be in Manhattan. This hotel/hostel isn't as close to Times Square as we'd like but it's not too far! There are plenty of subways nearby which makes this place easy to travel from. The hotel it's self done just the job for me but I don't think some people would be impressed. I wouldn't say there's anything majorly wrong with this place but the interior is a bit worn and old. My worn and old I just mean small things which most likely wouldn't bother people (including myself) like a lot of loses screws in door latches, ceiling fans, towel rails ect. If you touch something there's a good chance is going to move or seem like you're about to break something for good. The only other down I can put on this place which again is only a small one is that the toilet roll didn't seem to be changed on a regular basis, at times you'd have to walk from bathroom to bathroom looking for the one with paper left.Ok so that's the downs of this place, let's talk about the good parts. The staff were very helpful and friendly, always someone at the main desk no matter what time. Like I said earlier, not a bad location for your money and close to the subway which is only a 5 minute train journey to Times Square. The rooms are basic but they are clean and are all fitting with ceiling fans and air con with was great after coming back from a hot day outside. Really don't know what else to say about this place, it has no great features or a wow factor but at the same time only has minor flaws. If you're looking for somewhere to get your head down and want a cheap price in a convenient location this is your place, if you're looking for something more flashy with a fresh feel then probably not..Really is a good average.

We visited this hotel on our holiday summer 2015. After first night my husband was bited by bedbugs so our holiday was for him very painful and itching. No use to go this place! Cheap but no good! We change room but same thing again.

If you like rats running just in front of the main entrance, smelly filthy claustrophobic tiny rooms, used stinky sheets on bed, and gross carpet and blankets, then this is the perfect place for you. If not - just run as far as you can to another location.

Perfect value for money in Upper West Side Manhattan (though closer to Harlem). The onle serious drawback - they failed to find my booking made through budgetplaces.com, and we spent the first night in the available room (it was of higher category though). In the morning we were transferred to the booked room, thanks a lot it was available, as a lady at the reception was not sure it would be. Tidy linen and towels, no smell, relatively tidy bathrooms - as good as it gets for $80 per night for a double with shared bathroom.

The Morningside Inn is one of the cheapest hotel in NY and this is exactly what you get. The room what small and worn but the bed sheets and towels were clean. The location is very convenient and quiet. The staff was rather unfriendly but competent.

The entrance is nice, but as soon as you step in you see dirt everywhere. The building was filthy beyond imagination, dismal, and the room not at all like the pictures shown on the website. We stayed one night out of the six planned because we thought we had already paid it, but then we found out that the 125 dollars we had paid Budgetplaces were just for the reservation, not for the night, so we had to pay 132 dollars extra!

We came for a short visit to NYC, just 3 nights. Morningside inn did the job perfectly. We rate it 3*- one for great location, one for fantastic comfy bed (rock hard!), one for friendly and helpful service. It's very basic, shared bathroom (it has seen better times too and could do with some fresh paint), unreliable hot water, shower handle fell off when in use, internet signal very poor and slow speed. Overall ok, well priced city option.

We booked a 4-day stay at the Morningside Inn in late May-early June 2015 because of convenience for a college reunion celebration. We were shown a first floor room which was Spartan but clean. The first 2 days went smoothly but on the third day we woke up to cold water in the shower -- a boiler failure we were told. The hot water was restored late in the day but our schedule for the day and evening was full. Because the hot water was restored late in the day, we did not request moving to another hotel. Nevetheless, on the 4th morning, the boiler failed again and there was no hot water. On checking out we requested an adjustment in our charges and were told this would be referred to the hotel's ownership. Repeated calls and emails about being compensated for the lack of hot water went unanswered. Message: if you have a problem with the accommodation, don't expect the hotel's management to accommodate you!

When I saw the star rating of the Morningside Inn and the price I thought I would be staying in an ok place but the truth is far from that. The fan and air conditioning did not work resulting in a uncomfortable sleep for all the nights. The wifi also did not work forcing me to go on a hunt to find the nearest free wifi. There is a dirty shared bathroom and the towels were ripped. Tiny room and bed. Small elevator making it hard for us to take our luggage up. Lower the prices in future. Never coming back.

This is a basic, no frills or amenities place. Room had 2 double beds, dresser, TV, one bedside table with lamp, a/c and a private bath. EXTREMELY CLEAN which was my top priority. It suited the purpose of this trip perfectly and was walking distance to where I needed to be daily. Neighborhood feel. Local restaurants and markets are great, especially Absolute Bagel around the corner. I wouldn't choose this for a vacation but for a busy work trip it was fine.

Dont book a place in there! our room was 3x3 square meters literally! Queen bad, was for hobbits! Not enough long to keep whole legs on it! Shared bathroom wasnt cleaned even one single time, during our 4 days stay! Pubic hair all around bathtube, clossing the outflow and maks it fill with the water. wardrobe door had this big 2 inches hole in the middle. House keeping? They've never heard about something like that! One time when we came back to room, we realised that someone was messing in our stuff and using our perfums. Wi-fi only exists somewhere in the space, I mean there are two sources that u can try to connect but the stream is so weak makes it impossible to reach. Ive paid over 100 bucks/night, thats like a 95$ too much. Never recomend for anyone! Worst place Ive ever been in my life! Staff in front desk was nice and polite.

There are air conditions in the windows. You share an old bathroom with other people on your hallway. The fan in the room had no string for the light you have to unscrew the light manually to keep the fan on at night. It needs renovating. The elevator is not big enough to get in with your luggage for one trip up. Not for families with children. Maybe single couples would be fine with here.

Just returned from a 2 week stay at Morningside Inn (June 2015).This place is one of the cheapest hotels we could find in New York, in Manhattan.We booked a double bed with ensuite.Would definitely recommend this hotel for those on a budget. Yes, it is not the most modern, luxurious or fancy hotels in New York, but for those who are budget-conscious, and just want a decent bed for the night, that's clean, in a good location, this is perfectly fine.The location is great - a quick subway ride to all the main sites - and the hotel itself is very close to the 110 Street subway station on the 1 line.Supermarkets, shops, pharmacies, bagel shops and restaurants all very close to the hotel. The rooms are tiny, but I think this is normal for New York. We just unpacked all of our suitcases and hid them in the wardrobe to save space. Two of us in the room for 2 weeks was manageable really, so yes it's small but it's fine really. Bathroom also tiny, but has a working shower, toilet, sink. Had no problems with hot water (seen a few reviews where they had no hot water, but we never had this issue during our 2 week stay).Bedroom has air conditioning which was excellent, and a big fridge to store food in the room too. No kettle for making a hot drink, so I just bought tea from cafes instead.No hair dryer in the bedroom, luckily I brought my own. Also brought a few coat-hangers with me which was good because the wardrobe only had 3. Wifi was temperamental - some days wifi did not work, some days it worked perfectly fine. But everywhere in New York has free wifi so you won't be without. TV in room worked well. The towels were changed daily, bedsheets changed every few days - housekeeping made our room up every day. Rooms a bit shabby but clean overall. Reception staff were friendly enough - someone was always on the desk whenever we walked past reception.I did try and email hotel twice before arriving to confirm arrival time as I had made a mistake in my original booking. I also emailed to ask if they had hairdryers available - they didn't respond to any of my emails so maybe communication is a bit poor, so in the end I just bought my own hairdryer with me. Kitchen on every floor, but with no pots/pans is a bit useless - but we just ate out every day so didn't need to use it. We would stay again, it's cheap and in a great location in Manhattan, and worth the price you pay. Also there was no noise at all in the room. It's on a quiet street, couldn't hear a single noise whilst sleeping which was a nice surprise in NYC!

Stayed here for 4 nights while in New York as travellers. Initially concerned as receptionist couldn't find our booking (made around 1 month ago through a 3rd party site) however booked us in (and as 2 friends travelling together gave us a twin room rather than the cheaper double that we had booked). Checked with reception the next morning and they had sorted everything out. Older building with narrow corridors but had a lift to 4th floor which was good. Clean linen and towels. Creaky beds but comfortable. Air-conditioning was good (but room also had fans). Shared bathrooms which rarely had to wait for. Bathrooms a little run down but hot showers and good water pressure. Surprisingly quiet. Very good location to 2 different subway lines into Lower Manhattan. Very close to both Hudson river park area and Central Park. Great place for breakfast close by (on about W 101st).

I was referred to this hotel by a friend who stayed for 3 months while getting integrated to NYC, so I stayed for one month while I searched for an apartment in the City. It's located in a GREAT location on the UWS of NYC, close to shops, restaurants and just a short walk to either Riverside Park or Central Park! I felt completely safe during my stay - had enough baggage to fill the room since I was moving back to the City, and I was never worried about any of it being in the room whenever I was out of the room. The room was always kept clean by the hotel staff as well, so overall, it was a great experience!I've recommended the hotel to a friend who is staying there now with a couple of other friends and I have full confidence that they'll have such an enjoyable and wonderful time visiting the City knowing that they're in a safe, clean and hospitable hotel! I can only highly recommend it - it's a great value for the price!!

We knew we could not expect much for this price, but even then it was very disappointing. Everything was just old, dirty and decrepit. Airconditioning did not work, making the room very hot at night. Wifi did not work either. The shared bathroom was very dirty. Towels and bed sheets had holes in them. It is just a very dirty and depressing place.

- Stayed 21 days, only ONE day there was WiFi in my room. I noticed others standing near the front desk and using WiFi. Huge inconvenience for me as I had to go to Starbucks everyday.-could not change it as it was NOT refundable.- 3 days no hot water-everyday from at about 11 AM towels are taken and returned at about 3 PM after cleaning. A hostel not a hotel, no bathroom in the room. Substandard quality moved to a different hotel the next morning, since I had arrived too late in the evening to go to a different place. They are to reimburse me for the nights I did not use. Have not heard back anything yet

Felt like a mix between a hotel and hostel with shared bathroom and separate bedroom. The bedroom environment felt like a hostel. The bed was not very comfortable, but the room was decent size for a hostel (and small for a hotel). The Budgetplaces.com website charges a separate fee (~$50 extra) from what is listed on the website as the price to stay here.

who is writing the reviews of this hotel ? my daughter and son - in - law live in new york city and i visit them once or twice a year for 7-10 days at a time.hands down ,this place is great ! staff is friendly, rooms are clean, location could not possibly be better.those people who gave this hotel a poor review should get out of their room and see the city.

This place is clearly a hostel NOT a hotel. The place is a dump. I had a room with two lumpy beds (one double, one twin) with barely more than 18 inches between the beds. The furniture looked like it was picked up at a garage sale or from a NYC curb. The AC Window unit was the smallest I had ever seen - about 12 inches and only worked intermittently. Also intermittent WI-FI. Finnaly, and worst of all, there was NO HOT WATER for morning showers. I should have been suspicious about the water situation when I checked in. I stayed on the 3rd floor and decided to walk down the stairs - and I noticed a signn on the floor below me that said because of a problem with the boiler there would be no hot water until Noon on Friday. Well, since I checked in on Friday afternoon, I assumed the problem was fixed. When getting ready for bed that night, I only used cold water to wash at sink and brush my teeth. The next morning, when attempting to take a shower there was no hot water. I called the desk at 8:00 AM and the person said U.S., they knew about the problem and that they had a call in to the boiler company to fix the problem. They didn't know when the problem would be fixed. I checked out that morning!

I rarely post any review for hotel because this is my fist poor and terrible experience with any Hotel in USA, So writing my review to beware others. I was planning for trip to New York with my family and was looking for a budget hotel. I found this hotel and despite of it negative reviews, I decided to give it a try.I got a free room upgradation from shared restroom to attached restroom, but overall all the rooms has a very bad smell and you will feel very uneasy from the moment you’re in the rooms. He told me the other room I booked has already been checked out by someone , it was hilarious as that was on my wife name and we were together, moreover his attitude was too arrogant like rooms are for free.I completed my new York trip but this is the first time as I have such terrible experience where I have to waste my one day, thinking that I might end up paying twice. But thanks to hotel.com , who sorted my case.My suggestion is avoid this hotel as you never know what might be waiting for you !!!!!

Room small, bathroom ok, cleaness ok.Promised internet, and in 4 days I never had internet. They said they would repair, but nothing. After complaining to the manager, i exchanged shouts face to face with him. Really a forgatable experience. You can use better than this Hotel !!!!!!!!!!

We booked the Morningside Inn as it was somewhat cheaper that the downtown accommodation, but this turned out to be a huge mistake. The hotel was a considerable distance from all the main New York attractions, and any savings made in the cost of the room were swallowed up by the cost of transportation.The neighbourhood (a Mexican Spanish speaking neighbourhood) itself is quite interesting, but it was two or three days before we felt entirely comfortable to walk about and make the short trip to the nearest Subway station at Cathedral Parkway, on Broadway between W 109th and W 110th Streets. The hotel itself is on W 107th, a pleasant street, and is flanked on one side by a very impressive church and on the other by a building housing a project for unemployed people. The facade of the hotel is nice, with an inviting lobby. Unfortunately the rooms were something else...The upper floors are accessed by a small elevator, or by a winding marble staircase (not as impressive as it sounds!). We had a room with en-suite facilities, but there are many shared bathroom, toilet and cooking facilities on all floors. Our room was averaged-sized, with two comfortable double beds. The decor was quite shabby, especially the carpet, and the furniture looked as though it had been purchased from a second-hand store or a charity shop. Some handles were broken or missing, and the bedside cabinet had a wooden wedge placed underneath it to stop the drawer falling open of it's own accord. The bathroom was horrible, with a grimy-looking suite and mould around the edge of the bath and showerThere is a metal heating pipe running the height of the building at the front, and where it entered our room through the floorboards there was a small gap in the floor. It wasn't until our final night that we realised that this was where the mouse (or mice) had been getting into our room at night. A hole had been gnawed through my bag in the search for food! If I had known about the rodent problem before the last night, I would not have been comfortable staying there, despite being an animal lover!When we checked out the next morning, I of course mentioned the presence of our nocturnal visitor to the receptionist, but this was met with nothing more than a shrug of the shoulders and a tilt of the head. Generally though, the staff were friendly enough, but don't expect English to always be spoken as a first language. We accepted the offer to arrange our transportation back to the airport, but this turned out to be provided by what I assume to be a family or business associate who charged more than the set Yellow Cab rate. Overall, we will not be returning. The hotel is cheap, but that's exactly what you get. Too far uptown for the main sights of Manhattan, but if Mexican social culture is your thing, then this neighbourhood may be a way of living the "real" New York experience.

Booked room for 3 weeks but had to cancel due to emergency. It was a nightmare to get the refund and the manager on duty by the name of PATRICK was a raving lunatic. He definitely has ZERO clue what customer service entails. Having a conversation with him was absolutely impossible. Same token, her front desk staff by the name Cynthia was equally unschooled in the art of customer service. I would NEVER recommend anyone to book that hotel. Thanks to Travelocity and Expedia for their efforts in facilitating a refund.

My friend and I were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. This is a very quaint place. We paid for the budget double and Patrick upgraded to a room w/a view and a private bathroom. The room was very clean and I will def recommend MI to friends/family.

I should have known something was amiss when I was given the opportunity to "check out" the room before I paid for it. I did not appreciate what it means to check out a hotel room at that time - I do now. I opened the door to the hallway and suddenly realized that I should have had some Febreeze. The sour smell of carpet which had been wet and not dry cleaned was apparent. I should have known something was amiss. But I simply poked my head into the room, saw two beds with clean white linen and said "thank you" for the attendant who checked me in. I did not stay very long because I was meeting some friends who happened to be in town from across the country.I returned later and turned on the room light on the wall. The light came on but so did the fan. I tried to turn off the light but keep on the fan. No such luck (initially anyway). I saw a remote control on the wall and decided to play with it. It turned off the light and the fan. I kept clicking until the light went off and the fan stayed on. Thinking I had achieved my objective, I laid in the bed and went to sleep. I woke up later that night and the fan was not longer on. I turned it on again and went back to sleep. I awoke an hour later and it was off again. Playing cat and mouse with the remote, I decided to let it be. I was tired. Around 3:55 am, I heard two people arguing. They were so loud I thought they were standing outside my door. I never heard the staff intercede.I woke up the next morning and decided to shower. I have never been inside a bathtub quite like the one in my room. It was about three feet long and two feet wide. I laughed out loud. It looked like a white bassinet glued to the ground. I then put my back against the wall and extended my leg. It touched the other wall. I am 5'7". In addition to the micro bathtub, the bathroom had a commode. There were no towel racks and no mirror or sink. The sink was in the main room. To use it, I had to sit on the edge of the bed. The cabinet doors did not shut and they had no handles. As I stepped into the micro bathtub, I turned around and there it was. A window into the shower area. No curtain or covering lie between my naked body and the four windows from the adjacent building. I finished showering, stepped out to get my cellphone, and took two photos. I have added them to this review.Before I left that morning, an employee asked me to give her my dirty towels. I did so. As I left the room, I noticed that the door did not close properly. I had to lock the door from the inside. I had not seen a lock with a "push button" in more 35 years. I had been transported back to the 1960s. When I returned to my room, I noticed that two washcloths and two bath towels had been placed into my room. But otherwise, my room looked the same. The bed was unmade and it appeared that no one had been inside. I thought about what kind of "housekeeping tip" I would leave upon checkout. The outside temperature dipped to 47 degrees. I looked for some heat. I saw what appeared to be an accordion style heater along the far wall. It was half the size of a regular bed pillow. I then realized there was no air conditioner at all. The heater is controlled by management. I had no option but to sleep in the cold room. I pulled the blanket off the second bed. My feet were still cold. I had to put on a set of socks. Finally, a word on the wifi. It never worked. I laughed at my naivete. I think they owe me for staying at the place. There is absolutely no threat of me staying there again. If you want some place to stay in NYC, try somewhere else. This hotel should be embarrassed to call itself a hotel. It is a low scale hostel.

My room was very nice. The linens were clean everything else was also clean. It had a cute little TV. Overall I really liked my room and was surprised because I expected it to be unkempt. The only thing I didn't like was that I didn't get my own shower and toilet, but other than that it was a nice stay.

The Morningside Inn is a well organized hostel with friendly staff. The rooms are ok and there is even a kitchenette. The shared bathrooms are impractical, but quite clean. Bus and metro will get you downtown easily.

I had made the reservation for two ppl with shared bathroom, but the day we arrived a friend joined us and they gave us a double bed room with private bathroom even though they were "full". The woman at the front desk was very very helpful and nice.The room was very clean, enough towels and soap :)We didn't had wifi at the room, we had to get outside the room stay at the hall.

What a horrifying 'hotel'!! This not a hotel but a hostel, they advertised it as a hotel. Rude and unprofessional staff including the 'manager Trevor'. Take a course in customer service for you and your staff and dress and speak properly to your guests. And as you can see, I write my review. Your threats dont work. Pubic hair in the shared bathroom, no soap, no toiletpaper. We stayed 3 nights here and I believe they only cleaned it once. Stains and hair on sheets and pillow. There is only the smell of food and weed in the hallways. Wifi barely works. No mirror in the room, no place to store your luggage. The rooms are way too small. This was just overall a gross place to stay and definately not worth your money. Will never ever come back to this filthy place and wont advice this hostel to any of my friends nor family.

Reasonably priced double room with shared bathroom and toilet. The room was very clean. Comparing the prices of the private rooms in other places in Manhattan this was a very good deal. It had a fridge, sink, cable TV, double bed and enough storage for clothes. Had no problem with the staff.The only issue which i had was the internet. It is extremely slow on some floors.

where to start? they don't live up to half of the things they promised, the rooms are awfully small, the bathroom makes noises and the walls are so paper thin that you can actually hear the conversation in the other room. as soon as someone walks pass you door then you'll hear everything. the coffeemaker and microwave and all the other utilities that were promised in the room didn't exist.

We arrived a few hours earlier than the check in time. The front desk guy let us store our luggage in the storage room, while me and my girlfriend explored the city! The room was bigger and better than we expected. The subway is walking distance from this hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here, this will be my go to spot whenever im in New York.

The location is great, and for that price we didn't exactly expect gold and marble. But we did expect a decent place to sleep, but unfortunately we didn't get this. The walls are thin as paper, and every sound from showers or other rooms spread between the rooms. And the heating system has a serious problem making sharp hissing sounds from time to time. After complaining we got to change rooms, but the problem remained in the new room.

Ok...everything clean and tidy. The hostel is cheap and value for money. All my belongings were safe and I felt ok staying here. The hostel is close to everything you need and I found the area to be safe. My only problem was the staff...now this wasn't the manager but one young girl in particular...young lady...I pay your wages and I work hard. Just because I came to stay here doesn't mean I cannot afford to stay in a hotel somewhere a little up market. She was rude and didn't want to help. My first time in nyc and I didn't feel comfortable asking her anything. The only words she muttered to me were "what's your name". That is it! Other than that...no worries.

Good location near public transport, only 15 mins into times square on the train. Lots of cool affordable restaurants around morningside and amazing begel shop on the corner prefect for breakfast quick stop!!

It's a hostel so we didn't expect luxury by any means. The rooms are super basic but could not fault the cleanliness and nice and warm even when it's freezing outside. We were pleasantly surprised and were not there much as so much to see and do so was plenty good enough for our needs.A few mins walk to the nearest subway with a direct line on about 20 mins to Time Square so a little out the way but if you want to be closer in you have to spend 4 times the price, your choice!

Having read the numerous terrible reviews on here, but having a non refundable reservation we were very sceptical and worried about two main things that popped on previous reviews:A) Our room being given way,B) Bed BugsWe arrived at the hotel around 4pm - the hotel had our names on the system and the room was ready - just a matter of picking up keys and paying the rest of the amount. Receptionist gave us our keys, let us take our things up and check everything over before we had to come down and settle the balance. The bed bugs reviews made us take a couple of our own blankets, just ones to put down on the bed before we went sleep (airline ones will do) - but room was cleaned, bed was made and towels changed every day.Sheets did have stains on them so they look like they dont get washed a lot - but we had our own blankets so not too bothered - this was the only negative.Great location, Number 1 subway is at 103rd street (4 blocks South) or 110th Street (3 blocks North), only a 5 minute walk from the Hotel. There is a 24 hour McDonalds, KFC, Chipotle and Five Guys, and Absolute Bagels (supposedly one of the best in NYC) only 5 minute walk away. Subway is only 10-15 minutes to Times SquareOur room had a private bathroom - Hot water was fine, no problems at all. Kept clean and basic. There were 2 shared bathrooms on our floor - I assume they were just the same.There was always someone at the reception to ask any questions - let us use the luggage store once we checked out before we needed to leave for our flight. There is free parking on the street if you plan to have a car for any duration of your trip. All in all, we had low expectations from reading reviews but we found this place to be pleasant and exactly what we needed - a cheap place in a good location. Great value for money in an otherwise very expensive city. Would definitely stay here again. Don't expect something unreasonable from such a cheap place and you won't be disappointed!

worst Hotel in my life,in europe you wouldnt get a Hotel like this for 10 bucks a night.but someone told me thats ok for new York.so would i recommend it? no! did i found something better for that Price.unfortunately no either

The manager was the rudest person on earth and yelled at me bathrooms were not clean and showers were broken. Really unpleasant stay which is a real shame for such a beautiful city.I think better places can be found, as affordable and more polite.

Considering as hostel, the room and shared bathroom it were cleaned all mornings. The staff was very polite and available 24 hours. There are one market and subway station close to hostel. There no hair dryer in the room, but just ask the staff and get just to use.

After checking all budget hotels this one was had good location and affordable price. One bedroom room was ok no TV or private bathroom. The bathroom was shared next to the room. Overall solid budget hotel in NY, subway is 5 min away and you will reach downtown in 15 minutes. If you are on budget and looking a place just to sleep in this one is for you.

we stayed on the rooms with private bathroom.its was clean and comfy.but in the morning....we can hear the people coming talking by the elevator/lobby.maybe next stay we will request a room far away from lobby.

As I arrived at the entrance of the Morningside inn, I thought, this looks very basic, but clean and welcoming. There is a kitchen on every floor, however the noise from the kitchen woke me up a few times. Shower worked well. Flat screen HD TV. Fridge was useful. Bed was very comfortable. Really nice area. Subway is 7-10 mins walk. Staff were friendly and allowed me to shower after I did the New York marathon (even though I had checked out). They also recommended a diner 'The Manchester Diner' a couple of blocks away. The food was great, staff great would recommend it. Overall the room was Basic, clean, good location, great base to crash at. If I ever go back to New York, I would use this Hotel again.

The room was clean. The image shows 2 bedside lamps. There were none. The Room amenities boasts tea and coffee making facilitioes. There were none. You can heat your drink if you have a cup- in the microwave. There is a kitchen on every floor. There was no drain plug for basin or bath. Shower worked well. TV was great- HD channels.Fridge was useful. Plenty of closet/drawer storage. Bed was comfortable. NO AC. Overall it was ok. The area was pleasant residential- lots of local shops. Subway is 7-10 mins walk .

Entering the lobby of the Morningside inn, my first thought was "this looks good" I was given my room key and told to go and check room before I paid. The lift is a bit noisy, but works fine. Opened door to my room to be greeted by a double bed, small fridge on floor (did not use) small sink in corner and draws & wardrobe. On the whole basic but adequate. The bed was made every day and changed once during the week. The bathroom was right next to my room (408) and I could hear the shower and toilet flushing (nothing else). Found a really nice diner a couple of blocks away "The Manchester Diner" food was great, staff great would recommend it. As for Morningside Inn, the old saying "you get what you pay for" is true. Basic, clean, good location, great base to crash at. If I ever go back to New York, I would use this Hotel again.

The Morningside Inn at Upper West town has a good location. With the Subway nr.1 it is easy to get to the central parc, times square and south ferry. unfortunately no cooking facilites as promised.neat

I have heard of bad deals and had a few over the years. I am sitting on the bed at Morningside as I write- on the bed as there is no chair in the room. there are no hangers, no lamps, no drinking glass.The bathroom down the hall has a shower, sink and toilet and is reasonably clean. but we haven't been able to use it because it is night and over 20 other people also want to shower, use the toilet and brush their teeth before bed, but only one person can use the bathroom at a time. Just got into the bathroom--the toilet was plugged; fortunately, there was a plunger next to it. I wonder why?!! Could this be a regular problem?!? AND we had booked 2 rooms, but only 1 couple got here early and paid; the other couple dropped off their bag and left, returning about 10. No room for them. No willingness to pay for a cab to another hotel. Simply told that they had overbooked so the room was given to the first person who came in and paid! Do not come here unless you don't mind being without a room or a bathroom or any basic necessity like a drinking glass. The inn has wifi but it's locked and they didn't give us a password.

I had a very good experience during my stay there. I expected a clean place to rest and I got exactly what I was expecting. Everything was fine.I booked through Agoda and 3 days before my arrival I called the hotel to confirm my booking and they didn't get it, but they told me not to worry about that just to call Agoda and they will solve that. I called Agoda and everything got solved. I do recommend to confirm your booking before.

Walked in to check in, the lady at the desk didn't even acknowledge us and when we got up to our room it had a horrible smell, the lights in the bathroom didn't even exist and when we asked for it to get fixed, they said it would be done straight away but it hasn't. So we have had cold showers in the dark, and have paid $700 for a 4 night stay in a room the size of a shoebox. I don't recommend!

I still don t know where they have the pictures from their room.The hotel is very simple and they DON'T offer breakfast!! It is closed to Broadway and is quiet.Don t take the room next to the bathroom ..otherwise the guests may wake you up by shivering.The rooms and the beds are very old.

Together with my daughter I enjoyed our stay at the Morningside Inn. Located close to the central park en in a safe area, also at late evening hours. Although the rooms are very basic, the beds are perfect and the room was cleaned every day (with clean towels). The receptionists were kind and helpful.Our stay at the Morningside Inn contributed to an unforgettable first experience in the big Apple.

The position of this hotel close, to a subway, grocery store, bagel shop, pub and excellent Indian restaurant out weighs the disappointment of the room. There is no hot drink making facility, unless you count the communal microwave. Even then you have to go and buy a mug to make it in, not useful when arriving late at night, In fact if it could be removed from the room it did not exist! On the plus side, clean room,clean linen every day and plenty of hot water, so great place if you just shower and sleep.

I went to NY with my boyfriend and this was the best option to stay one night. It was really close to Central Park and it's really easy to get there by train... The service was really nice to us, the room is clean, and the [private] bathroom was good.

The initial sight of the reception area, a window on the side of a long, narrow, tatty, hallway was a bit off putting. I appreciate that having travelled from the UK and being rather tired did not help. It is an amaturish sort of set up, the two nights we were there we never saw the same person twice in reception, they looked to be a series of students making some cash in the holidays.The room, unce we had exited the small and very slow lift, was long and narrow too. So narrow that the door struck the end of the bed as we entered. The room too was tatty but the bed was comfortable and the room quiet, probably because we overlooked a well between the buildings.Otherwise no real complaints, slept well, not many facilities but we survived.

arrived at the Morningside Inn hotel at 2315 to be told my room had been given to someone else and that they had no more rooms left and that i could only check in the next day. I showed them my booking confirmation and proof of deposit payment to which they replied "we dont see a dollor of that deposit so its not our issue" I was left on the streets of NYC on my first night after a long flight from Europe.I was forced to pay $225 to stay in another hotel for one night. I returned to the morningside inn a day later requesting to speak with the manager but i was told everyday he was too busy. i emailed him directly about my experience but no response. absolutely shocking !!! A few nights later I witnessed a couple at reception at 2100 also being told the same thing. This place will give away your "confirmed" room to anyone off the street who arrives before you. What's worse is the manager doesn't even care to apologise!

The stay at Morningside Inn was absolutely fine.The room was clean, the other things as described.24 h help if needed.Plus an extra luggage room if you have to check out before your flight goes.Wifi could be a little more efficient.All in all: a nice stay at a great located place!

Stayed in the morningside for two nights. The room was not as shown in the pictures. The shared restroom stinked and was dirty most of the time. There was hair and used toilet paper everywhere. The shower didnt work properly as it had no cold water sometimes, even if you selected it and it was impossible to take a shower. Inside the room, the TV had only one channel functioning and no other channels were available. Even after complaining to the front desk nothing was done about it. The towels were very old and not good for guest use anymore. The door lock needs replacement as one had to struggle to remove the key from the lock after unlocking the door.

I booked a room with the morningside inn through agoda. I received a confirmation email but when I emailed the inn asking a question they had no record of my reservation. I was already in route when I get the email from morningside alerting me that they did not have my reservation and thus had no room for me. The clerk at morningside was somewhat helpful but I was forced to find a new room on my own from LaGuardia airport. I strongly recommend not booking a room through agoda, but if you do confirm with the actual hotel. Agoda has terrible customer service and if your reservation falls through you are on your own.

This hotel is basic, you get what you pay for, Stayed in this hotel for ten nights in a triple room, was small but comfortable, most of the time we didn't even stay in the room as we are in New York City!! When we first arrived, the room was clean and comfortable and was cleaned every day. The shared bathrooms also cleaned every day, depending on how many people in the hotel you could be waiting a long time for a shower however we overcome this by using showers on different floors. Also they could get quite messy during the day as lots of people were using them, but like i said before, we used bathrooms on different floors which weren't so unclean. Also, struggled to get hot water in one of the bathrooms, but as it was so hot when we were there, a cold shower was welcome! We were able to connect to Wifi on the second floor however the signal was horrific, but usable, as long as you aren't expecting to mega fast download speeds, you are able to check facebook or email on this connection. Some people were using the lobby, which had full signal strength when we were there, but we never really felt the need to. Could be quite noisy at night, but not that bad really. The air conditioning unit was quite loud, however was a bonus as we were there during really hot and humid weather, there was also a fridge which was also helpful and the tv worked with no problems. Really close to subway station, Cathedral Parkway/110th Street, on a direct line to Times Square and Penn Station. The neighbourhood is generally quite safe, on the side which is closer to Columbia University, the side closer to Central Park is bordering Harlem, wouldn't recommend walking there alone at night. Staff were friendly and accommodating, helped us with directions, places to eat and also when we forget to print tickets printed them for us. Overall this hotel is basic, but you have to remember, if this is your first, second or third time in New York and you want to experience the city, this is a great place to stay!!!

Good value for money, good location, very helpful staff at reception. If the wake up call on last day at 5.45am would not have forgotten a very pleseant experience! I would be happy to book this place again and recommend the double room with en suite bathroom (403?)

We paid $173 (tax included) for this room, which is inexpensive for NYC. The room was just that – a room to sleep in and not much else; no frills at all so don't expect otherwise. I have read other reviews of this property and was surprised at what people expect for this price - sorry but this is NYC and if you want the Waldorf than you have to pay the price. However if you are in need of just a place to sleep, then this does the job. There was an unnecessarily huge dresser that took up a large part of the small room. The room was clean but very outdated. The elevator was very small and slower than molasses. The Wi-Fi code they provided did not work. Since we have been to NYC many times, we didn’t need to be down where all the action is in Midtown. We needed to be near Central Park for an event, so this spot served us well. If you are Seinfeld fans, the restaurant known as “Monks Diner” is only a few blocks away. The subway is pretty close. We parked our car on the next street (108th) for $17.00 for 24 hours – now that was a deal through ParkWhiz. If you need to be in the Upper West Side of the city or near Central Park, then this is a great location.

Description of Service. The only service offered by the hotel is laying of bed, change of towels. All services mentioned in the brochure were not there. No entertainment of any sorts. The public relation is not cordial.

You don't expect a lot for the price per night in Manhattan and you don't get a lot. The word adequate was invented for this establishment, although the TV didn't work and the shower wasn't great but it did the job.

Positive: The hotel is kinda close to the subway and it's near some good bars, restaurants, supermarkets and drugstores.Negative: We booked a double bed room with a shared bathroom. Our room was super tiny, we weren't even able to walk on the floor with our 2 suitcases! We also had this tiny TV but it didnt even work. (I mean we payed a lot for the tiny room and we were so unhappy in this hotel, so we just wanted a TV that works - even tho we didn't even watched TV) They promised to send a TV guy for fixing it, but no one ever came! After 3! days of complaining about that broken TV, they gave us another room. Now we stayed at a bigger room with a bigger TV and an own bathroom. Thanks to the broken TV! The only negative thing was that they didnt put sheets on the pillows.All in all I can say is that I wouldn't stay in this hotel again. We payed too much for a really tiny room.

Had to ask how to turn on the AC. Would have liked to see small desk/hutch & chair/stool for my laptop & notes. Had to pull dresser over and sit on edge of bed. Staff was accommodating & helpful, though. This was probably a more run-down place in the past, but they appear to be making efforts to upgrade things. I would stay here again.

Stayed her for 5 nights at the week of the 4th of July. Very recommended good place if ur a group of young friends who just looking for a cheap place to spend the night. We were 3 friends and stayed at a triple room. The room was small but very clean and had a tv and air conditioner. The shower and toilet were small and not very clean but good enough. The guys at the reception were very polite and helpful. The neiberhood was safe (walked there alone at 2 am) and there are some bars and restaurants (including the Seinfeld's diner) near by. Metro station is just 2 blocks away.

Small room cleaned, but dirty towels in the closet& food in fridge from others, tv not working,towels were so old, there were teared on the sides bathroom on the level should at least provide paper  towels

The negative comments regarding this 'hotel' are completely justified. My partner and I stayed for 9 hellish nights in late July 2014 dispite the mixed reviews. The rooms are not like the photo's on the Morningside Inn website. We had no bedside lamps (even after asking we still had to buy our own to use for reading at night) the "widescreen" television was a tiny 28cm old box hanging losely on the wall with cables stuffed behind it and had very poor reception. The floor was filthy, the walls cracked and mildued - as were the shared bathrooms (warning to wear flip flops in shower). The room was so tiny the door almost hits the bed when you open it. There is no fresh air and the tiny view outside is of a dirty ally with a filthy stench. The bedroom doors have very poor security and swing shut with a loud bang echoing the tiny passage ways all night long! The lift is incredibly small, painfully slow and suffocating. The basement with cooking facilities and laundry was hot and suffocating and felt like a prison. The dryer did not work and no 'out or order' sign was placed by staff to stop people losing their money. The hotel staff were friendly enought but really didn't care much for guest needs and are just interested in your cash! This hotel/hostel should be condemned as it is not up to standard. Be warned. Not a pleasant place to waste your NYC experience or your money. $1,000 US for nine nights. Spend an extra few hundred and upgrade. Only positive was the location.

this hotel is literally the worst thing ever! I'm not sure how its still allowed to operate. my dad and I went to new york during December of 2012 for 3 weeks and we stayed 3 nights in this hotel until we booked somewhere else because it was so bad. the staff were very unhelpful and unwelcoming considering we'd just been on a plane for close to 24 hours from Australia. 0/10 would not recommend to anyone, it might be cheap but its definitely not worth it.

Morningside Inn was the worst experience I have ever had in a hotel. Sure it was not a five stare hotel and at the time of check in we had to wait for our rooms to be cleaned. Sure it was weird we did not get clean towels everyday and they did not have wash towels. also out of the three rooms we reserved one had no lights. Only one had T.V reception. I also dealt with the bill being close to four hundred dollars more due to additional taxes. A few people in my party had noticed how rude the manager was to the arriving guest. my room was on the third floor and I was busy keeping the kids entertained,so I had not witnessed this. But unpronounced to me I would become an involuntary victim to his rudeness. One morning I noticed the manager watching T.V and asked the manager if the cable was back up, Well that set him off. He threaten to throw me out and hurled a slew of insults short of cursing me out he screamed and threaten to give me my money back out of his own pocket but never did ( I never brought up money). Yes I ended up staying because I was traveling with kids. I avoided him throughout the stay but also witnessed two other confrontations, different people, with the same guy. One couple took their things and left. I wish I would have done that.

Excellent location, rooms are clean enough, relatively small but fine for this price. They have a kitchen that you can prepare something for breakfast etc. Loads of restaurants and bars around. Would recommend for budget travellers

Room was small but with a cupboard so able to store bags. No tv in room. Bed and bedding clean with comfortable bed. Bathroom old and a little run down. The rooms had thin walls and you could hear everything from other rooms.

The people saying underwhelming things here forget what NYC hotels can cost. This place squeezes every dime out of what they bring in. Small rooms? Yes. Shared bathrooms? Yep. But come on, for the very low price this place is super clean, the people were nice and the neighborhood is great. This is in NYC, and you won't be sitting in your room all day anyway. Its clean and safe and actually quite nice for the price.

I lliked the Morningside Inn as its location was good in Uptown NYC, the reception people were very helpful and assisted in finding every place in the city. The standards of cleanliness were high. The marts worked 24 hrs a day and a night and you could buy everything very close to the Inn. WiFi worked and the subway station (110th street) was only some blocks away.

After we've made reservation including pre payment of 40 dollars and after 30 hours of long overseas trip. We arrived at the hotel and they told us that there is no room for us. While waiting at the lobby in order to find another hotel we've met 3 guys that the same story repeated with them. It is a systematic behavior they are overbooking their rooms in order to earn more money.We strongly reccomend not to go there.

Pro's: Location - 8 stops on the subway to Times Square. The rooms are cleaned daily with fresh towels & linen.Con's: The rooms are tiny. No kettle, toaster or utensils in shared kitchen. Wifi is very poor and the TV's didn't work work the entire week we stayed

A Terrible place to stay. My girlfriend and I booked Morningside Inn for July 10 to the 18th and during that time we've experienced the electricity going out, the toilet stop working and the television glitching. The hotel advertises a large screen television and certainly provides it, however it complements the tv with antennas that are barely able to catch a signal, let alone hold one. At the same time majority of the channels the antenna was able to hold was in Spanish. The service was okay, although on the last night there we found a mystery stain on one of the towels. The main light didn't work, it flickered on and off like a horror film. The room itself was quite tight and contained broken pieces of furniture (the loose dresser drawer, the cracked tiles on the bathroom floor, and the gaping hole in the private bath door.) And to top it all off we were given a double not a queen size bed, which was what we originally booked. Overall F for their effort. And F for their execution. Would NEVER recommend.

Service was pretty good. The elevator and rooms were tiny and there was an extra bed that we didn't need in the room taking up space. The beds were rather uncomfortable but we didn't have much trouble sleeping.The air conditioner worked well though, and it was a good price.

I love the hotel, the location, but i did pay for two rooms with tv but nothing, the wifi was awful, impossible to connect, and the only nice people was Víctor, very kind and helpful, the Best one, the administrator was rude every time.

It was a good price for New York, a clean room, and 20 minutes away from Timesquare.The neighborhood has a couple of nice places for a late snack.Just one thing : I gave a call for an early check-in, the girl on the phone said it was ok, but when I arrived, the manager told he couldn't do anything... Too bad, but they have a luggage room.

Bed-bugs.... Although coated bed every other day and the room was clean, bed-bugs are there! Hotel is in a good location, but only for the brave who are not afraid of insects. It was a big disappointment and a big shock!!

Me and a friend traveled to New York on the 17th June and decided to book this place. We had looked at previous reviews on here and they were up and down (good and bad) so we didn't quite know what to expect. Upon arrival the staff were nice and friendly and spoke fluent English. He gave us our key and told us to go have a look at the room before we pay.. We checked out the room and it was all you need for a 5 night stay in NYC. Clean, Fresh, Safe and quiet. Our bedding and towels were changed daily and the maid was also very helpful and friendly. We never used the kitchen in the hotel as we were on holiday.. (who wants to cook on holiday!) super friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived till we left. If i returned to New York I would Defo stay again! Super cheap... 7 or 8 stops from time sq... and just what you need in a hotel your only really going to sleep and shower in :)

With this hotel I was extremely satisfied, was clean, every day our dear cleaners swept the room, put clean towels. Also the staff at the reception was nice. Certainly when I go back to New York, I go to the same sticks. Excellent location.

Budget for sure but was worried after i booked and read horrid reviews. But on my 5 night stay, room was spotless fresh towels and bed clothes daily and felt safe in an exerlant location near cent park

Cheap, close to central park and subway.Nice surprise when we arrived as the person at reception gave us an en suite room even though we had booked a standard room. But after first day out we got back to our room to find door open and unlocked thankfully nothing was mising from our room but we asked to not service our room after that. We were only staying 3 nights. Quite noisy as there was a pipe running through the room, but for the price i didnt expect too much.

I travel frequently for work and stay at nice hotels. This hotel was as clean as these expensive hotels. I will definitely stay again. There was no TV in the room but you're in NYC. Who needs TV? The AC blew ice cold. It was quiet and I never had to wait to use the bathroom. Two thumbs up!

I had a terrible experience with this hostel. They were inefficient and rude, and I would never recommend it to anyone. They treated us terribly. I phoned on the day we were arriving to confirm that they knew we were coming as we were getting there late, which they said they did. Then, when we got there late at night, about 11pm, they told us that they did not have space for us and were going to put us in another hostel. We were exhausted, having travelled to get there all day, and this was a dreadful way to be treated. They made us wait alone in the freezing cold outside for a taxi and sent us about 20 blocks away. We had selected this hostel for the location, so to be sent 20 blocks away was unacceptable. If we had known before hand, which they could have told us, we could have made arrangements to stay somewhere else. Furthermore, the hotel they sent us to was cheaper than Morningside, but we still paid Morningside full rates for a cheaper, tiny, dirty little room. I have been trying ever since to get a refund for the difference of the rooms, with no success.

If you are looking a place to sleep and then go arroumd the city... this is a good place. Good service, intenet service, decent bathroom, good tv service...............................................

Service: We were lucky and got Victor during our check-in and our check-out. He was very helpful and went out of his way to help us. Kudos to Victor. Unfortunately this was not true for the others at the front desk. One girl in particular was having an animated conversation on the phone and barely looked up to ask what we wanted!Facilities: They were actually quite good for the price we paid. The room was clean and there were housekeeping services everyday if desired. The bathrooms though few in number were very clean. HOWEVER, the greatest shortcoming in this place was the lack of a KETTLE or even a pot to boil water. True, there was a pantry but there were no pots and pans nor cutlery in sight. If they are so worried about things being stolen, I suggest that they make the customers sign for the items they need to use during the duration of their stay. My husband in particular was very irritated that he was not able to make his own cup of tea at any time he wanted. In fact you can't do anything in the pantry save microwave your store bought food. This is the only hotel I have ever stayed in which did not provide facilities for boiling water. If I've known this earlier I would seriously consider not booking this hotel!Location: It was a convenient short walk away from the nearest subway station, Cathedral Parkway. Food was easily available. Be wary of D'Agostino though. Prices are high and service poor. Westside Market would be a better choice.Price: budgetplaces offered a competitive price for this accommodation

Everything was good and in safe and quite area. It was close to businesses and stores where to buy food. Also, close subway stations. The TV signal was not very good, the doors where loud and other people were not very quite when closing the door.

I needed to crash for 1 night in NYC and was arriving at midnight, so this hotel seemed ok. Affordable. However, I was immediately worried when I was offered the opportunity to inspect my room before deciding to stay! I went up and had a look and the room was as basic as you can get - basically a bed and a dressing table, showers down the hall.
