The bed seemed clean and I was to be out in a few hours so I decided to stay. However, when I went to get into the bed I noticed the sheets were stained. That was it for me unfortunately. I slept on top of the bed with my clothes on. I would not recommend this accommodation. The rooms and showers really need refurbished.

Loved the staff, the place was pretty good. Definitely worth it. The place was clean and close to the subway line that can get you basically anywhere. I stayed there 2 nights and had a double room with the private washroom. Great stuff.

This was a good stay to be on the Manhattan island at an affordable price. Located upper west side, this is in walking distance to Central Park and Broadway, so good access to subways. Shared bathroom and kitchen which was fine, private room was clean and included a fridge.

We stayed one night at Morningside Inn and it was great! Do not expect anything fancy, it is a normal, cozy place in NYC and most importantly, it is affordable! The staff was nice and we would stay there again! :)

Tiny room but comfortable & clean & bright with a good air conditioner & T.V. Refrigerator is also in the room!!But no coffee maker is there though it is listed :(. Bathroom is neat & clean.Very Good location. Just 2 blocks from subway & major bus stand is just 1 block. Columbia university & Cathedral Church is very close.Clean & quiet & safe neighborhood. I would strongly recommend this hotel for a quick night.

This property is a hostel but wasn't listed that way. The room was extremely small but had a small private bath. It was listed as having a hairdryer and coffeemaker, which were not available. But the place was quiet, clean, and air conditioned. It is located about 6 blocks west of the northern end of Central Park and was only 3 blocks from the nearest subway. It is definitely more for younger people just wanting a place to spend the night!

Good location. Walk to Central Park & Museums. 2 blocks from subway and on major Bus routes. Choices of eating venues in the area, bars/pubs and coffee venues. The staff are courteous and helpful. Entire Inn smells of Pine Sol, so you know it is clean. Small bathroom, but great shower.

First of all, the room we were given didn't match the booking and when we tried to explain the situation to the hotel manager, we had to deal with a very aggressive gentleman who was disrespectful and confrontational. Avoid at all cost

Easy to get to. Bright and clean. Very accommodating front desk and service staff. Rooms are tiny but comfortable. Keep valuables with you. The neighborhood is spacious and offers a range of places to get food to eat in the dining lounge or for picnicing. We will definitely be going back to Morningside, and recommend it to economy-minded friends and travelers.

My husband and I were on honeymoon and had booked a double with private bathroom. After a long flight, we got to our 'hotel', only to be told that our room was not available. If we could cope, they would give us another room, but with a shared bathroom for the night and then we'd move to our original room. We agreed. We got to the room, to find it half painted, with a mattress on the floor with dirty linen, the wardrobe door jammed open by the 'bed', a broken fridge, no wifi and toilet rolls thrown in the room for good measure. Needless to say, I wasn't very happy. The staff were incredibly unhelpful and we had to find another hotel at short notice, a day before new year. They didn't even refund our deposits. Do not go here.(We went 2012-2013)

Staff was very friendly (especially Patrick, thank You for Your hospitality), rooms were nice and clean, location was great, foodmarkets, restaurants and subway were near. So great holiday! I recommend this hostel.

We arrived in Hotel at about 5 pm, they gave us promptly our room. We booked one with shared bathroom to save some money and it was totally O.K. for five nights. The location was awesome, in walking distance to the metro, even fast line was not far, and a lot of restaurants and even a supermarket (very rar in NY) was close. So perfect for a low budget trip.Our room was provided with a TV and a fridge. The only thing I would criticize is the safety of your valuable articles. There is no safe provided and the door lockers are poor, so I would recommend to bring maybe a lockable suitcase.

We arrived at this hostel (it's not really a hotel but hostel) late in the evening (by 11pm) and were surprised they had changed our booking and provided us with a single room without bathroom. I was sad and disappointed at least by this and on my question why had they done so with any notice to me I had a reply that's usual practice with people who arrive late and do not call in advance. Fortunately next day they provided us with a decent room we booked before. The manager promissed me to give the difference back to my bank account but they didn't do it yet even though I sent some messages. Strange experience, take care if you arrive late and try to call them in advance. I wouldn't stay there any more, definitely

We reserved a budget triple room for 2 nights. At first we called someone if we could have an extra bed for the 4th person because originally we booked for 3. However, we couldn't get it. At first night, we saw that 4 people could live in that room(but we found out later that the person at front desk named Patrick assigned us to deluxe double room) so we decided to live there without telling him. However, he noticed it wasn't only 3 people but he kindly gave us that room so we didn't have to pay. We would recommend others to stay here because staffs are friendly, the location is close to subway and many restaurants so it's easy to go out and have fun. Moreover, the room is also clean.

Double bed very small, no channel on TV (no signal), no kitchen utensils provided, not every room has airconditioning, no hangs on the wall. Location is good; shops, cafés, pubs and restaurants on Broadway

Do NOT book a reservation here.When we arrived in the middle of the night (had booked, payed deposit, and given notice), we were told that there were no rooms for us. Did not get any help finding another place to stay in our budget class. Did not seem to care two young girls had to wander alone New York city all night

It's located in a very good area, close to the subway, central park, st. john's cathedral. Lot's of pretty cheap restaurants around there too. A night at the hotel is pretty cheap, better than anything you'll find in manhattan. The hotel's inside looks a bit old, the common area was pretty dirty, the bathrooms are shared but the beds are comfy. The people who work there are very nice, friendly and helpful. Overall it's a great and affordable place to crash for a few nights.

Much like I was, you're probably on a budget, looking at reviews on here thinking it doesn't sound THAT bad. In honestly, it's not THAT bad. It probably won't kill you. Particularly if you're planning on being out all the time and just crashing out in your room. But make no mistake, this is a hostel not a hotel, despite what their website claims. If you expect to spent any time at all in the room, spend a little bit more and get a proper hotel. The general state of repair was absolutely awful, the bed sheets were stained, the facilities were seriously limited and the wifi was mostly unusable.One huge plus: I absolutely loved the surrounding areas. The bars and cafes near the hotel were a great antidote to Times Square! Would highly recommend the area, if not this 'hotel'.

We stayed at Morningside Inn for five days in the Upper West Side of New York. The hotel is well run, there is little noise from other guests and the rooms are a decent size. The staff are very helpful. Finding a hotel room in New York for a reasonable price is difficult but I'd recommend this hotel even though it is a few stops on the subway from downtown.

room description not accurate & misleading, room clean and safe. no facilities ie computers/breakfst facilities or vending machine facility, as a bit of a scary area after dark. staff not very helpful

I was in the city for 6 days. The location of the hotel is fine and the staff are nice. However, it would be great if they could fix some of the small problems they have. for instance, the TV wasn t working. I am not sure it is just too expensive to fix that in New york. Also, on their website, they show stoves and microwaves, one would expect some coffee cups or a coffee maker or even, since they show a stove and microwave, some thing like a pan or a plate. hen i inquired, they said those were stolen hence no need to have them replaced. How about they keep them in the admin office and hand them to whoever need them with an agreement that they will be returned at the end of the stay? generally, it was a nice stay except those small things that can make a difference

I book a room at agoda.com for this hotel. But when I arrived there, the manager just told me there were no rooms. But the booking fees have already been taken. Then the manager recommended another hotel to me, which is 25 blocks away! The worse thing is when we departed for the recommended hotel, a man after us met the same problem with Morningside Inn. It seems the hotel sends guests to other hotels every day!!

The room was clean. Bathroom had hot showers and didn't ever have to wait more than 5 minutes for one if them to open up. There are a number of local restaurants near by and a couple minutes walk to metro. We enjoyed having a light breakfast at Absolute Bagel which is just right around the corner. Great bagels and very popular with the locals.

I got bitten by bedbugs in room 511, but luckily it happened on the last day we were staying there so I got them poisoned in next hotel. Or at least I hope so. I sent an email to the hotel but didnt receive any response regarding this matter. BAGS LOSTMy bags were lost during the trip to NYC and were delivered to the hotel. However nobody said that they had arrived and when questioning they said nothing has come. On the second last day I asked after having called to airport luggage department, the lady at the desk found the goods. They were behind the door she was sitting. At the very same corridor she has to go through to get his office? Actually I dont know did I lose something, but if I did it was maximum of 200 USD, since I am not completely sure how much money did I have in my luggage.LOCATIONHotel has good location and the rooms look clean but as stated before I got bedbugs and had to go Home depot to get the poison and spend 4 hours poisoning them. THE ROOMI got a two bed room and it was ok considering the price but the heating systems sound is like the sound of 1980's vacuum cleaner which would start hoovering once per hour. The thing gives steam all over the room and you dont want to have your hand touch that thing while sleeping. The beds were mediocre, a bit old and too soft for me.OTHER FACILITIESThe communal shower was clean at all times.THE STAFFCleaning personel was very nice and clerks at desk were nice as well. Personally I would take seriously bed bug issue as they are nasty creatures and ruin the hotel's reputation (and because of this I have to give only one point for cleanliness . For me that is big no no and thus cannot return ever to this hotel. And I got no response to email.WOULD I COME AGAINUnfortunately not. Had it not been bed bugs, then I would have said yes since I can sleep regardless of medium level noice and the location is nice as it it close to subway stations. Internet didnt work at any time at rooms even if supposed but then again in the lobby I got the most of the bandwidth and could easily read emails.

Tip: Double bed with a bathroom means 1 bed 1 bath, not 2 beds with a bathroom. My girlfriends and I stay here in Vacay and ended up with a room with 2 beds and a communal bathroom, that a homeless man was allowed to use daily! - Hard beds (felt the springs)- Tv satellite flipped in and out the whole time- very small room (door hits the bed)- never received a new clean bed spread after asking twice (the concierge & boss)- communal bathroom (need i say more) Overall: i ended staying at my ex's just to get a warm bed and decent showerI felt like i was homeless. Tip: Save up for a real hotel because this one wasnt worth the money.

Clean room and clean bath room. The place is near subway, supermarket and easy find halal food. Near to central park and hanson riverside park. Small room no AC and no TV. For sleep and bath only ....

I was surprised with this hostel, I got a private room and it came with a queen bed, the room was very clean like a good hotel. Good environment, quiet and with nice front desk person. No complains at all.

This hostel is on the Upper West Side of NY, which is considered the rich part of Manhattan. I had the budget single room, which had a full/dbl size bed, mini fridge, sink (with no mirror), small dresser, small closet, and TV (which didn't work). I paid like $80/night (total for three nights came to $270) and the room size was perfect for me since I traveled solo. I was right next to the bathroom in the hall, so that was a plus also. I didnt' have to walk down the hall or far from my room. I had two issues with this hotel. The first was that I booked this through www. agoda.com and when I went to confirm my reservation the day before my arrival, the hotel didn't have me in the system. Luckily, the front desk person (Wendy) was nice and she said that they have plenty of rooms and I would have one when I arrived the next day. So, I then called Agoda to see what the mix-up was. They, too, were nice about it and called the hotel while I waited on hold to make sure I was in their system. No one could tell me why I wasn't in the hotel system. I'm glad I called ahead of time! Jeez!My second issue was that when I got to the hotel (I stayed Thus thru Sunday) the TV didn't work. I didn't try to turn it on until Fri morning while I was getting ready for my day. It said something about a remote and there was not a remote in the room. So I stopped by the front desk on my way out and told the front desk person. She said that they were in the middle of converting from old to new cable boxes, so some rooms had cable and some didn't. Of course I had a room with no cable. She said she would talk to the manager (Patrick). I stopped back by Fri night and she said the manager said the TVs should be back on Sat. I said ok and asked when he would be in the office. She said from 8-4pm so I was going to try and catch him Sat. Sat morning about 9am I stop by the front desk and she said Patrick hadn't come in yet because he had to work overnight, but that he should be there by noon. Well I was on my way out for the day and was not gonna wait around for him. I was leaving the next day (Sunday) and at this point it was ridiculous playing cat and mouse. My point of trying to talk to Patrick was to get some kind of compensation for my stay. I understand that most people aren't even in their rooms half the time, but I'm one that likes the TV on when I am getting ready in the morning and watches it before I go to sleep at night. It would have simply been nice to know I had a room with no TV when I checked in that I had no working TV because to me that's false advertising.PROS: Only 3 blocks to subway, Great price for the location, right next to my bank/ATM, close to food/restaurantsCONS: Communication sucked (between Agoda and the hotel with my reservation, and the fact that no one told my I had a non-working TV). Too far from where I spent most of my time. I was primarily in lower Manhattan so it took 35-45min by subway ride. Loud, walls thin, can hear your neighbor (I was prepared with other reviews and brought ear plugs, so I was fine)

The place is good for the price, and reception people are friendly and helpful. But during our stay a bag full of goodies I bought in the pharmacy - and I bought a lot, for $145 - was gone. It was sitting there on the bathroom floor, and then it was gone. To be fair the manager offered us refund but since he didn't know who took it we didn't want him to impose the fine on an innocent person. Apart from that good place and good location, and if we are in new York we will go for it again I suppose

Actully everything was nice - location is good, lovely bars and restaurants around, staff is nice, elevator. BUT - something with plumbing (? water in WC) - time after time there is terrible sound from water coming (from somewhere). Acoustic is low, so you can't sleep. There is kitchen also, just no dishes at all, so you can't prepare food or even tea/coffe.Otherwise - price is very good for what you get, very good that WC is inside room. We came from Europe, adaptation period is longer, so it is good if you have more comfort! Thank you :)

The private room was ok, but the tv was not working during the 11 days I spent there. The wifi was ok. The receptionists are not too friendly, they don't say even a good morning. The local is very safe and easy to get to the subway. There is a kitchen in each floor, but the microwave was not clean. The housekeeper staff was friendly differently from the receptionists.

When we arrived our light did not work, however, we got a free upgrade to a better room with working lights. The service personnel was very nice and forthcoming. Rooms were cleaned everyday. The hotel was located in a safe neighborhood, close to the subway and a bus line. There were many shops and restaurants nearby. It takes a little bit (20 min) to go downtown Manhattan, but since the prices were lower and the public transportation in NYC is convenient this was worth it.

This hotel was great, I had read some horrible things about it but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised, the room was clean, as was the private bathroom. I felt safe at night in the area around the subway stop. I am a single female and I had no worries about feeling safe. No bedbugs, and everything was in perfect working order, I would gladly stay here again

Worst hotel ever. After 2 days I started to get red spots all over me, and soon it started to itch like c r a z y! If you do not want 92 (true story) bedbug bites, you should stay far away from this place.The manager, Patrick, promised us before we left that he at least would pay our dry cleaning bill (and ointment against the itching), since we had to laundry all our clothes in 60+ degrees celsius before entering our apartment at home. (Expensive!!)He answered our first e-mail that he would compensate us, but then nothing happened and after 3 more e-mails with no response we gave up.Now we want to warn others not to do the same mistake as we did.We never saw the bedbugs in the room or the mattress, but our bags was on the floor near the bed, and when we came home we saw them in the bag.And the itching continued for days. Please, stay away from this place.

October 2013 we booked 7 nights (November) by budgetplaces.com at the Morningside Inn in New York City. We paid budgetplaces.com 99,14 Euro in advance for one night. On arrival on 9th. November the room we were given was not in accordance with the specifications in our reservation.We informed the manager that the room did not meet our expectations, but apparently it was not possible to have the room we had originally booked. In order to be given another more suitable room it was necessary to pay a surcharge to which we consented having no other option and paid for the seven nights.When we had finally got to our room we became aware that the 99,14 euros we had already paid to the booking site had not been deducted from the bill. We immediately informed the manager of this oversight and asked for the mistake to be rectified. However he unfortunately became very annoyed and informed us that he had given us a good price for the new room. The money we had paid in advance was in his own words “a fee to get the room for the price we paid”. It was impossible to have any further discussion on the matter due to the verbal aggression of the manager Patrick Arroyo. In view of which we decided not to ruin our holiday but to deal with the matter at a later date.

morningside innPROS: near subway (110th), walking distance to central park (3 blocks), clean towels and sheets, nearby grocery,restaurants,etc. CONS: we were transferred from a room (facing the street) since the room was under maintenace and front desk officer was not aware (duh!) to a room (facing the wall of another building).no working tv,fan (no a/c,was ok since the weather was still cold); internet connection was poor even when your in the front desk; no shampoo; no tea making facility in the room (as per advertise in budgetplaces.com); common kitchen was useless since no pots,utensils, etc. to be used by the guests.; the bed was not cushioned enough, u can feel the springs; walls are too thin, u can hear footsteps, closing doors, shower running, flushing toilets,etc!Here is the copy of the reservation details made through budgetplaces.com1 superior double room Double bed/s, Private bathroom, Kitchen (access to shared kitchen), Telephone, TV, Wi-Fi, Coffee / tea making facilities, Air conditioning, Heating, Hairdryer.I spoke to Patrick (manager), about my concerns, he said that there was an on-going repair in the building and that's why there is no signal on the tv. But why the heck they have their tv on the reception?! About the kettle at least for the room, he promised to have it available when we get back, as usual empty promise. I got tired already and just decided not talk to the receptionist or any1 about the lack of facilities. One more thing, since there was no A/C in the room, we opted to open the window, unfortunately, everyday some one smokes.So,we had to close it again.Point is, if you just want to sleep, this place was ok. Other than that, don't expect any more.

I liked the fact that it was cheap because it was a last minute trip but, we called 3 times for wash clothes and ended up with hand towels, the noise from other people checking in was so loud it woke me up out of my sleep, I called because when I got back to my room it smelled like cigarette smoke and the front desk said oh I don't know anything about that, the heat wasn't that good but the window didn't lock either so it was very cold at times, and as I was leaving out one of the front desk clerks just starred opposed to saying having a good day or hello or whatever. I tried to look at the brighter side but it was hard.

In comparatio with New York Hotels and Hostel This is quite cheap and not bad, is close to the metro station which let you be in the city center in 15 minutes, The are is relax and quiet, with some bars and restaurant aroun.Is a good option if you don´t wanna spend a lot of money for accomodation and you want a decent place

I've Stayed here on December of 2012 for 4 days with my mother and my sisters. We chosen a private room with private bathroom. The location is excelent! Near a Absolute Bagels, where you can eat a Bagel with butter and a hot chocolate for less than 3 dollars, which helped us a lot for our breakfast. The subway station, central park, St. Patrick the Divine and lots of nice restaurants are near, so it's a very good place to be and not very expensive, if compared with other locations in Manhattan. But on the check-out the staff had arranged us a cab to La Guardia, and the cab was terrible! Totally dirty and the driver VERY antipathic. But, I would recommend this place to anyone that want's to visit New York with a low budget!

I've been coming to Morningside for many years. The value is absolutely incredible for the location. The hotel is located on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, which is a very quite, family-friendly area of the city. The hotel is just blocks for the 1 train, so you basically have New York at your finger tips within a matter of minutes.The hotel itself is very clean and the hotel staff is EXCELLENT. One of the best parts about Morningside is that each floor is equipped with a full kitchen, so if you are on a budget, this is a great way to cut the cost of your trip. As I mentioned before, the staff at Morningside is the best - from the front desk to the housekeepers. I've found the staff here to be extremely polite and helpful, which makes the stay even better! I would definitely recommend staying here and am looking forward to my next visit and many more to come!

Me and my girlfriend stayed here, from sept 8th to sept 19th 2013.Room was wery clean, with towels changed every day. Water was ok. Showerhead was attached to wall, and not removable. (But thats unfortunately normal in all of the US).TV and refrigerator was OK. Though we barely tried the TV, as we were there to see the city!Surroundings and nieghbourhood, was good. Pharmacies, shops, restaurants and bus stops, just around the corner. And just a few blocks to the subway.WIFI was just OK. Really a week signal. But several networks can be browsed, to choose the one which is best at the moment.There, was no chair or any table at the room. (But then, we did not ask for it either!)Wery good and large bed, with a good matress, to sleep in. Our room was also surprisingly quiet, with little or no noise from the outside!As we experienced, the staff was really pleasant, friendly and helpful when approached.Yes. There were rats outside the hotel. But thats not the hotels fault, as the whole neighbourhood just places their garbage bags on the outside, a long time before the collectors come to pick it up!If we go to New York again, we would absolutely consider another stay here!

3rd time for me in Nyc and stayed here for the holiday period. I was really concerned regarding some of the reviews but honestly, taking everything into account It was excellent value. I've rated it 4 based on the value for money. The hotel is clean and I got clean towels bed linen and anything I wanted whenever I asked. All staff at the hotel are friendly, the neighbourhood seems safe, there are lots of bars, places to grab food and other shops nearby and it is a 2-3 minute walk to red tube line and 5-10 to the orange and blue, both go straight into middle of manhattan in no more than 15 minutes. I highly recommend 'the Ellington' for food and drinks nearby next to the Amsterdam tavern which is also goodTv in room, en suite we paid for which was good and a fridge in room. We are both easy going but if u r fussy then the thin walls and loud heating (in our room) may annoy u. Staff happy to let us store bags after check out I would definitely stay here again

I travel for my work, am on the road a quarter of the year, and have been doing that for the past fifteen+ years. One of my favorite hotels is the Morningside Inn. What makes it so great is 1) the location – in Manhattan, convenient to everything, yet tucked away on the quiet Upper West Side, 2) the prices – you just can’t beat their very modest rates compared with other places, 3) the accommodations – quiet, clean, comfortable, and well kept, and 4) the management & staff – especially the manager, and the meticulous housekeepers. The place is just the best. I’m there 3-4 times a year, and never ceased to be both amazed and satisfied with the quality and moderate cost of the place.

I stayed here from 18/11/13-25/11/13. I had a comfortable bed. Had a tv and it was what it said on the website. When I asked for my room to be cleaned it was. I had a room with shared bathroom I was lucky as the other people who used the bathroom were clean. I did get woken up a couple of times from people banging their doors and I spoke with them and it stopped. When I wanted something from front desk I got it. I could have guessed back as I had friends staying at another hotel who came to visit me and had no hassle getting them into the hotel. For a hotel on a budget it is well worth a stay.Their is a KFC & Macdonalds near the hotel and other local delis. There is a Starbucks right by the tube stop which was very useful ! I used 110th cathedral parkway on line 1 to get into town took 15mins. Brought a weekly subway ticket which cost $32 I think. I really enjoyed my time in NYC and staying at the Morningside Inn but next time I'll get a room with an en-suite just personnel preference.

Went 12/15 to NYC with Hubby no kids. Location is absolutely great across from Central Park. Easy train/bus ride from La Guardia. M60 bus to Astoria stop , then get on the Train. N,Q, R train get u near , then Walk to 107street. Or taxi($8.00). We did it with our rollaway luggage no big deal. Building has small entry way, front desk, elevator and stairway. Decorated nice real big Xmas tree. Room was standard full bed, 1 small window with small in room sink, little fridge and a closet. See pics. Bathroom is a shared bathroom in hallway. Old nasty tub/shower with old toilet. (Or pay ridiculous fee for private bathroom) Make sure you have ur own TP, I observed several times when there was no TP in the bathroom at night time . Some what quiet (no complains except we could hear the couple next door bed romping) during the midnight hours pretty quiet range up until 5-6Am you hear metal doors slamming. We were gone all day till 11pm or so, we were off to time square or Rockefeller plaza(just beautiful) bottom line; no place for children. Room was clean, small space, excellent location in Manhattan. Rest- Dinners and great food near by, bring rubber flip flops to shower with so you don't step into nasty tub. $100 bucks a night; can't beat that in high season. Great to just crash. Courteous staff. Excellent location in Manhattan(good safe area)

We arrived for a 2 might stay on 12/6/13. As we walked in, we observed an angry guest throwing his keys at the desk clerk and yelling at him because there was no hot water. We asked about that. The man at the desk identified himself as Patrick, the manager, and told us that the hot water was being fixed "as we speak". So, we decided to check in anyway after looking at the room, which was small but clean and adequate for our needs. Patrick told us he was going to give us a discount because "we seemed like nice ladies" So, he took 10% or $30 off the rate and we checked in.We went out for the day, came back in the evening and there was still no hot water. We asked the desk clerk about it and she said they had called someone and they were gonna come and fix it. Hmmm... Patrick had said they were already there. What was THAT all about?In the morning, there was STILL no hot water! We were getting concerned because we had a black-tie event to attend that evening and really wanted to shower first!!We went downstairs and Patrick was at the desk. We told him that we were concerned because there was still no hot water. He abruptly said it was fixed. My friend, who used to own a hotel, told him that she felt that an additional adustment should be made on the rate for last night due to the lack of hot water. He started screaming at us and saying that he had already given us a discount and what did we want him to lose his job? He was very insistent that the water was fixed. But, we had just left the room and the water was cold when we left, so I decided to go back upstairs and check the water again and if it was hot then, we would have just let the whole thing go. Well, it was still stone cold. I went back downstairs only to discover that Patrick had kicked my friend out of the building, called the police and told me to leave as well. He said he felt threatened and in danger of bodily harm by us and we needed to get out. I was flabbergasted. Here is this big burly guy threatened by 2 middle-aged women??? So we waited outside to see if the police were really coming. And they did! They went inside and he told them that there had been a disturbance but the problem people had left. We found this out when the police came out and we asked them. We then told them we were "the problem". They looked at each other and chuckled. We told them the whole story. I was afraid that he would throw our belongings out in the street but the police assured us that it was safe to leave our things in the room, that the hotel staff would not touch them and we had a right to stay in the room because we had paid for it. They further went on to say that we had a right to have hot water and if our belongings were disturbed, we were to call 911 and they would help us. If we did not already have a full day planned, we had not already paid $300 non-refundable for the room and if there had been a vacancy in the City at Christmas-time, we would have gone elsewhere. But the police were very reassuring, so we took the chance and left for the day.We returned around 5pm. Our belongings were still in the room and untouched and, lo and behold, there was hot water!!! However, it was scalding hot water, very difficult to regulate but after about 15 minutes of playing with it, I got it to the point that I could shower and not get second degree burns in the process! The rest of the stay was fine and I would have stayed there again in the future had Patrick not gone off like a rocket on us!! His anger was misplaced. If indeed, he did have plumbers working on the problem for all that time, he should have been yelling at them, not us!! At least we didn't throw our keys at him like the other guest did!! We calmly approached him and he flew off the handle!! Perhaps anger management class or a different line of work is in order for Patrick.

Our stay was quite OK here, no mouses in the room, and we got clean towels to the room everyday. We used the room to sleep, and agree with others that its nice that the subway is close. We got what we paid for and generally are happy about it.However I have to be disappointed to the fact that I never got my keys back that I left to the room. A man told me over the phone that they were found, but didn't know how to arrange the delivery. I contacted the hotel manager as he suggested, and he seemed like he's going to take care of it, just asked me to email my address to him. They probably aren't anymore in the lost and found but in trash, and despite my call and two emails, I never got any response to them. Even a fact that it for some reason would not be possible to post them would've been fine, but nothing. Although its kinda my own fault to leave personal belongings behind, some kind of gesture towards the issue would've been helpful. So don't leave anything to the room, won't get it back.

My previous review was removed because it was too accurate on the disgusting place Morningside Inn is!The website is completely wrong as to wait they offer. I stayed in a "Budget Single" room. There was NO 32" Flat-Screen TV, NO Desk, NO Chair, No AM/FM Radio..And NO HEAT for 2-3 days! I stayed at the end of October 2013 and I needed heat!They provided me 2 towels a day, DAMP towels, not dry towels. When I asked them to bring me some dry towels, the towels they brought were also DAMP. The woman just said, 'sorry' and something about the machines that they have to use downstairs.Disgusting shared bathrooms. On my floor was 19 rooms, there were 2 shared bathrooms. One bathroom had a toilet that was clogged with "you-no-what" and the shower would not work. When I complained, they just LOCKED the door. The other bathroom was okay, but when I went to use it, there was water on the floor from the previous person using the bathroom. There was no floor mat or anything on the floor. Thus, I had to put one of my towels down to keep my feet wet. There was no place to hang my clothes and towels. The only 'hook' was on the back of the door which was broken off. Thus, the only place for me to place my clothes and towels was on the toilet seat....I could go on and on about this place.The ONLY GOOD thing about this place? It is about 3 blocks from the Subway. However, I will NEVER, I repeat, NEVER stay in this hotel again.J.

My stay was a welcomed one, staff very friendly, my room was very clean and you could smell the clean linen scent...nice!! Location right where i needed it! Every morning at 7:30 i would step out side the front door and straight out and breath the morning air...wow...so clear, then i began my walk after visiting the grocery store right around the corner, so handy!! About half way down the street broadway ave there are banks, star bucks, mcDonalds, Rita Aide Pharmacy, Just one block is the Subway Station and Bus stops, I was just loving it!! I was here from 11/1-07/2013

Look... this place is not the Plaza! But if what you want is to see New York and not have to carry your suitcases with you every day then the Morningside Inn is absolutely perfect.Did someone open the front door for me... noDid someone press the lift buttons for me... noBut, did my room contain a bed, sink, toilet and a shower... yes! On top of that, as simple as it is, we had a TV and a mini-fridge. That may sound like an obvious inclusion but realistically, based on the previous reviews, we weren't expecting much!The hotel is a couple of blocks across from Central Park on the Upper West Side. We walked everywhere. If you don't mind walking this place is perfect for you! Regardless, there are subway stations on 110th and 103rd.One thing to be aware of is that this is much closer to Harlem than the 'Upper-West Side' location would have you believe but:1) It is a safe enough area2) Harlem is a really cool place to go now!Overall... The Morningside Inn VASTLY exceeded our expectations!

Me and my husband stayed here for three days and two nights. It is conveniently located in Manhattan, Westside. There's a bus stop at the corner, M60 takes you directly to La Gaurdia. The 110th station of #1 train is a few blocks away. There are two Starbuck's nearby, a pharmacy, and a grocery. There's a Catholic Church just next door. I am very happy with the fast internet service. Sheets are changed everyday. Bathroom is newly renovated. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. Neighborhood is generally safe. For a really expensive city to stay at, this Inn gives you the best value for your money.

At first, my sister and I were happy we booked a room here, we were hesitant at first because of all the bad reviews but we thought it wouldn't bother us too much since we'd be out a lot. Long story short, we got there just to be let down. They said there was a leak and our room wasn't available anymore (we freaked out). Just two girls in NY for the first time, and without a room...you could imagine our anger. Anyway, the manager (after 2 hours) told us he booked us another room in another hostel on the lower eastside, when we got to the other hostel there was a mix up and we had to wait another 1-2 hours before they finally straightened everything out and gave us a room. The only good thing that came out of booking this hostel was getting booked at the other hostel for less!

I was quite wary of this hostel, myself and my boyfriend where staying in it for 3 nights before we got set up in an apartment for the summer living and working in NYC. I was pleasantly surprised how clean it was, we booked into a double room with a shared bathroom. The bathroom was cleaned a few times a day and the bed had fresh sheets on every morning.I will stay again on a budget.

- stayed there for 2 nights, three beds with shared bathroom- room was small for three people, it was clean though, comes with a small cabinet, dresser and tv- good location, subway metro and subway fastfood is within walking distance- be warned though, cleanliness of a shared bathroom depends on who you're sharing it with - if you choose a shared bathroom, make sure to bring flip flops/ bathroom slippers (so that you wouldn't have to be on-foot on a dirty bathroom floor)

Our family of 4 came to discover NYC for a couple of days. I took a bit of a gamble on this place and we are glad that we did! This is actually a hostel. There were French students staying on the 2nd floor. If you're like us and want your own bathroom, ask for a PRIVATE ROOM--when you book on their website. We had 2 beds, 2 little rooms and very small bathroom, a small fridge, sm. closet, dresser, and 2 side tables with drawers. It was VERY CLEAN. Tips: bring your own breakfast items, go to the corner market or CVS for ice, if parking on street, find a good spot and WATCH OUT FOR STREET CLEANING SIGNS. You might have to move at 9am. You are 4 blks from the subway, 3 blks from Central Pk, and 1 blk from Broadway (shops and food). Can get Wi-Fi if you go upstairs. I would stay here again!

Book a budget standard room and expecting a shared common bathroom but to our surprised we will given a room with bathroom in our room that's was pleasant. Room was small, free wifi. Location was near to subway and supermarkets. From the exterior of the hostel it looks very decent and nice. All I have to say is the location is good :)

I recently had to travel to N.Y. to enroll my son at Columbia University. A friend of mine booked this hotel because it was close and seemed convenient so a booking was made. When he arrived in the morning he was informed that he could not check in until 2:00 P.M. This was no problem, he was told that they would hold their bags and to return after 2:00 to check in. He returned at 3:30 P.M. and tried to check in. I accompanied him to the hotel and this is what happened.We were told that their computers were down and that it would be anywhere from 4:40 P.M. to 7:00 P.M. before he could expect to get checked in. We asked if there might be a way to ask maid services which rooms might be ready as he was only going to be there overnight. We were told that this was not possible, and we were asked to sit in the lobby and wait until the maids shift ended at 7:00 P.M. if the computers did not come up. The reason for this was not really explained we were just told to wait or we could just get another room somewhere else. We tried to impart to the registration girl that we had hoped to get into the room at "check in time" (2:00 P.M.) and the fact that it was now 4:00 in the afternoon and he would be checking out by 8:00 A.M. the next morning. We were informed that they had 80 rooms and that she had no way of knowing which rooms were ready and therefore she could not let us into any room until either "the computers come back up (or) the maids give them room list at 7:00 P.M.I have to say this is without a doubt, a very BAD CHOICE if you need to stay near Columbia University, do not choose this hotel. I only made it as far as registration but I have to say this it smelled pretty bad upon entry and I did not expect it to get any better. We ended up asking our friend to change hotels and they ended up at the ALOFT just up the street a ways.

Why you should stay:1) When you come out of the hotel and walk towards left (Broadway), you will find a bank at the corner, a great bagel shop, tons of restaurants, grocery store, pharmacy, bakery, ice cream, etc. 2) Walk towards the right (Amsterdam Ave) and you find more stuff including a nice little bar, the Amsterdam Tavern. 3) The subway is a few blocks (quick walk) away (103rd st and 110th). If heading to Times Square or China Town you don't need to make any transfers.4) Its clean, safe5)You'll feel more like a local rather than a tourist6) If you are in NY for the city, not the accommodations 7)Staff we encountered was very nice.8)Some rooms have a kitchen, which is a benefit if you are trying to save money (As mentioned, a few places to get groceries are near by).Why you shouldn't stay;1)The hotel is a repellent to the word "luxury" or even "standard". Can't even say its cozy.2)My bed was uncomfortable, hard as a rock. For three people we got a queen bed and a sofa bed. 3)Its more of a hostel/B&B feel than a hotel4)If you need the pampering, forget about it.5)Everything is worn out. My local Salvation Army might have better furniture and sheets for sale.We chose this hotel for the location and the price. When I think back on this particular trip, I don't even think about the hotel since we had such a great time in the city.

Much better than we expected! The room was a fair size and the hostel was nice and clean, our rooms were cleaned every day and we were provided with new towels every day. We had a large TV and a fridge that we didn’t really use. Wi-Fi was free and accessible anywhere in the building. There was a kitchenette on each floor with a sink and a microwave. We had read about other people arriving to find that they had no reservation, so we made sure to call to confirm prior to our arrival and everything was fine. The shared bathroom situation was ok, there were 2 bathrooms per floor, that seemed to be cleaned daily and if they were ever occupied/unclean you could always find a free one on a different floor. They were never unclean for long. Each bathroom literally had a toilet, shower and sink - no public showering luckily!The hostel was in a really good location - very nice, safe area with loads of places to eat/ buy groceries only 2 minutes down the road. Also only a 10 minute metro journey to Times Square (but make sure you go to the right station as there are two with the same name and one is a lot closer!)Would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone travelling on a budget, we got a lot more than what we were expecting from the price we paid. It isn’t a social hostel though and no real communal area. The horror story reviews sound like they're from people expecting to turn up to a 5* hotel.

The hotel was Ok!It was our first time in the city and we really enjoyed it!The room was small but we got free towels every day and never had to wait for the bathroom.Because some reviews complaint, that they made a reservation but didn't receive a room, we called the establishment to verify our reservation. But every thing was ok!The internet wasn't fast but it worked. The last day we discovered there was a kitchen... It would have been nice if they had told us! The location was great, subway was very close and around the corner was 'absolute bagle' here you can buy bagles from 6 am to 6 pm. Cheap and delicious!

My expectations were not high after reading the reviews, but still, I was disappointed when I saw the room. The room was really small - even smaller than rooms in Europe hotels - looked sad and needed some maintenance. Moreover, the bedclothes were stained. However, the hotel is close from 2 subway stations and from Central Park. The floor was quiet and there was always hot water. It was clean and looked bugs free. So overall, it was alright. You just have to realize the hotel is like a "private bedroom and bathroom" hostel. Hotel in NYC are super expensive, so Morningside Inn is still a reasonnably good option.

We stayed at the Morningside Inn in November of 2011. My husband & son had been to NY but it was my daughter & my first time. We were somewhat on a budget so we had to be frugal. We found this hotel on a search engine & booked it...we couldn't have been happier! The location is excellent, close to the subway that will take you anywhere in the city. The rooms were very clean & the staff very helpful. We arrived a little early & thought we would have to wait to check in but the front desk person said one of our rooms were ready so if we wanted to we could check into that one, go explore the city & come back later & check in to the other. The corner store, The Garden of Eden, is very convenient & open late to accommodate the late night munchies. Our overall experience was favorable & we have determined we no longer need to "search" for a place to stay when we visit NYC...Morningside Inn is the perfect place for us!!!

We could not have had a better place to stay for our large family: incredibly good rates for NYC, the charm of the neighborhood (with places like the Garden of Eden foodstore), and the funkiness of the old building. But it's about people, isn't it, and Patrick, the manager, made our stay. He is a host through and through, both gracious and generous. And funny. Thanks for adding greatly to our time in New York!

With great fears after the TripAdvisor reviews we read, we got to the hotel and all in all- we really loved our stay. The room that we got was great, seemed as if it was recently renovated, and was very clean. The location was great and was between two metro stations, so we could access the NY surroundings in no time... But!We got to the hotel at 02:00 after our flight was delayed, and the man at the front desk said that he is not really authorized to give us the room since we have arrived after midnight, but he'll do it anyways. Well, thanks!We ordered a double room with private bathroom, and the gut said that we are subscribed under a room with no bathroom. We asked him to change the room and he said he is not authorized to do that... We had to spend the first night in a room with no fresh air (only AC which was not so great) and not bathroom inside- which is not so horrible- but it's not what we paid for!The next morning the lady at the front desk was very nice, offered to move our luggage when the room we ordered will be available, and to give us a refund for the difference of the room rates. A day later, Patrick, the manager saw us, and we told him we should receive a refund for the difference ad he said that the woman who told us that that's what they'll do is not authorized to do that and that we can't get the refund. The employees of the front desk were pretty much not authorized to do anything other than tell us to wait for Patrick every time we asked for something, and Patrick was very rarely there… Basically, we liked the place, the room and the location, but the service could have been much better!

Morningside Inn is the perfect hotel if you're planning to visit the city. I have stayed at the hotel many times throughout the years and it has always been a great experience. The hotel is located in a fantastic neighborhood and is less than a five minute walk to the nearest subway. The building staff (the Manager of Morningside, Patrick, and front desk staff) have always been extremely polite and helpful with whatever has been needed. The building and the rooms themselves have always been extremely clean and are very well-kept. The hotel also has a full kitchen on each floor (sink, stove and microwave) which is an added bonus! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to any traveler! Great price, great location, great staff!

The room we got was modest-sized but very adequate -- double bed, private bath with shower, nice flat wall TV. It was clean and quiet. Shared kitchen was very useful. Quiet, pretty neighborhood. Good access to transit everywhere. Negatives: only one window with view of an alley between buildings, elevator sometimes slow. Overall, a great place, especially for the cost.

We stayed 3 nights here but would've loved to have stayed longer. Great location, clean room very cheap rate and our room was ready before check in time which was great because we were pretty tired the staff was great and very helpful they helped us get around new York city and print out tickets through their PC. The metro station is just 3 streets away, and the train takes you to the center off time square I will definitely be coming back to Morningside hotel, had a great stay!

I stayed at Morningside Inn for 6 days and it was fantastic value for the money. The room was small but very clean and had everything I needed. The wifi was pretty good except at high volume times of day ( on the sixth floor). The location is great and the amenities directly around it make it easy to eat cheap while in the city, especially Absolute bagels. The staff were friendly and helped out when my flight was cancelled. I was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews but I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to those who are traveling on a budget.

My decision to stay here was based on the location near the subway line a ride away from midtown. I enjoyed walking Broadway and Riverside park . Last time I stayed in Queens and it was long ride in the subway. You are paying to stay in a safe neighborhood blocks away from Columbia University, I really can't say much for the amenities of the room when you have the city so close. It was a convenient and cheap place to crash, that's it. Patrick, the manager was helpful and friendly finding a car service to the airport. I be coming back.

I just read the previous reviews and I have to say I was shocked!! Patrick the manager is such a gentleman, he assisted me with places to go what to see, what is good to eat. the rest of his staff was sweet but not full of information. the room I had was 102 on the first floors, BEAUTIFUL!!!very clean, towels 32 inch flat screen need more channels only complaint. my experience was so good I am coming back in the fall. come to Morningside you will be pleasantly surprise!

DO NOT STAY HERE!!! The manager Patrick became verbally aggressive when we simply asked to be moved to a room with a private ensuite, as we had booked online.When we first arrived at the hotel we were told by the receptionist they did not have our booking and we had to move to a different hotel for the night where we had to pay more for the room. When we arrived back the next day the manager, Patrick, informed us that the staff member we spoke to the previous day was stupid and doesn't know how to do her job, and they did in fact have our booking. We were then given a room but were not able to check in until the afternoon. When we arrived back in the evening we discovered our room did not have an ensuite as booked online. When we asked the receptionist about this she said she didn't have access to the computer system to check if there were any rooms with an ensuite available. When we asked to speak to the manager he was phoned and spent the next 20-30mins verbally abusing us. He said we didn't present him with the paperwork for the booking when we checked in and so he hadn't known we booked a room with an ensuite, and we were now being unreasonable and causing trouble, and he was going to come down and give us our money back and we could leave the hotel. We had in fact offered to show him the email confirmation of the booking upon arrival, however he did not want to see it. How can the hotel not have their own records of bookings??? We were unable to get more than a few words in on the phone and Patrick continued to yell at us and threaten to kick us out of the hotel. We would have preferred not to stay there, however it was peak season and we couldn't get accommodation at another hotel in our price range. So the remaining of our time at the hotel was spent afraid that we would again be yelled at by Patrick. The room itself was very basic. The a/c was effective but very noisy. The double bed had a terrible mattress which meant the 2 of us sharing it ended up rolling into the middle of it each night and not sleeping well. The wifi barely worked, even in reception. Phone in room didn't work.

Myself and my 2 friends arrived late Wednesday eve after booking accommodation for 3 people. The girl on reception was pretty uninterested in our arrival- and simply asked to see my booking info when i said we'd arrived to check in- she looked us up and said- ok thanks- you can pay in the morning- heres your key- and promptly looked back down at her computer. I then asked where we needed to go for our room- she pointed roughly down the hall. we got to our room to find one double bed in there. My friend popped back to reception to ask why we had a room for only 2 people- she simply said- oh im not sure- there's nothing i can do now. So my friend said- well cant you find us a room for 3 as thats what we booked for- she said -we'll i dont know- id have to call the manager! so we said- well can you do that then please or we'd like our deposit back!! She called the manager who i guess was feeling reeeeeally generous as she hung up and gave us keys to another larger room. the fact that it states you need to pay on arrival- and she said we can pay tomorrow- was i guess because she couldnt be bothered to do any work. the rooms were very basic- but not too bad i guess.. and the rest of the staff were fine- especially the lady working friday morning when we checked out.the only other issue was when we went to check out their card machine wasnt working- we tried 3 cards between us- they tried everything so i guess there was some fault.. the wifi wasnt great either- it didnt reach our room - which was only just behind reception- so we had to hover in the reception if we wanted to use it...

The second floor back rooms are infested. Management knows about the problem but chooses to stifles complaints and tries to bully guests into silence. Only the location has some merit if you are visiting that upper West side Columbia University area.

In December 2012 we booked a double room for March 2013, through Agoda.com and since it was a hot deal offer, we payed total amount in advance.Two weeks before our arrival, we sent an e-mail regarding our reservation to mr. Patrick and he confirmed that everything is fine. We also informed him that we will be arriving around 10 p.m. due to our flight schedule.We arrived to the hotel at Friday night and the receptionist told us that they are overbooked and they have no available rooms. She also told us that they had a system failure and she has been dealing with this kind of situations the whole day. We asked her to call the manager on the phone and she did. We were standing 2 meters away from her and we could hear him shouting at her. When she hung up the phone, she started crying and told us that she will find another hotel for us for the night and in the morning the manager will refund the costs. Since it was rather late, it took her 2 hours to find available hotel and it was for 220$ per night. We agreed to go to that hotel and return in the morning, when they should have available room for us. She apologized once more and said that this happens all the time at this hotel. At the same time when this was happening, other guests arrived at the hotel and were in the same situation. They didn't want to go to another hotel because it was simply too expensive for them so they spent the night in the basement, sleeping on chairs.So, we slept at another hotel for 220$ and we payed a taxi to take us there and our total costs were 270$. We saved the bills and in the morning we were back at Morningside Inn. The manager, mr. Patrick was at the front desk and we told him about our problem last night and presented him the bills. His first line was: oh, it's You that made my employee cry last night! After that he said that it is against hotel policy to refund the money in cash and it is not possible to refund it to our credit card and that he will call Agoda to make the refund and then charge the hotel, but since it is Saturday, we should not expect anything before Monday. On Monday morning we came down to ask him if there were any news and he said that we do not have to worry, that he called Agoda, and he will take care of everything. We also made a complaint about a certain pipe in our room which was blowing off steam loudly and was dripping durring the night. He said he will fix it – he didn't.On Tuesday morning we asked him again if he received any written confirmation from Agoda and he said that we have to make the call and that we can use the phone in our room. In the evening when we wanted to make the call, we noticed that the phone was unplugged and there wasn't a phone socket in the room! We managed to make the call from the front desk and we got an answer from Agoda customer service that nobody reported this issue to them. We sent an e-mail explaining the problem, with bills in the attachment and got an answer that we should settle the issue with the hotel. The receptionist told us that the manager will be at the hotel on Friday.On Friday morning (this has been going on for a whole week) we told mr. Patrick that we contacted Agoda, that they told us they didn't receive any calls from him and that all we want is a written confirmation of what he told us before or to call Agoda right now. Mr. Patrick got up from his chair and got verbaly very agressive and rude! It wasn't possible to communicate with him because he was shouting and didn't want to hear anything we were saying! He said that it was not his fault that the hotel didn't have a room for us on the first night because Agoda never informed him about our reservation (mr. Patrick probably forgot that he confirmed our reservation by e-mail) and that it's our fault that we booked through Agoda!?? He called us liars, told us that we are bullying him for something that was not his problem! This argument was going on for 15 minutes and mr. Patrick could not calm down. At this point we started to worry about our safety at the hotel and the safety of our belongings. Since, our flight was on Saturday and this was our last day at the Morningside Inn, we were afraid that if we go back home, we will never get our money back. So we found our country's Consulate office and went there for advice. The Consul called mr. Patrick on the phone and asked for an explanation. Again mr. Patrick was rude in his communication and the Consul told him that he will advise us to report this to higher authorities. Few hours later we started receiving e-mails from Agoda that everything has been taken care of and that the money has been refunded to our credit card. When we came back to the hotel, mr. Patrick was at the front desk and told us that we are very rude people who are trying to dishonor him and his hotel and that he got all the paperwork from Agoda but now he just won't give it to us. We will never return to this hotel or recomend it to anyone, just because the way how the manager treats his guests (we were not the only ones with the problem there), he has serious issues, acts disrecpectful, speaks sarcastic and really doesn't do his job properly. We travel very often and we never had such bad experience. If You go through other reviews You'll see that this happens frequently.

Very clean, great location, just few streets to subway station, a lot of shops and restaurants around hotel, nice area:) you have great price, air condition, hot water, and clean bed- everything you need;-) I totally recommend this!:)

I had paid a reservation for two single rooms in the internet some three months before my and my companion's intended stay in the hotel. When we got to the hotel from airport around 6 P.M., we were told that our reservation was "not on the system, though it's paid" and that nothing can be done. We were sent to another cheap motel on the other side of the city, far away from Morningside Inn's good location. We thought that there would be accommodation for us in this another motel, but there wasn't. We had to pay for the rooms ourselves. Happily, things turned out much better, but no thanks goes to Morningside Inn or their receptionist's rude idea of service.Keep out of this place unless you want some real trouble by noticing that you don't have a place to sleep in a strange big city!!!

I spent 3 nights in Morningside Inn, and I'd recommend this place for those who would like to explore Manhattan and are looking for a simple but clean&tidy place that provides the basic needs for a traveller. It was easy to arrive in the hotel from La Guardia Airport. As I'd never been in Manhattan before this trip, I just followed some Google Maps instructions, and could reach the hotel because it is located between 110th St( Cathedral. Pkwy) and 103th St. Metro Stations. The only thing I didn't like was the shared restroom. As I had my reservation done via Agoda.com, I had no idea about this, however, this was not a big deal. Wifi is free, but needs to improve, sometimes it was really difficult to connect. In a few words, a good, affordable, well located place to spend some nights.

I tried looking for the cheapest accomodation in New York in Autumn. Of course, it was difficult and so I settled for this hostel as it's location is good and indeed one of the cheapest in NYC. Reservation was not as efficient as I hoped. I had to call numerous times as I found out that the room I booked was not actually reserved for me and offered to somebody else. Well, they sorted it out after several long distance calls, but I almost had to beg them to give me assurance that I'll have a room when I get there. I booked a standard single and it was even worse than my very low expectation. It was a really tiny room with a small window and furniture that looked like it was bought from a flea market or salvaged from a garage sale. It was a nightmare and I really didn't even want to sit on the bed. I felt so sorry for myself for traveling on a budget, I wanted to cry. The view from the window was depressing. The shared bathroom was soooo bad I stopped myself from drinking liquids to limit my use of the toilet. After 2 sleepless nights, i tried asking Patrick to transfer me to a deluxe room or anything better than what I had and luckily they found one for me. Patrick was helpful. The new room I got was wayyy better, with my own toilet and bath. Still not the best, but at that time it was a big relief for me. Room was still small but a lot bigger than the previous one. It was decent enough. Wifi is only available at the lobby. I had to sit on the stairs. On their website they say that they have a common room/lounge area at the basement where there's wifi. Yes, there's a lounge area that was pretty scary and empty, and of course, there's no wifi there.

The location is good but the service is terrible! I had a brand new dress stained by Bleach in my own room by one of the maids and they said I was lying and that they wouldn't pay for that. Felt really injured. From where I come from the costumer is always right and must be well treated so he can come back other times. That's not what happened here and that's why I'll never get back neither recommend Morningside Inn!!!

Having read a number of bad reviews for the Morningside Inn, and also emailing the manager & not receiving a response, I was concerned about staying there but I needn’t have worried. I booked a budget single room and my friends booked a budget double and I asked if we could have rooms on the same floor, which was fulfilled. We were given 2 rooms on the 4th floor. Upon arrival we were booked in & my friends had a double bed, drawers, wardrobe, sink, a fridge & a TV in their room. My room had a double bed, a chest of drawers and a mirror and not much else. I enquired about a TV as budget singles were described as having TV’s in all rooms. The lovely lady, Wendy, on reception said that there wasn’t much that she could do that evening but would see what she could do the following day. When I got back to my room in the afternoon of the following day I had a very large, & what looked like brand new, TV!As for the shared bathrooms, not once during my stay did I have a problem finding one. There are two on each floor & one of them was always free. They were very clean and seemed to be cleaned regularly. There is also a maid service and we were given fresh towels every day and the bed was made up (and sheets changed a couple of times during a 7 night stay). Although there was often a smell of disinfectant around the place, it was reassuring to know how much it was cleaned. Not one cockroach or bedbug in sight!I suffer with a bad back but found the bed to be very comfortable, despite some of the reviews that I had read previously. This may vary from room to room though.Even though we were on the 4th floor, there was a strong WiFi signal and we never had a problem with the WiFi. (Reception will give you the passwords for the various WiFi signals).The hotel/hostel is in a great area – so many bars and places to eat. We found some great bars and met some lovely locals. The area also feels very safe. The metro is nearby, just a few blocks away. It’s good to walk around the area a bit though to discover the many very good places to eat/drink.I would definitely recommend this place to friends and I would also stay there again. The only problem we found was the other guests who, most of the time, seemed insensitive and selfish and enjoyed slamming doors! Other than that, we had an enjoyable stay.

This was my first trip to New York, and boy has it stuck in my mind and all for the wrong reasons. I have never come across such an arrogant and rude man as Patrick the owner. The room was shabby for what we paid, then we found out that our room wasn't booked out to us even though I had corresponded with him on several occasions stating the exact dates we would be staying, he then went on to say the amount he had quoted was actually for one night and not three nights even though I had repeated the dates in EVERY SINGLE EMAIL I had sent him, I even asked for the full total of the stay as prices differed from one website to another, he quoted me the price for the three nights I had given him. He refused to look at the email correspondence between us, said point blank he wasn't interested, how rude and arrogant can you get?? He knew he was in the wrong but wasn't big enough of a man to admit it. A terrible place, terrible manager and totally ruined my first impression of New York and my birthday, thanks Patrick for nothing. I would not stay there again if it was free!!!

Stayed here for a weekend, couldn't believe how cheap this place was considering how nice it is! You get a good-sized private room like a regular hotel, but for a hostel price. Our room had a window that opened out onto the fire escape, so we got a balcony. Room had dressers, a closet, decent beds, was bright and clean. Bathrooms were quite clean too and towels are provided. There is free wifi, but only in the basement lounge. There is also a room to store your luggage, which they generously let us use even after checking out (would not store anything valuable there as all guests can access it, but it was really useful to leave our bags there). Would definitely recommend staying here on a short trip. The neighbourhood is great, very close to Columbia, feels v. safe and there are loads of nice places to eat, etc, nearby. (If you go, be sure to visit Absolute Bagels at 108th and Broadway: super close, best bagels in NY)

I'm sitting at airport now three hours before my flight just to be away from this horrible hotel. We stayed in roomed 501 and last night was a night mare. There's a guy who was in 511 right in front of the elevator that partied from ten pm to four am with women and men doing drugs drinking running up and down the halls and God knows what else. We called the front desk five times and erickas lazy self did nothing at all to assist. This is a rooming house part hotel with no award winning stickers or service. We practically begged for wash cloths but were provided with towels. Front desk is no help at all and I'm telling everyone i know to never stay here no matter the price. This place is located in Spanish Harlem not midtown as they state.
user_location: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States

review_body: I was here for a week, and was quie nice place. Quite cheap to new York and really clean. You have a metro station just few meters away and bar and restaurant close by.Few meters ago is the Smoke jazz cafe, one of the best place to enjoy a great jazz concert

We started to enquire about this hotel in January - we needed three nights towards the end of April and found very reasonable prices on booking sites. We checked with the hotel direct and were given a low price. We had noted the high regard in which Patrick was held and that influenced our decision to book. We received and returned a credit card confirmation that clearly gave the price and the correct dates. However, when we arrived the desk staff denied having a reservation for us but found a room for one night saying that Patrick would be there the following morning. When we spoke to him Patrick denied that we had been given the price for three nights and said we had to leave. He flatly refused to look at the document he had sent us or at our email correspondence. His ground for requiring us to leave (apart from being full) was that the price was far too low for three nights and we should have realised that. He became very aggressive (verbally but not physically) and I was getting so stressed by the way in which he was addressing me that I had to walk away. A quick check has just shown that for February next year the prices quoted are roughly what we were given for April this year. We have checked again since we arrived home and at no time was the rate referred to as a nightly rate. On every occasion we gave the same three days and these dates never changed. The amount we ended up having to pay for the one night was slightly more than half what we had been quoted for three nights. The hotel to which we moved was considerably more expensive but considerably better. I found Patrick to be difficult, unreasonable and unpleasant to deal with and this has been by far my worst experience in four visits to New York City.

I can't even describe the smell in the hotel. Me and my partner literraly had to hold our breath every time we came back to the hotel.The service and the cleanliness were OK.Suggestion: go for the rooms in lower floors

We booked a triple room with shared bathroom and stayed in the hotel for 9 days.The first day we arrived earlier than the checkin time, aroun 11am, the hotel manager kindly offered to keep our luggage until our room was ready.We got room 406, it has one double bed and a single, a large TV a small fridge and a closet. There are two bathrooms in the 4th floor and a kitchen with a sink, a microwave and an oven, you can cook there if you have the proper gear because there are no pans or other cooking items. We never had issues using the shared bathroom, at least one of them was always available whenever we wanted to use it and the kitchen was always clean.As mentioned on other reviews the beds make noises everytime you move but it is not impossible to sleep over them. An important topic to mention is Wi-Fi, we had good coverage in our room and never had to go to the lobby to use Internet.The location of the hotel is a pretty good one, it is only three blocks away from the 110th Street-Cathedral Pkwy station, therefore making trips to downtown Manhattan is a very easy task. That station belongs to line 1 and runs directly to Times Square.The closest avenue to the hotel is Broadway and you'll find all sort of grocerie stores nearby (D'Agostino, Rite Aid, Duane Reade and Garden of Eden are very close). If you walk to the side opposite to broadway you'll reach Central Park, it takes a 10 minute walk to get there.I was a bit skeptic about staying there but I'm glad we chose the place.I recommend this hotel for the price, location and quaIity of the rooms.

For someone staying on a budget in New York for a few days and not planning to stay in their room for the time there, this is perfect. Rooms are quite clean. Bathrooms are fine too. Possibility of storing luggage, even before and after checking in/out. The staff is professional. Very near to a subway stop. Walking distance of the Cathedral of Saint John the Divine (world's 4th biggest church - nice to check out). The price suits the place, i.e. shouldn't be cheaper nor more expensive for NYC. However, watch out for the elevator, smells more than BAD. Also, don't relly on them for a wake up call.

Being two college students at the time, we needed something on a budget. While this is a hostel, we made sure we picked a room in which we had our own bathroom. Everything is very small and it's hard to move around. However, it was worth having a small room for our own bathrooms. The beds were very small as well. I'm only 5'7 and my feet were nearly off the bed. The staff was friendly, though. The location is nice as well. We were just a Subway ride away from Times Square. I felt very safe in the neighborhood. We were also a walk away from Central Park. If you're young and looking for a budget, this isn't a bad deal.

We stayed in the deluxe room,. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. The location was awesome. It is a simple room but had a fridge. Located close to the subway, yummy restaurants and markets. WIll stay here again. It is a basic budget hotel but it is great. If you have a street facing rooms I would recommend earplugs but that is a-ok.

We were a group of 14 that visited NYC for an Interdisciplinary Art Department Trip. Everything with the Morningside Inn made us feel comfortable and at ease when we were not busy visiting NY's museums. It is a recently renovated facility but yet boasts the original character and architecure of the building. The location is great and allows you to easily navigate through the city by walking, or catching the subways and taxis. Mr. Patrick (the general manager) and his crew provided us with everything our group requested and even arranged for fleet service back to the airport. Looking for a place with plush towels, marble floors and down-filled comforters? This is the place!

We (me and my wife) stayed at 4th floor for 7 days. The room was good and the bathroom ok. A very quiet local, good for rest. Theres a metro station 3 blocks near e the central park is 3 blocks to. There is a bus station 1 block near where you can get the M60 bus to em from La Guardia airport. The manager, Patrick, was very kind with us. The price is not so cheap, but that's New York city, right?! We would stay there again and recommend the morning side inn hostel to everybody.

this hotel was horrible! we had come off a 20 hour flight, and were exhausted, and we entered our hotel room and found one double bed that barely fit in the room. we also had a communal bathroom in which we had to share with many others. the doors didnt lock either, which meant we had to take all valubles with us!!!!

I have been staying at morningside inn when I travel to New York for about eight years. I absolutely love it here. Patrick, the manager, is awesome and always takes great care of us. Wendy is also wonderful. I would and do recommend this place to anyone going to New York. It is affordable and right by a subway stop that takes you to downtown. The neighborhood is great and you are blocks away from Riverside park, a great place for a run.

Overall the hotel was ok. Great location to everything nyc has to offer. Only complaint is the wall where thin you can hear everything that is going on in the rooms next to you. I had a budget room, which came with a bed, dresser and a shared bathroom.

I went to NYC for four nights by myself and was very pleased with my experience there. I am a 23yr old female and felt very comfortable there. I have stayed in several hostels in the city and this was the best deal. I only had a basic room with no bathroom or tv, but with it just being me, I didn't need those things. Anyways you do not need a tv while visiting nyc! You have the whole city to explore and watch. Having a basic room at that price was exactly what I wanted. If I can save money by not having a private bathroom, then I definitely want that, especially if I'm just traveling by myself. The shared bathrooms where kept clean anyways so that was nice. I had lots of storage space within the room for clothing or whatever. The thing that stood out most to me however was how kind the staff was to me. Everyone was so nice! I have been to other hostels where the staff wasn't as welcoming so this was great, it really means a lot to me when people are so kind.
