I accidently locked my key in my room and the woman at the front desk during the late night shift was very nice about helping me get back in. I was worried that I would be seen as a pain but she was so pleasant and helpful. Overall this is a great place if you are looking for a budget room, like I was. It is so much cheaper than a regular hotel and I like the more personal feel with a smaller place. Thanks so much and I will definitely be back next time I visit nyc, which will be soon!! Love you ladies and gents!

My partner and I stayed at Morningside Inn in September last year. We were very happy with the location as it was only a short walk to the subway and central park. We stayed in a double room with use of shared bathroom and kitchen. Facilities were basic (no pots, pans or cutlery in the kitchen) and we could only get internet connection downstairs in the lobby. We stayed for 4 nights and got a great nights kip every night as hotel is located off the main road in a quiet road. Perfect for travellers who like a bargain, a great location and peace and quiet. Food, shops and atm within 5 minutes walking distance.

This year was the third time I visited Morningside Inn after 2 good experiences. I had a reservation made though the webpage and confirmed by phone to stay a few days in a room with private bathroom. I couldn't arrive the day I was supposed to because Manhattan was closed due to the visit of Hurricane Sandy. I called them to inform the situation and they told me that there was no problem to arrive 2 days after.When I finally got there they told me that my reservation was cancelled and that they didn´t have any room available. After the shock I showed them the on-line reservation and only then they gave me a room that I wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy. It was smelly, tiny, with no bathroom, no tv. I was afraid to look under the blankets because it felt dirty. It's a terrible feeling to trust a hotel and then be received with this kind of roomThanks God I only had to stay for a night until I found another hotel.I had to pay 91$ for that room! it didn't worth 20....

My wife and I booked a room in the Morningside Inn for two nights--mostly just to sleep. Our room had a queen bed and its own bathroom, and the rate was $90/night plus tax--about 1/3 of what other discount hotels in the city wanted. The location was terrific for our needs. We stayed in room 505 and, contrary to what I've read here, we found it very clean and comfortable. The flat screen TV worked, the bathroom had fresh clean towels that appeared new, and the bed had a nice sheet and duvet--all clean. Our only complaint was that the bed was rather hard, and they only supplied two pillows (I asked for another but it never appeared). However, I would not hesitate to stay at the Morningside again and if you need a basic room for a night or two while visiting NYC, which does not kill the budget, I recommend you give it a try!

I had a good experience with This hotel. We stayed 3 nights in a triple bedroom. It was clean. The employees are very nice and helpful. The location is good, very close to the metro and In a multicultural neighbourhood with easy access to Laguardia airport by M60 bus. But don't expect anything fancy. It is an old building with shared bathrooms and Internet is not working in the room. You have to go in the lobby or basement.

Nice and clean place. 2 blocks away from subway(1-2-3 lines).Baths are sometimes not clean. But it is because of the people. A classic hostel, do not expect hotel comfort. Rooms are not big, as of any hostel in NYC.

My flight was delayed by 3 hours and I checked in after midnight or I would have looked elsewhere. Only reason I was in this inn was an error in booking my next accommodation was made and this place was given as an option.....they have been informed of the state of this inn.It is a lower cost place ($105.00 per night) - but I would not recommend it unless there are no other optionsavailable( WIFI is only available in the front reception area - other guests sitting on the stairs on their computers - poor WIFI signal from conversations with these people)OK - to begin - I had trouble finding the room within this Inn. After getting my luggaqe up to the 4th floor in the tiniest elevator I have ever been on I searched for 412 troughout the whole 4th floor. I had to go back to the lobby and was informed that I should have turned right and go through the door at the end of the hall - but make sure I closed the door behind me as my room was 4 inches behind this hallway door into a dark hallway. Written in felt pen on the door was the number 412 in what looked more like a storage cupboard. There was a dresser, a small mattress wrapped in plastic and it had a yellowed fitted sheet on it and a folded flat sheet ...that's all. No towels, no blanket, no bed spread, there was pieces of garbage on the floor as there was no garbage pail. I put my luggage in room, locked the door and went back to the lobby and the receptionist came back up with me and was surprised at the condition of the room as well. -Said that it must not have been cleaned?? She went off - but was not able to find me a blanket, she brought 4 extra flat sheets and a single towel, and face cloth. ( No offer to make up the bed) Now the bathroom.... It also took a while to find it - (yet another trip to the lobby) - Found it was locked, so never did see the one closest to the room. (keep in mind this is all happening after midnight) Found one at the other end of the Inn and it was not clean. Shower/tub was full of body hair! Toilet not flushed!! No toilet paper?? ( Found out next morning that they supply TP in the guest room...but as I did not have even towels so it was understandable that I would not have TP either) Upon return to room I saw a small four legged, long tailed creature dash down the hall - Put on a jogging suite and socks, put up the hood and lay on the bed waiting for morning. Did not sleep well at all, noise from rain, other rooms and it and was very glad to depart to a wonderful B&B uptown. ( FYI - I own a B&B/Inn in B.C. Canada and know how things should be done - not this way -trust me).

The hotel is very well located, near to a subway station. I spent six nights there, the first four in a Deluxe Apartment Suite with a couple of friends and the last two alone in a Private Bath room. The location is great, and overall I have no real complaints. Both rooms were clean, staff was nice enough, and, most of all, it was affordable. They have a little room where you can leave your luggage if needed, but they're not responsible for your belongs and just give the key alway to any guest. They entered our room for cleaning with us there more than once, yet gave us just one key to a room that can acommodate up to five people. But I will definetly stay there next time I'm in NYC. I'm used to all kinds of hotels, and this is a simple, good enough one, in a city that makes you wanna do anything but sleep or study the ceiling of your hotel room!

The staff were very helpful & friendly. the room was a twin bedded on e. Very clean, clean bedlinen..basic but clean!! only problem was somebody having an argument at 2am in morning.....otherwise o.k. Bathroom was 2 doors down and spotless!! Only stayed one night but was v. good value.

Great place to stay a excellent value for your money. Close to manhattan and there were a lot of places in the immediate area to eat and party. The public transportation is very close also I will recommend this place all my friends!!!

I booked 3nights stay at morningside inn online. Upon arrival on 19/10, I was told that the room was unavailable for the first night. I was not informed at all before arrival.However, the hotel staff had arranged for me to spend the first night at another hotel at street 88. I was told to pay the other hotel staffat street 88us$ 175 for 1night stay & when I return to morningside inn the balance of $80 at checkout for 2nights stay at morningside. Inaddition, they would hire a cab for my transfer to hotel at street 88. I was told to retain my receipt for redemption of cab fee from the manager. I did as I was told. However, the manager refused to give me the cab fee later & denied that they had made the offer to redeem the cab fee for me. I was also charged $105 instead of 80for the remaining 2 nights, supposedly for city tax.The cab fee was onlyusd$18 but I was unhappy that the staff did not honour their word. Inaddition, the toilet flush in 1of the common bathrooms broke down on second evening of my stay & could not be repaired till the next day. Also, I was locked inside their 1 of their toilets on 2 occasions. The door lock was faulty. 2 other tourists had the same problem over the 3 days & were locked inside that toilet as well.I had to unlock the door & rescue 1 lady from the bathroom after her shower. I had told the manager abt the problem but the lock was still dysfunctional over 3 days!

I would like to lodge a complaint against the Morningside Inn 235 107th St New York, NY. I made a confirmed reservation on line with a deposit through my credit card for a new night stay at the Inn. I arrived at 10:30 pm with my 10 year old daughter and my immunosuppressed disabled sister-in-law (we were in town to see her daughter). We were told there had been a mistake and they had no rooms. We were told this happens frequently. A young woman spent an inordinate amount of time trying to deal with us but told us she had no authority to help us in anyway except to call another hotel. We had to go stay at a hotel with which more than twice as expensive and very far away. By the time we arrived it was 12:30 pm. The next day I called to try to speak to the manager starting at 8:00 am. One number on their card listed as “switch board” did not work at all. The other number was never answered and so I left a series of messages saying we assumed we would have a place to stay for the second night but could not travel all the way back up town as we only had one day in NYC and we wanted to sight-see, not spend hours dealing with the hotel and for the manager to please call back. When we made it back up at 5 pm there was a new young woman with no authority telling us she had no room for us. She could not reach the manager and claimed we had not called but then played one of the messages I had left that said “Hi, I am calling again…” She told us the manager was not allowed to call us back as it was an “out of town” number. She could not reach the manager. Another 1 and ½ hours later (lots of time when you have ONE day in NYC), we took the subway to another much less desirable neighborhood for a more expensive hotel. Upon arriving home I called the manager (Patrick) who was unbelievably rude, never apologized, only offered to refund the deposit and claimed again I could have never left a message for him. He finally hung up on me. This situation seems especially wrong as they surely would have kept a full night’s fee had I not shown up. Is there no recourse?Thank you for your time.

I stayed at the Morningside Inn for 3 nights in Oct 2012. Firstly they gave me a key to a room where somebody was sleeping and had all their belongings. After that error they "upgraded" me to a new room and assured me that nobody would have access to my room key. The upgrade wasn't exactly special; and it probably meant that the person who booked that room got downgraded. The beds are almost unsafe; they have springs poking into your body and make a noise whenever you move. Impossible to sleep. I was woken on the second morning to the sound of my room heater blowing steam from a small piston that could not be turned off. I thought it was going to blow up. My room heated up so much that I had to go outside and I feared for my belongings. It happened to all the heaters in the hotel and everyone went to reception, only to be told that she didn't know what to do and that the manager wasn't answering his phone. The whole place smells of bleach, the staff didn't speak English when they were trying to assign me a room and I felt very uncomfortable, like I was an inconvenience to them, when it was their error for giving me an occupied room. All in all it was a very disappointing experience not like anything displayed on their website. Also they have lots of hidden taxes that they charge you for. The staff are obviously not trained properly or cared for by the manager.I'd recommend that you do not stay here!!

I had read the many reviews of this Hotel and having booked through another booking service and not directly with the Hotel I heeded the advice of others and tried to email them at least twice to ensure they had my reservation even though I had the email to prove it and had paid a 10% reservation fee. No reply to email sent to the web site so just before leaving tried the other email on the Hotel site and received a confirmation notice. Just as well because when we arrived from the airport with printed out reservation in hand we were told that we were not on their system and the Hotel was full. It wasn't until I provided proof with the 'confirmation' email from the Hotel that they took us seriously. The receptionist was very nice and tried to sort it out by ringing the Manager but he did not respond and then the lady for the evening shift appeared. We ended up being given someone else's booking for the first night at a lesser standard than we had reserved and were told that we would have to move in the morning and the Manager would sort it out. So back we went the following morning at 0800 and met the Manager (who was very nice also) who told us we could leave our rooms in another room which would be ours after it was cleaned on our return. We returned late that night to find our bags had been moved to a smaller room but at least it had an ensuite. The bed was so uncomfortable as you could feel the wires & springs through the covers. In the end they never charged us so we only paid the deposit for the 2 night stay. The location was close to the metro but still some way from the central shopping area but pretty close to Central park. Make sure you have written proof of reservations when you arrive otherwise you might be left looking for alternative accommodation.

I'm not giving 1 star but I should. It was my first trip to NY and this hotel was terrible. It was on Holydays so price were very high everywhere, but this place was cheaper than the other (100/night). The only reason I give this hotel 2 stars, is the Absolute Bagels. BEST BAGEL EVER !!! They put like an inche of cream cheese. SO DELICIOUS !! But the hotel room was microscopic, walls are like paper and the personnal are not very helpful. Pay a little bit more and you'ill get a better place than this.

Old and tired with small rooms. Free wifi downstairs but not in rooms. The location is excellent, just minutes away from the subway, supermarkets and laundrette. Microwaves are available, and there is a fridge in the room. The price is the big drawcard. You will not find cheaper in Manhattan.

I stayed for the last week of july and i actually liked it a lot! the place is not so fancy but the staff helped me a lot during my trip since i didnt have a way to print anything or to look up directions on my not so expensive phone from mexico i kept bothering the young girl for directions on how to get places so the staff is very friendly...the wifi doesnt work that well in the rooms and thats a major no no... but i would just go downstairs to the lobby and use it there. the neighborhood is really nice i felt safe even after coming back at 3am (which you cannot do in mexico). the rooms are clean and house keeping was given daily when i stayed there. the rooms are really small but then again thats new york! overall a GREAT stay i would definitely come back in the near future to book again here. Ana Teresa- Chiapas, Mexico

We booked two nights in a budget room with a double bed. It was very hot and there was no AC but no complaints here, since it was advertised that budget rooms do not have AC. The ceiling fan was whobbling and hitting the ceiling making a noise that I could hear from the next door shared bathroom. The location is pretty good. You are 3 blocks away from the 110th street subway station which is serviced by the red line that can get you downtown, but be advised that it is not an express line and it stops in every single station there is, so if you need to get to Times Square, for example, you will have 9 stops along the way.The most frustrating thing was that the total due on arrival as per the booking information was not in fact the final total due. Oh yes, there were taxes! Would it kill anyone to put an extra line in the final due computation that states the tax amount??!! For two nights it was an additional 35 dollars worth of taxes and fees. The invoice had some 5 separate lines with different taxes adding towards the final amount due. We have stayed in a couple of other budget places but have seen such practice for the first time. We compared prices with other establishments before booking and it would have helped a lot in making a better decission, should the tax be included in the advertised price.The bed had a mattress with springs that were hurting the back, plus the bed was so noisy that you couldn't make a slight move in it without waking up the other person. I am almost sure that the neighbours could hear it too, as I deffinitely could hear them.The sheets looked crisp and washed but were still stained. This was desgusting. Is it that much of a cost to buy new linens from time to time? The room was extremely small (under 2 feet of space on each side of the bed), but I guess that is something you can expect in Manhattan. Staff at the reception was neither too friendly nor rude, no major complaints there. All in all, I am sure that for this kind of money or maybe for a little more extra, one can find a better place to stay and in a better location.

This was our final destination at a two month tour and found it a nice place to stay. The bed was really comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well. The place also had a shared kitchen area which had an oven and microwave, just no cutlery or plates etc to cook with. It is a good location for central park and it is in a nice area in general. The room however was small and we struggled for space, but there are drawers to keep your clothes in and a television if you just want some home comforts. The staff are also very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here for a few nights in July...good points: en-suite room, safe neighbourhood, tv in room, excellent air con close to underground and restaurants/supermarkets.Points for improvement: clean sheets every night (pretty sure they are just sprayed with air fresher), friendly staff who can answer questions rather than come back tomorrow and speak to..., total cost to be paid on arrival includinging tax, updated beds and mattresses.Like the title treat this like a middle of the range youth hostel

For the price it was good, but on the reservations it didn't say that there was a 16% tax and a $3.50 a person tax making it $145 a person not $133 like we thought. The celling fan was loud but not as bad as the A/C which is a window unit. The elevator fit one person plus lugauge. The fridge in the room smelled, there was a kitchen but no tools. The shared bathroom was for like 8 other rooms so sometimes we had to up a floor. The internet signal was so bad we couldn't get it on the 2nd floor room. The night guy was very helpful though.

At $140 a night, even in Manhattan, I would expect a reasonably comfortable bed and clean linens. Our bed had springs that cut into our backs, there was no mattress cover, and the towels and washcloths were stained. Euw. Hallways are narrow, dark, and a little smelly. The hotel advertised Internet service, but most of the time it could only be accessed in the lobby. People stand around in the lobby and sit all over the stairs to check their email, because the management apparently doesn't see fit to place chairs in the lobby. The front desk staff was not unfriendly, but not friendly either. They basically ignore the guests. We saw staff sleeping a couple of times. The hotel has minimal security, as the front door is always open, and the staff is not alert. What DOES this hotel have to recommend it? Good air-conditioning and a fantastic location. The Upper West Side and Morningside Heights are vibrant, safe neighborhoods with dozens of fantastic restaurants and a diverse, friendly local population. I'd recommend finding another place in the same area.

We stayed here for 8 days and couldn't have been happier. If you are looking to stay in your hotel room all day or in the hotel itself and lounge around a pool then this place is not for you. However, if you are looking for a basic room for a reasonable price to use as your base for what you plan to do in New York then the Morningside will fit your bill. When we checked in we were told because of the length of our stay they would try and upgrade us at not charge when a bigger room was available. Within two days we were offered to upgrade (we were in a 3 person room)but chose not to because we were comfortable. The rooms all have fridges and there is cooking facilities on all floors. We shared a bath but never had a problem getting a shower or using the restroom. Very good location, close to subway and many eating establishments. There are also at least two markets close by, the one on 110th street right by the subway stop was excellent. I would definintely stay here again. Staff was friendly, beds changed daily. Welcomed the air conditioner that worked great since it was in the high 90s while we were there. Would recommend to anyone looking for this type of hostel type hotel.

It’s not easy to find a reasonable priced decent room with en-suite bathroom in Manhattan. Therefore I felt happy when I found this place which I think it’s a good option if your wish is to sleep in the Big Apple.The location is good and the area is safe. Subway line 1 has one stop at 103rd Street and another one at 110th Street, so both stations on Broadway are very close to 107th Street -a nice street by the way- where the hotel is.This area in the Upper West Side contains also many small businesses, cafes and restaurants (we tried, f.ex., “Tropical Sensation”, in Amsterdam Av. between 106th Street and 107th Street, “Mama’s Pizzeria” on the corner between Amsterdam Av. and 106th Street, and we heard good reports of “The Manchester Diner”, on the corner between Broadway and 108th Street).Concerning our stay, we have to say that although we had booked a Superior Two room, they gave us a Superior One in the 6th floor. So we went down to the front desk, we explained the situation and then they offered us the possibility to stay in room #109 which is in the Ground Floor beside reception but which I believe to be a Deluxe Double room (I’m attaching some pictures). So we had a look, we liked it (because it has 2 beds and an en-suite bathroom) and we stayed here without paying more than what a Superior Two room costs.Room #109 has 2 comfortable beds, a very small bathroom, a flat screen TV, air conditioning and 2 windows facing the street’s sidewalk (fortunately 107th street is not busy, so it is quiet enough). Both the room and the bathroom were very clean and were also cleaned daily, so we value positively this place although there is no breakfast, no guest computer and the staff doesn’t seem to be very enthusiastic.

really a dump with shared baths, worn out furniture, dirty corridors, and no internet. I've reserved it by mistake for its proximity to Columbia University. Location is OK - in the Upper West Side near Central Park but close to Harlem

This hotel is very basic if that. The bed was all springs so very hard to sleep but is was quiet. I requested a wake up call at 6:00 am but never got a call and luckily since I could not sleep on the springy bed I was awake anyway. The location was good and right next to the bus to LaGuardia and the subway. I won't go back.

The neighborhood is nice. It has pharmacies, supermarkets and cafes nearby. The metro is about five minutes walking.The staff is friendly . It has free wifi in the lobby area.The room was small and clean. My only complain is the mattress, it was noisy and felt like sleeping on a hammock

The location is quite good, it is easy to find and in conventional distance from public transport. The prize is good for new York, but it requires some reparations.rooms are clean and small ( cleaned everyday) but what else you need for sleeping.we had some doubts about the safety of rooms, because our room door did not fit quite enough, so we checked everyday whether anything miss and fortunately nothing. What was the most negative feature of this hostel were toilets and bathrooms. One did not work at all and one got broken during our stay. Otherwise I think it was a good deal for New York and we really enjoyed our stay. We love New York!!!!

The rooms are incredible small, unclean and damaged. The toilettes were disgusting! My friend locked the door and couldn't open it after, so it took here 1/2 an hour to get free! The people were not very friendly. The Location was the only part I liked about this stay!

The Morningside Inn is situated in a great part of the Upper West Side for travelers. It is only 3 blocks north or south of the subway entrance being 110th on Broadway or 103rd on Broadway which puts you on the red line. We had room 106 which is on the bottom floor & as it was close to the elevator a few times it was a bit noisy but no real problem. The room was neat & tidy with two double beds, fridge, R/C A/C, shower in the bath,flat screen TV, ceiling fan hand basin & bar heater. Small items of repair that the room needs are: tiles coming up in floor of bathroom, security chain on the door needs to be replaced, door lock & latch on entrance door to the room need to be replaced as while they where function able, the door did not close entirely. There is a communal Kitchen with a microwave & stove on each floor except the lower & there are stairs & elevator to go up & down on. In the basement there is the laundry which the washing machine worked ok but the dryer was U/S in the four days we where there. Also in the basement there is a common room where the internet works the best, which is also free. There is a vending machine for coke & the likes as well as chips. If you need other coin op Laundromats there is one on 107th & Amsterdam where the dryers are great & one on 107th & Broadway where the machines are very clean but not as hot. There is a market on 107th & Broadway which is excellent for getting food to eat in your room & with the microwave you can heat up food at a later date. I had paid for breakfast but when I booked in the receptionist said they no longer do breakfasts LL no real problem as you can get breakfast anywhere in NYC but the convenience would have been great. TV at reception was a bit noisy one night but when asked for them to turn it down a bit it was no problem. My wife & I had NO PROBLEMS at this hotel while we stayed there & the items I have pointed out are just on going repairs that need doing & not a INCONVENIENCE. For the price we paid I am more than happy & would recommend the Morningside Inn as a place to stay while in NYC

Me and my wife were last week in this hotel for 4 nights. It's clean hotel with simple and small rooms. Room was equiped by aircondition, satTV, bathroom, fan. They cleaned room and changing towels every day. Personal on reception was unfriendly and boring. Hotel is equiped with free wifi.

Just spent another night in Morningside Inn (been there at least 6+ times) and again I agree with an earlier reviewer - it is an excellent value. No, the rooms are not enormous and the toiletries are meager - but the hotel and rooms are clean and it feels safe and the beds are decent. What else you need for the price I don't know. If so, go pay 3-5 times the price elsewhere for a place that gives you fancier soap....but for my money and NYC experience the place always fits the bill and I have never had an issue with the front desk or any of the staff. In my trips in NYC about 4 times a year I always hope they have a room left and am delighted when they do.
Clean place, but it's as if the hotel scrimped on wherever it could scrimp. Front desk also acts like they're being bothered if you ask them anything.

Just stayed here for 4 nights; had room 301. Service was good: fresh towels every day, bed made up. WiFi worked for me in the 3rd floor, even though they admit it might not reach higher than the 2nd. No problems even with larger photo uploads.There is an alternative lounge/room for Internet too. Cell reception is non-existent though!The fridge in the room is nice, but I only used it as a table. A table and a chair would have been more useful actually. Walls and doors are really thin. You can hear people walk and talk when passing by like they are inside the room. Luckily other guests were pretty civilized. Water pressure and temperature is excellent, but the shower has only a fixed head, I don't like that. There is a TV in the room, but unfortunately mounted left and pretty high up from the be, so the viewing angle is close to unusable.The location is really good imho. Grocery, Radio Shack, a pub around the corner and subway a few blocks away; so is Central Park. The M60 bus to LGA is also very close if you need that.

Hi there ! Just got back from NYC a few hours ago, I've spent 7 nights in this upper west side Inn I was a little worried about it when I saw other comments about the place. Also, they never answer emails don't even bother and on the phone they are preatty rude. For a group of four girls, we too, the ground-floor deluxe suite. It was really not expenses, 50 buck per person and per night, what would you excpect for that price ? Well, we had a small appartment, very well located, and cleaned every day. You enter a corridor and there is a huge bedroom on the left .On the right a nice bathroom. Then you enter a room that is supposed to be a small living room with a sofa bed for two and a small kitchen. The kitchen is really appreciated for breakfast cooking, coffee, et.... A table for for people is also there so you can enjoy a bottle of wine and sushis. The subway is right there 3 blocks away, line 1. This is not fancy but affordable. It is a little cold insinde and there is no light coming from outside but who cares as have a nice place to sleep and you are not going to spend much time in. You have to leave the room a 11 a.m but can leave your luggage in the basement. There is a nice delly opens 24h on block away on amsterdam and 108 "Columbia Delly" with yummi sandwiches.Enjoy NY, I already miss it :-) Cheers

Convienent Upper West Side location to Central Park, Columbia University, eclectic dining and public transportation. Other than that, rooms are extremely small with bare bones furnishings ----- definitely a no frills place. Room and bathroom were clean, although bathroom could use some refurbishing. Staff not overly friendly. For $155 and a one night stay it was tolerable.The hotel advertises recent updates, yet I think this applies only to the new lobby doors (which, by the way, open opposite to what one expects; push to get in and pull to go out; I thought all egress doors had to open outward, not inward, but perhaps NYC has different regulations).Doubt that I will ever book or recommend this to a friend.

This hotel is absolutely fine. It's in a great location near Central Park and near some nice little restaurants and easy access to the subway. It was expensive for wht we got, but thats understandable as it was late december right before new year. Plus hotels and hostels are generally quite expensive in NYC. We were given a free upgrade, which was nice as we werent exepecting a private bathroom. Only downside was a noisy heating pipe in our room, but we just used earplugs to sleep and the pipe helped us dry our washing! I would reccomend.

We stayed in Morningside Inn during 2011-2012 Christmastime and New Year’s Eve. We chose it due to PRICE x LOCALIZATION combination. The neighborhood was quiet and safe, just 3 blocks to subway station. The room was very clean and comfortable, no cigar smoke smell in any place; 32 inches TV with many channels; good bed (no bed bugs); friendly staff (especially Patrick and Denise); Good bathroom and very good daily cleaning service. The only bad point was the wireless LAN that does not reach the upstairs rooms and all guests had to stay at the first floor for connecting their laptops/tablets to Internet.

I stayed at Morningside Inn during Christmas time. Of course the rates are higher in this season, but the manager (Patrick) was kind enough to make some arrangements for me to stay in a room with a bathroom for a slightly lower cost since I was travelling with my underage niece. He is a very nice person. Denise, the night-shift receptionist, is also nice, friendly and polite. Very different from one of the morning-shift receptionists, the brunette one, who is extremelly unfriendly and impolite. The cleaning girls are also nice.The hotel is average. Bad points: internet access only at the lobby - which gets pretty crowded when many guests want to go online... - no breakfast (but it seems they're starting having it soon), the heating system is not very efficient, the stove in the kitchen on my floor was not working. Good points: Most os the staff is nice, the rooms are kind of small but comfortable (mattresses a little noisy...), cable tv, well located (near grocery stores, general stores, central park and subway station). Overall, a good hotel. Maybe the rates could be a little lower. I recommend it.

First of all the staff here are just amazing! We were worried due to the lack of email responses however apon arrival we had a great South African lady help us out. With no surprise due to the lack of emails our booking had been messed up but she was able to fix the solution (which doesn't happen a lot we've noticed). Even all the maids are lovely and helpful. - Transport - good heaps of local train stations at $2.25 per trip- Locations - Its cheap so ok but further south (downtown was nicer)- Staff - Fantastic- Rooms - Preferably get the upgraded rooms with ensuits.. alot better (we stayed in both)- WIFI - Doesn't actually reach your room you have to sit on the floor in the lobby- 2nd Floor - DO NOT STAY ON THIS FLOOR - everyone shares a bathroom and forgets that the doors slam.. so all night you are woken up to banging and stupid girls giggling. 4th floor was fine...

We were in New York for New Years eve so it was very pricey not matter where we went. If you want to email them a question... DONt Bother.. they never got back to me.. There was a big muddle up with my booking and it was very frustrating. There was a beautiful south African lady at reception. She upgraded us she was very approachable! as was the other lady! The men.. (im not sexist!) but dnt bother... they dont care about customers only about gtting a break to watch the telly!! Rooms- Dont expect clean just expect basic. (perfect for what we needed) Subway - Very close by.. Try get off on the 110th 1 line not the one further away... its a lil more dodgy. Location: OK not super safe but stay on the main roads u will be fine WALKING: It took us about 1 hr to wak into time square.. Straight down broadway.Breakfast-NOT INCLUDEDKitchen- Staff forgot to tell us there is full kitchen facilities on site!! All in all.. Its good for a budget travelller.. Wouldnt rave about it nor reccommend it.

The hotel is centrally located, with underground stations close by. Plenty of eating places within walking distance.Room quality is not great. We opted for a double room. The bed was comfortable but the room was not very clean. The carpet was stained, bathroom not mopped and cleaned thoroughly everyday. I had dropped a few hairs on the bathroom floor and they stayed there for 4 days. Hotel quality can be improved. Staff is friendly and approachable.

Was already familiar with the neighborhood (as familiar as one can be with NYC after 4 years away), so I knew this was where I wanted to stay. Very limited lodging options in this neck of the woods, but I fully recommend it to get a true local experience. No sign out front in this quiet (again, relative), residential street. As others have noted, a safe area, but don't be careless. Clean and basic, felt like a dormitory almost. Myself and two buddies got a standard triple room with one full and one single bed. Tight quarters for 3 grown men, but it wasn't awful. Reasonable closet space, dresser, fridge, small tv hanging from the ceiling. Fresh towels and soap daily, beds made up. Did not have a private bath, but rarely had to wait to use the one on our floor. Kitchen wasn't really stocked with anything, but if you were staying a while and got your own stuff, it would really help. We just got some snacks from the West Side Market, a quintessentially New York local grocer. Grab the house special at the Hungarian Coffee Shop around the corner to start your day off right. Bedding is basic, but adequate. I can't imagine how some of these bed divas would have survived in earlier eras. The three of us thought they were fine. No noise issues. Easy access to the 1 train, which can get you just about anywhere. Unless you have physical limitations or deep pockets, don't bother with cabs. The system is easy to learn, cheap, reliable, quick, and provides great people-watching.Internet was only available in the little sitting area next to the front desk, but free and clear. I emailed the property with some questions a few days before going and never got a response. They may have been offended that I used the term 'hostel.' My bad. I think there was one other negative, but I forget what it was. I work in a 5-star joint, so I had to seriously adjust my expectations, but what I found was a great value in a great spot in NYC. With the same budget, it's where I'd stay again.Tip: don't ignore the local sites. The Cathedral of St. John the Divine is breathtaking, as is Riverside Church. Grant's Tomb, Harlem's main drag, the northern wilds of Central Park, and Columbia University are all walkable and worth the time.
We stayed there for one week and we loved it, Patrick was the best ! The staff is really nice and everyone really helpful. Recommend it if you wanna stay on Manhattan.Love to you guys from Iceland :)

We have returned from our second trip to NYC and once again stayed at the Morningside Inn because we felt that the neighborhood is very safe and the hotel had all we needed to be comfortable. We noticed two buckets of tools along the sideway walking to the hotel that sat there for three days which shows what a safe and quiet street that it is. It is an easy ride from downtown on the subway and a $2.50 bus ride on the M60 from La Gaurdia. If you buy a seven day metro pass as you leave the airport at a cigarette stand, you can use it for the M60. On the street corner of the Morningside Inn is a lovely floral shop which had beautiful Christmas decorations in the window. Next door to it is a very well organized grocery store with delicious fruit on the street. Plus, there is a bagel shop, Absolute Bagels, next to it. There were also restaurants in the neighborhood. Patrick at the office printed us out directions to use the metro system for anywhere that we asked him to do so. There was also a metro system map which we picked up at the office window. Each day the maid straightened our room and left fresh towels. In our estimation, this is an excellent choice for budget travelers so that their money can be spent for all the city has to offer. As we told Patrick, we felt very safe at the Morningside Inn, and we felt that we had come home. We will stay there again and will recommend it to friends

We chose the Morningside Inn for it’s upper west side location and value pricing. We reserved a superior 1 room which had an ensuite bath and a tv. The room was very small and Spartan, but that is to be expected for a budget hotel in New York. The room was clean and the bathroom had been updated. The elevator is small, but even though the hotel was full, we never had to wait very long.The worst part about our stay was the bed. It was very uncomfortable – you could feel every spring in the mattress. The pillows were also terrible. The tv was mounted next to the head of the bed, making it awkward to watch.The location was ideal for us. The subway is a few blocks away. The hotel is located between Amsterdam and Broadway. Both of these streets are lined with cafes, so there was an ample supply of reasonably priced dining options. The area felt very safe. We enjoyed getting bagels and coffee for breakfast at Absolute Bagels around the corner on Broadway. There is also a market that sells fresh fruit.This is a decent choice for budget travelers who just want a clean place to sleep after sightseeing.

This is clearly a budget hotel and lives up to that expectation. The furniture and the space in the room was the barely necessary, not an inch more or less. The corridors, carpets, paper-thin walls, tiny elevator... you just recognize the budget constraints everywhere. The service at the reception, same thing. The kitchen is absolutely basic, so you will just warm up a pizza in the microwave, period. The wifi works in some parts of the hotel only. However, the prices correspond to what you get. This is a place to sleep that will be clean and correct. You will have maps and some basic touristic info at the reception. No extras, no fuss, no luxury... just basic comfort in a good residential location near to many shops and subway.

I spent there only one night. Clean, shared bathroom outside the room. In reality was dedicated to our room only while the second room was vacant.Good price and excellent location. Close to CP and Metro.

This was my first ever trip to New York, travelling on a budget with an adult son. Unsure what to expect but found the Morningside perfectly adequate for our needs. Room 306 faced the street (through a window with broken frame) and other than one area of carpet damage was large and pleasant enough. Temperatures were high (90s by day) and small aircon unit struggled to deal with this, but ceiling fan also helped. Fridge in room was brilliant, although kitchenette area severely under resourced (no pots/pans/crockery/cutlery) despite working oven and microwave. Room, shower and toilet cleaned and stocked daily. There was a communal lounge area but we didn't check this out. I loved the area, a few minutes walk from Central Park, with outstanding deli stores and a wide variety of other shops very close by, including the fantastic Absolute Bagels - OMG !! I'd be very happy to stay here again.

I reserved a Superior One room with a private bath for two weeks. I arrived early and Patrick helped me store my luggage and graciously directed me to the local eateries. The room was clean, simple and straightforward. The bathroom was spotless and the refrigerator incredibly helpful as I was on a budget and needed to get groceries instead of eating out. Room was reliably cleaned daily. I attended the Columbia University Teacher's College Reading and Writing Project and walked to school everyday. The hotel is two buildings away from corner of Broadway and the metro and busses going to every part of the city were at most, three blocks away. Central Park is also within walking distance. The hotel is located on the 1 train route, so I could get downtown, midtown or to the LIncoln Center or Columbus Circle quickly and conveniently. All of the shops and restaurants on Broadway near hotel make it unnecessary to have to go somewhere else for a good meal or personal shopping. It seemed to me that most of the guests were budget travelers and gracious. In the end, I wish I would have had in-room WiFi, but that would have cost me more :). Their WiFi in common room was fine.

Three of us stayed in a budget triple for a week, and it was just right! I work for a housing department at a university, so I was quite wary of bed bugs. I read all the reviews of different hostels in NYC, and thought to take a chance on this one. Upon arrival, I planned to take my LED flashlight to the room before we all got in there with the bags. It's almost like the front desk staff read my mind because the first thing they asked was if I wanted to check out the room, and they handed me the key. I went up, searched with the flashlight, looked on the corners of the beds, removed all the linens, and saw no signs of bed bugs. They also cover their mattresses with bed bug resistant covers. The rooms were definitely small and worn, but the public bathrooms were kept clean as well as daily housekeeping to our rooms. I know they changed our linens each day because some days we had light blue sheets and other days we had white sheets :-). The front desk staff were friendly, it was a neat building, there was an elevator, and we felt safe. I recommend it!

The Morningside Inn was a good place for our family to stay while seeing the NY sights - near the metro, a grocery store, and enough room for us to get a good night's sleep. Not a luxery suite, but very adquate for us.

Budget spartan room with nothing moveable and unnecessary stern warning not to steal the furnishings. No TV, hence the bonus that there's no TV noise next door. Quiet street. Peaceful ambience inside, and the few guests seemed largely budget-conscious young travellers. Lifts and loos erratic. However, close by is Upper Broadway, a cheerful area with almost Parisian ambience, good eating, drinking and excellent bus/metro communications .

The Morningside Inn is located on 107th Street which is in upper Manhatten. There are 2 subway stations close to the hostel (about 4 blocks)The hostel has a small lobby in the basement where you get free wifi and a chance to buy something from a vending machine.Our room had one queen size bed and another sigle bed. We were only 2 people but there was room for another one. The room itself was pretty small for 3 persons. Just enough space to get to you bed. But it was all right since we only went there to sleep. The room even had an air condition and a small fridge.The showers on the floor were ok. I ended up showering in one down the floor instead in front of our room since it was cleaner and larger.

We stayed there for 5 nights in May 2011, we booked a double bedroom with private bathroom.All in all it was OK for the price, but VERY basic and not that clean.Be warned : you MUST verify room before accepting it. We were given room 603 at first but we refused it : room was really tiny, bathroom really tiny as well, shower tap was dropping non stop, aircon had no button to switch it on or off! After refusing it, we were then given room 610, which was really larger (both room and bathroom) and aircon was working this time.Positive points :- Price : the only valuable reason to stay in this hotel : for 5 nights in a double bedroom with private bathroom, we paid only 700$- Room : the 2nd one was quite large, including a closet, a fridge, a drawer, TV and a big bathroom.- TV : lots of TV channelsNegative points :- Reception people incredibly unfriendly. I guess shouldn't expect more from a budget hotel in NY?- Be prepared for torn and unclean bathroom towels. They were changed everyday but never looked clean.- Floor was full of stains- Bed was VERY uncomfortable, we could feel the bedsprings on our backs- After 2 days we started scratching ourselves, so be warned if you are allergic!- TV was placed badly and we could hardly watch it from the bed- You can't open the windows!
Clean quiet and comfortable, all at a level reflected in the cost. Shared bathrooms were a minor problem. Room was bigger than expected.I would stay there again.

Very affordable hotel in great part of Manhatten. Wireless access was not in the room, but you have to go down into the basement which was a pain. Bathroom was very clean. There is no coffee maker in the room, but there is a fridge. I don't recommend this for a business stay, but if you don't care about amenities, I would recommend it.
Just stayed at Morningside Inn - fixed up, painted up - unbelievable value for price, clean, safe and NO BEDBUGS !!! Good stay - very happy.

We stayed in this hotel 4 days in early May. Hotel very cheap considering the conditions in NY. At this price it can not be too much to require. The hotel is located near the metro station at 110st. There is a supermarket in the area. Room was clean, but bathroom, unfortunately, was in the hallway (and definitely needs to be renewed). We had a room on the 2nd floor, so there wasn't problems with any noise from the reception. The staff is very helpful. No breakfast at the room price:(

I stayed here for almost a week and I chose it because I was looking for a place in Manhattan with just relavitely cheap price, and bathroom inside the room, without having to go to Brooklyn or another area of NY. It was a good choice because it has an underground station very near so you can move around easily (it´s almost in the beginning of Harlem, very calm area). Ok forget staying in Manhattan visiting NY is a must (brooklyn or queens might be a good place I guess, and everybody knows much cheaper and with a wider range of places to choose from).. but I didn´t think so and it´s not easy to find a hotel in Manhattan with these features and not super expensive. Rooms were average, just basic, and we indeed had some problems with the hot water since some days it just didn´t work and they were a bit slow fixing it.. place was a bit noisy and things like that, but frankly being in NY you won´t spend much time inside the room so we were ok. I guess next time with a higher bidget I won´t come back here but for someone who can´t spend much and want to stay in Manhattan, it´s a good place, why not.

This past December me and my two daughter's stayed at Morningside Inn on the upper west side of Manhattan. This made the 6th or 7th time we have stayed here. It is a great place if you are watching your pennies. It is a hostel, so no mints on your pillow, but it is very clean, safe and Patrick and his staff are wonderful. The neighborhood is very safe, and it has a lot of great restaurants within walking distance and is very close to Columbia University. Also it is only a couple of blocks from the Subway and less than a block from the bus. Would highly recommend it to anyone!!

hotel located near the Broadway Street, subway and Central Park. Quiet and safe neighborhood. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, towels changed every day. The bed was a little narrow. The bed had plastic cover under a sheet, which made it very noisy. Air conditioning was old and did not really cold down the room.

We stayed one week in this hotel and for this price in Manhattan it was really great!Room was a little old, bed was ok, not the newest one, but everything clean, fresh sheets, new towels every day, bin cleaned..We had flat TV and frigde. Although no privat bathroom, there were 2 on the floor (about 4-5 rooms) and we had no problems in the moring (3 people). Bathroom gets little dirty and full of water after a while.Lokation was excellent, 3 minutes to the Subway then like 15 to times square, little grocery markets around the corner.We had a decent stay, if you don't want to spent lot of time in the hotel a relly cheap way to go to Mahattan. Would recomend for anyone that doesn't need much luxury.

I've stayed at a variety of Manhattan hotels, but I haven't found anything better than Morningside in terms of value and quality. The rooms are extremely clean, service is friendly, and the rooms are warm in the wintertime. Moreover, the Inn is in close proximity to many excellent restaurants, pubs, and several subway stops. It's also located very near the M60 bus route from La Guardia Airport. Even though I was on a business trip and my office was paying for lodging, I still choose to stay at Morningside. I'll be back next year.

As hotel rooms are generally very expensive in NY this seems to be a good alternative. It is cheap but do not expect a categorized hotel. Pros:- very good location, just 3 min walk to Metro station line 1, 110th street from there in 12min at times square- clean bath- bed was made every day- no cockroaches, no bedbugsCons:- towel was within one week never changed (but I also did not asked)

Stayed here for one night at the beginning of December. Arrived at 2:30, which is a half hour after check-ins start. They tell me that my room isn't available! I had to wait 40 minutes for them to clean, which I'm sure just consisted of a quick vacuum. Once I entered the room, it was extremely cold. A huge draft of cold air came through both windows, and made the room unbearable when the HEAT wasn't working! YES, I was without heat the entire stay! Not to mention, I was also without hot water. Myself and many others complained about this and all management did was blame the customers for not making them aware?! They were made aware countless times and did nothing to remedy the situation, just said it was being fixed. My room was right next to their office so I had the pleasure of listening to everyone complaining about this every 5 minutes. This "hotel" is nothing but a glorified apartment. The main entrance looks nice, but once you look beyond it you'll see a building that is very old and hasn't been taken care of.

My partner and i had been recommended this accommodation by a friend who visits new york on a regular basis. We arrived to be met by a friendly, helpfull receptionist. We had booked the hotel through their own website for $965 for 7 nights however we were then told that tax had to added to this bringing the total to $1105 which was unexpected.The room had two double beds, a large flat screen tv and fridge and was clean and tidy with en suite bathroom / shower. The accomodation is about three blocks away from the broadway at 110th street metro station. We bought a 7 day metro pass at $26 each, this is excellent value as it covered all our travel for the week including our train to JFK for our return flight as apposed to $80 for a taxi.There is a Bank of America on the corner we used to change our travellers cheques and a Irish bar called O connels around the corner we used regularly. We used a fantastic deli around the corner near to the 110th street metro called West side deli where we would buy salad bowls made up toour own choice which included various types of chicken which we would take out and about with us and also dif types of soup.The one down point about the accomodaton was that our room was on the lower floor near to the reception desk and we were woken daily by the latino staffs loud talking at 7am.Apart from this cant fault it

Best price in Manhattan, 3 blocks from Subway line #1. Excellent location near Central Park, Columbia Univeristy, theater area. Very budget, no frills with shared bathroom. Better than dorms in a hostel. Clean linens, clean bathroom. Helpfull staff. Laundry available, close to shops. Ok safe neighbourhood for the experienced budget traveller.

We stayed 3 nights here, the rooms weren't the cleanest and could do with a damn good refit, but we weren't expecting much for the price. If you pay so little, you don't expect to get 5*, especially in a city like New York. The shared bathrooms were clean, we had no problems, and our room had a little sink in it which was handy. It had a fan on the ceiling, we were there in the midst of Summer and it was really hot, the fan seemed to just move the hot around, but it was better than nothing. As long as you're not expecting a first class hotel, you'll find this suits your needs, otherwise you'll need to splash out more.
The Morningside Inn is a very good hotel. The rooms are clean. The hotel is really close to a subway, food outlets and is right next door to a Church. We all enjoyed our stay!

My family just stayed at the Morningside Inn for six days. It may not be in the middle of Times Square but is accessible to wherever you might want to go easily by the subway. The metro system is a couple of very short blocks from the hotel, and as you walk home there are three grocery stores in addition to a bakery. The grocery store on the corner was the one we used and had everything you would need down to a can opener. The hotel is in a very safe, quiet residential neighborhood. We never heard any noises inside or outside the hotel during any night of our stay. There were even signs that if you honk your horn you can be fined. Coming from the Sesame Street era, I felt Big Bird was going to step out at any moment as I looked down the street.In addition, we appreciated everyone who worked at the inn. They worked tirelessly to make our stay as pleasurable as possible. The cleaning staff was always busy, and the office staff was always available and very pleasant.. I might mention that Bobby was extra nice and Patrick, the manager, could not have been nicer or more helpful, in addition to his constant smiling face. It was as though we had always known him. He certainly is to be commended.If you want a safe place to stay that doesn't cost an arm and a leg so that you can afford to go to Broadway shows and do other expensive activities, The Morningside Inn is for you and your family. We don't spend much time in our room, and it was the least expensive place I could find for three people and we were able to save a bundle in an expensive city by having a small kitchen where I could cook. We plan to go back to NYC in the future and will definitely stay there along with recommending it to friends.

I stayed in this hotel twice, once in Dec 2004 for my 21st birthday and again in Dec 2006. I do consider myself to have high standards when it comes to hotels, restaurants etc but for somewhere like New York all you need is a base! You literally need somewhere to sleep and get ready in the mornings and this place caters for that perfectly. On my first stay me and my friend had a twin room with a shared bathroom, which, looking back I would probably not do again, however we had no issues getting in to use the bathroom and the room was adequate. Ok, so not all the furniture matches and there was a loud water pipe in the room but it didnt keep us awake, so going back to my original point-it was exactly what we needed. I dont see the point in wasting valuable spending money on accommadation in a place like new York! The second stay there were three of us and we stayed in the apartment suite on the ground floor at the end of the corridor. This consisted of a double bedroom, bathroom with bath and shower, living area with a bed settee and a kitchen area with fridge, freezer, sink and table. We also had a tv in the room and loved watching the American talk shows when were getting ready! Again, it wasnt exactly something out of the pages of an interior design magazine, however it was exactly what we needed.  The location was great too, not too close to cramped midtown and not too far out that is was ever an issue to get about. The subway goes everywhere you need! Although the area is quite quiet, we never felt threatened at all.All in all both of my stays at the Morningside Inn were perfectly accectable for my needs.  If you are wanting a base to explore new York and dont want to spend too much on a hotel but want somwhere clean and comfortable, the Morningside Inn will not disappoint you. Oh and hello to the manager if you are reading this! He remembered us the second time we came and we had a few chats with him when we got in from nights out, hes great!

So My friends and I got into NYC early in the AM..we were told there was lockers to keep our stuff in so we could go and see some sights before we checked in....when we got there we had to go to the "B" and we get there and its a room with a lock on it to keep our stuff in..OK i guess...when we came back to check in we were suppose to have a Private bath,we were told the room was already taken and there was no other Private rooms with bath...so we had to stay in a room with shared bath,it wasnt that bad at all really minus the bathrooms were small and there was mold on the curtains in the shower,the bedrooms werent so bad small but not bad if your only sleeping in it which thats all we did..only time we spent in the room was to get changed between shows and go to bed....staff was very friendly and as for Patrick which alot of other ppl said he was rude and not friendly at all...we had no problem with him at all very very friendly and was very nice..i lost my $ in the machine in the lounge i went up to the desk and he was very willing to give it back to me..and he also called us a cab for he AM we were leaving..and the cab was there even be4 we were ready...I would say if your looking for some place just to sleep and not spending much time in the hotel and want something cheap this would be a good hotel..and its only a few blocks away from the subway also.And Pat your a really good guy..thanks!

Well, i didnt have much problems! I think this inn its a little far from the most important place, but the station of subway is near! There are all u need near from inn, but the bathroom sometimes were cold water, but for me its not soooooooo bad hahahahahI advice u to go there!! but for a long time!

At Morningside Inn, the idea of customer care is far below the imagined standard, infact they simple dont care about what you get. Today i was forced to have a cold shower because there was no hot water. I came down to report to the manager/man at the reception, but he was busy quarelling with one of the girl at the reception, I stood there for nearly 30 minutes! Morningside Inn is not what i can recommend to friends or any one.

The hotel's location is fantastic. Just a couple of blocks away from the subway, North Central Park and a supermarket. Safe, clean and quiet. The staff is very helpful. It only loses points because of the bathroom. It was a bit cold compared to the rest of the room. Other than that, great place. I'd stay there again.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOSTEL!I booked this dump of a hotel, that doubles as a hostel for longer-term stays on the side (probably illegally since they don't advertise it, you have to ask), for an extended stay this summer. Let's just say it was a terrible mistake, but a lesson learned! Some people in this world are just terrible people and not to be trusted. Students, do not stay here for its hostel services. Do not pay deposits to these unscrupulous people because I assure you, your integrity as a consumer will not be respected and you will not be satisfied! When I arrived, my room was not in the condition or for the price I agreed to over the phone when I paid my deposit. When the receptionist called the manager at my request, this "manager" started yelling at the receptionist over the phone, it was unbelievable! The next morning, not only was Patrick the manager completely unsympathetic to my legitimate claims, but used physical and verbal intimidation against me when I wanted to get back my deposit. As a manager of hotel, Patrick represents the worst unapologetic greed-driven, relentlessly angry, power-hungry sociopath who is in reality just a overglamorized slumlord. This type of man should not be running a hospitality business.I was so PO'ed by this service, I immediately left and found lodging in the city elsewhere, which is really not that hard to do. But, several hundreds dollars down the drain! And my one night's stay? Absolutely atrocious, I could not imagine living in those conditions for extended stay. The shared bathrooms were dirty and disgusting, the kitchen trash overflowing, bedroom furniture mismatched together, and overall architecture and atmosphere of the place resembled a 19th century tenement. I did not stay long enough to verify the many claims of bedbugs, but if it were true, that'll hardly surprise me. I'd thought to write this review as a public service for those traveling in 2010.2 words: STAY AWAY!

After much scrutiny on cost and standards, I decided to make a reservation for my 3 night stay in NYC at the Morningside Inn as it seemed a resonable balance between the two, despite some negative reviews.However on arrival I queued behind a couple trying to check in. I overheard that there on-line reservation was not received by the hotel, and thy had no rooms available. Back luck I thought.When I was greeted at the desk, I was informed that there was a problem with the room and they could not honour the reservation.So we faced the prospect of having to find alternative accomodation on a freezing NY night, at a time of year where xmas tourism is at its height.Fortunately ( if that is the right word ) - The West Side Inn was right next door. I remembered this place from my prior research, and had rejected it out of hand as it was widely regarded as a dump.However, they had rooms available - and for fear of being stranded decided to take them.To be fair to the place, it was a dump - but it was warm and resonable clean.It seems to me that Morningside Inn are accepting on line bookings to fill the rooms, but re-selling them at a higher rate if they have the opportunity.My advice, don't risk it. Stay away. They don't deserve yours or anyone elses business.

The service at this hostel is the worst I have ever encountered anywhere. They would not recognise our desosit we paid with hostelbookers, they overchrged us for the room and then expected two professionas to sleep in a single bed in a cupboard. The receptionist is uncoperative and the manger is extremely aggressive. Steer Clear. Go to the Central Park hostel instead, its only a couple of streets away and much nicer.

I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews here. But after researching extensively - I went with Morning Side for its Location. I spent over a week here and it was extremely comfortable! I rented a standard roon with pvt bath. This is a decent and clean place. Yes the rooms are small- but that’s Manhattan. The place is perfect if you are looking for a affordable yet comfortable & safe place to stay in Mahattan ( wh is super expensive)I did use a shared bath for one night and it was OK too! The staff and esp Pat is extremely hospitable.The location is very lively and safe which is great!

I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of September and i have to say, after reading the reviews i was very apprehensive about staying here but was pleasently surprised when i arrived. I had booked a room for 4 people with a private bathroom. This is exaclty what we got... the room had 2 double beds and enough room to move around. It was like staying in a bed and breakfast, without the breakfast. The room was clean and had everything you would expect including a small fridge. The room was cleaned every day and we had clean towels provided each time the room was cleaned. The hostel is about a 3-4 minute walk from the subway and there are plenty of places to eat / drink around the area. All in all, for what we paid (and as it was only a place for us to sleep / get ready in) we were very happy. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who is going to New York on a budget.

my family and i reserved a room at morningside inn for 9 nights we booked a deluxe double with a private bathroom, the room was pretty clean the staff was friendly helped us book tours around the city. their is 24 hour service at the front desk which was a plus! our room was cleaned daily fresh sheets and towels the location was perfect just a 5 minute subway ride to 42 street time square and 7 blocks from Columbia University. we enjoyed our stay and hope to return pretty soon!

We stayed here for a week in early October 2009 and they have a serious bed bug problem. Numerous people were complaining about it so we have reason to believe it is in a number of rooms. Having arrived back home yesterday I have a huge number of really serious bites on me and the fun of now worrying that we have brought them back home in our luggage. Seriously, DO NOT stay here.

We booked 3 nights in this hotel through hostelworld.com but it seems thay never received our booking and were (of course) full when we arrived there on a Friday afternoon. The receptionist was very nice though and took time to find an alternative place for us for one night and booked us in with them for the other two nights. The only place which still had rooms available was a tiny hole of a hostel in midtown Manhattan, which cost twice as much and was way worse then the Morningside Inn and that is why they gave us one free night with them AND a 1-night upgrade to their best room.When we returned to the Morningside Inn the next day, we appreciated it even more after the horrible, tiny, dark place in midtown where we spent the night before. The inn is located in a lovely quiet street in the Upper West Side and it has a nice, bright entrance hall. The metro station is a 3 minute walk and you can reach midtown Manhattan in 15 minutes for the 2$ cost of a metro ticket. They have a range of rooms - the cheaper ones are what you pay for: very basic, a little dark with a very small shared bathroom. But there were clean, the beds were comfortable enough and they were pretty spacious (as opposed to some other hostels in NYC where you can't even open a suitcase in your room). The second night we staid in their best room, which was very nice and cozy and had all the amenities: en-suite bathroom, airco, small fridge.The staff was friendly and the owner personally apologized to us for the mess up with the booking, even though it was not their fault. Overall, I would definitively recommend this place over some much pricier and crappier places in midtown.

I booked this hotel in january and had an e-mail confirmation from them. My partner phoned them the day before we were due to travel just to make sure all was well and they had no record of the booking at all. Further to that the attitude of the person on the phone was pretty rude. She instructed us to e-mail the manager (apparently the only way to contact him) and he would e-mail us back within 5 minutes, it's a week later and i'm still waiting. Got another hotel (city park) that was only $30 a night more and was great and in a much better location

I was hesitate about staying at a one star hotel but a friend had said it was fine. We were very pleased with what we got for $90 for the two of us. Our room was clean and attractive with enough room for a double bed and a twin bed with good storage (a closet and lots of drawers.) We appreciated the refrigerator in the room. Our bathroom was newly tiled and very clean and shiny. The only negative thing I would say was the hall carpets were worn looking and unattractive. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The neighborhood was quiet-a very residential apartment neighborhood. There were lots of grocery stores and decent and inexpensive restaurants nearby. For a little more exciting neighborhood, Columbia University was only about five blocks away. We are a couple in our 60's and felt comfortable here. It is advertised through a hostel site and I pictured it being full of young people. It was mixed as far as that went. If you don't have to have to have something fancy, I think you would be very pleased with this hotel.

Mother, father and daughter stayed in the Morningside Inn twice: in july 4 nights in a room with shared bathroom, and again in august in a room with private bathroom. Staff was very, very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean, rooms had TV, AC, fan, fridge. Shared kitchenette with microwave was very handy. Excellent location near Broadway with everything you need, e.g. restaurants, banks, subway (don't miss the enourmous grocery/delicatesse around the corner!). You might think that the carpet in the hallway is a bit old, but then consider the price! It is everything I ask for a budget hotel.

me and my mum stayed here for 6 nights in nov 2008. after reading reviews on here i was abit apprehensive about staying here. so i thought i would ring the hotel myself and check that what i had actually booked was all in order, they assured me it was.when we arrived at the hotel, i did think well its not the ritz, but i hadn't paid that kind of money out.the hotel looked nice and what i would expect for upper manhattan.the staff were really nice and helpful, 24hour service also.PLUS they got our booking right.our room was very clean and warm and we had private bathroom. the room was cleaned every day and our bed made every day.also we had a tv in our room whcih was free.the hotel isnt central, but theres a metro stop just round the corner. we used it every day, its brilliant and very cheap. even though the hotel isnt central its not a problem theres loads of things near and it take 5-10mins on the metro to get to times square.(and we used the metro at night, we honestly felt safer there then we do here at night)all in all, this hotel is ideal!..why spends hundreds of pounds on a hotel that your only going to sleep and shower in.new york isnt a place you go to for the hotel, your hotel is your base thats all. we will be definatly staying here again next year. i recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a brilliant trip to new york and to see all of the city. and still have plenty of spending money

Before arriving at the hotel / hostel I was very optimistic about the place after looking at the bad pictures and reading a lot of the horrible reviews. I had booked the place because it had seemed much better than other hotels and hostels and also the price was brilliant for Manhattan. When I arrived to the hotel, it seemed very clean, although the hall carpets were dirty but this doesn't affect us so it doesn't matter. When we got into the room, we were very pleased. It had a soft double bed, an HD Lcd TV on the wall, a fridge really cold aircon and a cosy private bathroom. The room was small however just the size for us both. Room was cleaned every day and on th last day they let us keep our baggage there and have showers before our flight home. I would say if you book a private room, it is exceptional value for this little place and gave us a pleasant experience whilst staying in New York. I

Very very cheap hotel, but very very durty and......We booked a room for three people and when we been there they gave us a room withg a spacious for max 1 person. As well the photos that they show in the web site are different comparte to the really room. they gave us another room, just after the main entrance, wich was not bud as a spacious but it was raining inside the room.

Booked 2 rooms with single bed in each with PRIVATE bathrooms...........what we got 1 room with a smaller than double bed. Shared bathroom that wasn't big enough to swing a cat.The manager is VERY cheeky and the staff don't have a clue. Chared us DOUBLE THE PRICE! - BUGS everywhere!I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy...its terrible.Basically, we turned up. Logged straight online. Booked a hotel up the road "Hotel Newton" Chucked the morningside keys behind reception (As no one was ever there) and had the best stay ever.
We got ripped off by this hotel. We booked and paid for a superior room with aircon but we are given a budget standard room without airconding. I do not recommend this hotel.

While we weren't expecting much due to the price, there were a number of issues.Complete and utter lack of professionalism demonstrated by the staff. In spite of several calls and an email, we could never get any written confirmation of our reservations, only verbal assurances that they would "make it work". Upon arrival, our reservations were wrong and the price was higher than advertised. When presented with an issue, the staff acts dumb and unsympathetic, and defers to Patrick the Manager, whom we never saw. Drab surroundings. There was nothing updated or convenient about the rooms in the hotel, although they advertise a recent renovation. The beds are very hard - so unless you enjoy sleeping on the floor, you will probably not enjoy sleeping on these beds.Noise. We were moved to a lesser room for our final night, which lacked an air conditioner, a private bath, or even a nightstand with lamp by the bed. The AC would have been good not just for comfortable temperature but to block the noise from the street (all night long) and the loud couple next door who talked loudly and slammed their door repeatedly late at night. Security. There are only little doorknob locks and no security locks on the inside of the room, and as a consequence, we had maids in the room banging on the bathroom door while showering. There are no 'do not disturb' signs. The front entrance never seems to be locked, so I'm not sure how guests really sleep at night.Cleanliness. The sheets and towels were clean. Everything else was kind of grubby. Shared bathrooms were not at all clean. There was garbage heaped high in the kitchen.I would not stay there again, primarily due to the unprofessional, unhelpful staff who added stress and wasted time to our modest vacation. If they had ever once demonstrated genuine concern before or during our stay, I would return again, packing a fluffy mattress pad and my own 'do not disturb' sign.

Bed felt like we slept on the springs and woke up with back aches, room was as small as a closet, I had to climb on bed to get to bathroom, no space, price too high, service was terrible, they dont explain the policy over the phone so we couldnt cancel when we wanted to and it was less than 4 hours, oh lets not forget no parking, we had to park in a lot for another 30.00. People dont waste your money they are rip-offs!

This hostel is really great! Stayed here in 2006 for 6 months and came back in 2008 to stay here again for 2 weeks!I'm a student and you will meet international friends here before you know it, too play pool @ one of the many bars in the hostel's area! I know I will stay here in future again! Staff is unbelievable, keep up the good work guys! Albert, Netherlands

this hotel has bedbugs on every level..staff is partly rude/disrespectful, partly nice.Cleanliness - not given.Parasites - aside the bedbugs a lot, roaches, mice, other bugs..If you think you are having mosquito bites - that is not it. The bedbugs are invisible during the day. You d have to stay a couple of months to actually see one.Do yourself a favour search for a better hotel!

The Morningside Inn has received such mixed reviews that we were pretty anxious about our week-long stay there. We needn't have worried. We arrived a day later than usual (due to Air India no longer using JFK) and late at night. Patrick meet us on arrival and told us that our original room had been let as the travel company hadn't informed him of new arrival date. He was very pleasant and helpful, putting us in an ensuite room (we'd originally booked a budget room with shared bath) telling us to get some sleep and relax and that the room situation would be sorted out the next morning. As it turned out we were allowed to remain in the room and no extra charge which was perfect. Okay, the Morningside isn't the poshest hotel in NY but it was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable and the room warm.
