We did experience a slight problem with hot water (which occasionally did not run more than warm in the early evening) but it was fine for showering. The Morningside is in an excellent location (great for subways and buses). The street was very pretty and extremely quiet at night. Pharmacies and delis, etc are very close at hand. Going to the Columbia Deli for breakfast was lovely. You get a real taste of genuine NY life - which you don't get if you stay near Times Square, say. We would definitely consider staying at the Morningside Inn again. Our experience was a wholly positive one and contributed to a truly fantastic holiday in NYC - an 18th birthday present for our daughter.

I travel to New York City on business every year and I insist on staying at the Morningside Inn. The location just moments away from the 1 line, gives me quick access to all the great sites in New York, including Little Italy, Chinatown, Greenwich Village, Times Square and more. This hotel is very clean. The staff is great, especially Patrick, who is a pleasure to see every trip and is very courteous to guests. I always know my stay from arrival to departure is in good hands with Patrick.The front desk is staffed 24/7 and the nearby block has good restaurants, drug stores, fast food and shops to pick up anything I need at a moment's notice. There is a computer with internet access on sight to check up on e-mail or google street locations.The price to stay at the morningside is outstanding! It's hard to believe you can have such an inexpensive, yet quality stay in the Big Apple. I will continue to book each trip here and heartily recommend booking your next stay at the Morningside Inn.

My boyfriend and I cancelled our stay here because of the awful service we recieved from the manager Patrick and lost £55.We booked through hostel bookers, a triple private ensuite room. As I normally do, I called up the hostel to confirm our booking, I was told we were booked into a triple shared room, at which I was passed on to the Manager Patrick who informed me he would email me about the issue. 2 days later I didn't recieve that email so I called back again to speak to Patrick who again shrugged me off and said he would call me back. Needless to say he didn't. My boyfriend called him the following day to find out if they were sorting things out as all I was being told was that someone would contact me. He got the same response from Patrick so he contacted Hostelbookers directly who said they would deal with it. My boyfriend got a call from Hostelbookers confirming they had spoken to Patrick and had sorted the problem and all we need do is turn up.A week before arrival I thought I would call the hostel one time just to confirm the ensuite private booking which I had paid a deposit for. Patrick greeted me with a sigh and reassurance. He went on in an agressive manner to say 'You've done the right thing, you contacted Hosterbookers, we are trying to sort it.' 'Trying' implying it still wasn't sorted with only a week to go. I asked him what would happen if they couldn't sort it? he replied 'I will email you a week in advance.' My thoughts were, well no you didn't do that last time and today is a week in advance. My boyfriend and I decided we would look else where and cancelled when we found somewhere else. At no point did we get an apology from Patrick, he was rude and aggressive. Even though I didn't stay there I would never recommend anyone to stay there due to the service we recieved and the uncertainty of being given the room we booked and paid for!

I loved my stay at Morningside Inn hotel in New York! This was my first visit to the city, and I really didn't want a bad hotel to ruin everything for me. Well, I'm glad that I had made a wise choice! Morningside Inn is perfectly located - the area is clean, safe, has a lot of shops, banks, restaurants, etc. It's minutes away from the subway and you can easily get anywhere from there. The hotel itself was very quiet - no noisy parties, no drinking on the porch. The management was very helpful. The room was cleaned every day, and so were the bathroom facilities. There is an Internet room in the basement, that has a computer and free Wi-Fi access. In short, this hotel is highly recommended for everyone who travels on a budget but wishes to get the most out of his/her New York experience!!! :0)

We had confirmed reservations for 3 nights but when we arrived, we were supposedly on a "waiting list". They accommodated us in not one but 2 separate rooms because the newly trained staff did not have the authority to have a roll-away bed put into our room for the 3rd person. We ended up paying $100 for each room. They made us check out the next morning so they could put us in one room, but then again made us check out and check back in the 3rd day. All this was very inconvenient especially when we had plans to tour the city. The nightmare began when we came back at 4:30pm the 3rd day to check back in. There were no rooms available, except for 2 rooms that were recently fumigated for an infestation of ants. We asked to view the rooms and decided the first room smelt too strongly of chemicals, but the second was tolerable. At the same time a couple from Philly was also being offered one of these 2 rooms as their confirmed reservation simply "didn't exist" in the Inn's system. Unfortunately for them we took the better of the two bad rooms, which cost us about $83, whereas the other room was offered to us at $50. I mentioned this to the couple who asked the manager if they could get the worse room for $50. The manager Pat flipped out and asked me why I did that and threatened to give my $83 back and kick us out of the Inn. He also said that he was trying to do us a favor and I was basically ungrateful. From the other reviews and my personal experience it seems like this manager Pat is a BIG BULLY. His behavior and policies are UNACCEPTABLE. In the end, I had to apologize just because I had no place else to go for my last night in NYC. This experience single handedly ruined my trip to NY. I would have rather paid more and be treated like a human being. Please stay away from Morningside Inn for you own good.

I travel to NYC about 3 times every year and I always stay at the Morningside Inn. The Manager Patrick is very helpful & friendly. You couldn't ask for better!The hotel is clean & comfortable and the staff are friendly. For the price you pay,..this budget hotel is perfect. It's located in the nice Upper West Side and is close to subway routes, drugstores, markets, churches, bars and diners. I feel safe in this hotel and have never worried about my belongings being left in the room. The rooms I have stayed in are equipped with a color TV, sink, small fridge (great in the summer for your cold drinks), air conditioner, phone, desk, and I pay a little extra for a private bathroom. The linens are clean and the towels are replaced daily. I have told all my friends about this place,..and I will continue to stay here on each of my visits. This is a great place if you want to save some money on your hotel,..and spend more on the city sights. Kathy RoweSt. John's, Newfoundland, Canada

My wife and I stay here every year when we go to New York on vacation, and we love it. The staff are friendly, it's located in a nice neighborhood with quick access to the subway (the 1 line), and we've never had a problem with cleanliness. We've stayed in more expensive hotels where we received less service. The pricing *is* budget conscious, so you have to realize that it's not the Ritz. But if you'd rather spend your money on seeing and enjoying New York City instead of on the room where, for the most part, you're only going to be sleeping anyways, you can't go wrong with the Morningside Inn.

I was hesitant to stay here with all of the other reviews I read, but I found the hotel to be clean, close to public transportation and the staff took care of us. We had a deluxe room with our own bathroom. While the room was small, everything was functional and quiet. I felt very safe in the neighborhood and would stay here again.

My husband & I recently stayed in the Morningside Inn. We had originally booked a double room but had a friend who decided to accompany us. My husband emailed the given email address 4 times and did not receive a response, I then rang and spoke to Patrick, the manager, who agreed we could stay in a triple room and 'amended' our booking.When we arrived, we were told that we had to stay in one specific room overnight and to change the next day, by another staff member (not Patrick). After a 7 hour flight and 1 hour train ride into Manhattan, we were all looking forward to a hot shower, but as per the previous reviews, no hot water.... My husband made a complaint to the lady at the front desk and was told they were 'fixing the boiler' and it would be fine tomorrow. Needless to say, we did not have a proper shower until we got back to London.Next day, we try to check in to our new room only to be told by Patrick that he had no idea of the amendment to the booking and he had just rented his last triple room. When my husband explained his displeasure, stating that the receptionist on the previous day had confirmed that we would be staying in the same room, just on a different floor, he was told by Patrick that he had an 'attitude' and that we should all shut up and let him talk. He was very rude and arrogant.I would not recommend staying in this establishment unless you feel like being abused on your holiday. There are better hotels (with hot water and no bedbugs) for a little bit more money closer to the center of Manhattan.

I can confirm everything bad stated here.Bugs, noise, smell, mice in the kitchen and even in the rooms due to the large gap below the room's door.The aggressive manager threatening you when asking your money back. I studied in NYC (Columbia) and the uni had this hotel and Riverside Inn on the recommendation list.I was moved from Riverside when I complained bitterly about the bedbugs to this one. Not a bit better.I am sure no snob; I am still a student and used to cheap accomodation; content with little; liked the location and area a lot.I did NOT like the fact this hotel is infested with bedbugs (bloodsucking parasites in the materasses; you do not see them, they fear light and react to body warmth at night, check them out on wikipedia; unfortunately I learned many NY hostels and hotels have them). YOu think you have mosquito bites until you get to see one bedbug after a few weeks (so weekend tourists are likely to not realize the hotel has them - but are in danger of bringing them to their own homes within their textiles and suitcases - they re almost impossible to get rid of even with professional help - NY Times had them on their headline in fall 2005).I spent quite a few weeks in the hotel - believe me, you do not want to discover the bedbugs, mice in the rooms and kitchens, roaches, strange long-term residents, (really) dirty facilities, the poisonous smell in the rooms every time the exterminator visited (it suffocates you rather than the bugs)..Do yourself a favour and do not consider Riverside nor Morningside Inn (same owner and staff, same issues).I feel I have to share this here to spare others the bad experience I had there.

If you want the true Gritty Urban Realism experience in New York, then this is the place for you. All the thrills of a tenement house--no heat, no water, paper-thin walls, greasy overcooked food smells coming from the community kitchens, doors with questionable locks, a creaky ancient elevator with barely room for two, and non-responsive management that is sullen at best, belligerant and bullying at worst. Want cable tv? Go to the basement. Want a washcloth? Bring your own. Make sure your credit card isn't charged until you check out. Hotel it is not. I wouldn't even kennel my dog here. Do yourself a tremendous favor and book a room at the Days Inn down the road (about 8 blocks). This dump doesn't even rate one circle on the experience scale. I can't say this strongly enough: DON'T STAY HERE.

The lobby and the front door are the nicest parts of this "hotel." It is actually a dorm - which offers travelers rooms. Paper thin walls - so if you like privacy and want to sleep, forget it. We were there in the winter. My colleague had no heat. I had a space heater which kept blowing the circuits. We both had no hot water for 3 of the five days. Filthy halls. Sanitary bathroom, but too sanitary - had to air out each day because of the chlorine smell. Partying on Fridays - absolutely no sleep on weekends. Overnight "security" is no help - wouldn't do a thing. Manager charged the 5-nights we booked immediately upon our arrival (probably illegal). This gives him the upper edge - and we lost 2 nights lodging because we paid up-front (don't do this!!!! ). If you need a washcloth - you have to go down to the front desk to get it. If you insist that one is brought up - the person bringing it will scowl at you. The partying was the worst - we were in NY on business and wanted a place close to Columbia U - which this place is. We dreaded spending another night - so we asked the manager for 2-nights refund. We were repeatedly told that credits would be processed. We were lied to 4 times about this. If you want a refund forget it. We moved to a Days Hotel just down Broadway which was 10,000 times better and less expensive per night!!!! But the manger stuck us with 2 nights - which we are still trying to get by filing a dispute with our credit card companies.

My boyfriend and me stayed at the Morningside Inn on December 2007. I didn't like it! In our room there was a terrible and a lingering smell of smoke. It was quite small and not so clean. I'll never come back there!

Please do not stay at this hotel. I was verbally abused by the manager, Patrick, who is a bully and a terrible hotel manager. When I spoke to him he became angry very quickly and at one stage he rose to his feet and threatened me. I suspect that he either has mental problems or is just very screwed up. Nobody has ever spoken to me that, never mind a hotel manager who is supposed to be serving you. This all happened on Christmas morning which almost ruined my Christmas day and my experience of New York. At the time I wondered whether I had made some cultural faux pas, but after reading other reviews I realise now that he was looking for an excuse to get into a fight and abuse somebody so that he could feel superior. I am actually quite concerned for anybody who stays here that they may be physically attacked if they say the wrong thing.The hotel itself was nothing special and not worth the extra money we paid. Our first room had wet carpet, smelt bad, and the heater hissed so loud we couldn't hear the television. Furthermore, we had paid extra for the 'superior' room (our Christmas treat) but this was clearly not the best room in the house as we soon discovered.The manager agreed to give us another room the next night, but made us feel like he was doing us a favour every time we spoke to him. We also had problems with the internet, however when I tried to speak to the manager he became extremely angry and insolent.I would highly recommend you steer clear of this hotel and I am surprised that this manager is still working here after my own experience and reading all these reports of people being abused. After the incident I felt extremely upset and also powerless since there is nobody to complain to.

I stayed at Morningside Inn for five months while doing an internship in New York. The hotel in itself is not bad for the price, the rooms are ok and it’s not too far from central Manhattan. The night staff are nice and friendly. However, I had problems with the daily manager:The first incident happened when I was overcharged by $ 1,013 for my rent, two months before it was due – which is a big deal on a student budget. At first I thought it was a mistake, and when I pointed it out I was told the money would be refunded soon. However, after two weeks it still hadn’t been refunded. When I raised the issue again, the manager flipped completely. He said he had never told me it would be refunded and that it was money that was owed to the hotel. I tried to keep the conversation calm, but he quickly got completely furious and stood up and literally screamed in my face in front of other guests. I have never experienced anything like it, and was forced to just walk away even though I was obviously charged too much, too soon. The second incident happened when I tried to have my boyfriend stay overnight as my guest. The morning after the manager again got very angry and nasty because I was apparently not allowed to have overnight guests. Which is ok in itself, but the manner in which he was acting was very hostile. He said he would have my friend thrown in jail for trespassing even though I had clearly stated that he was my visitor. Ever since these incidents the manager had a very angry attitude, gave me hateful looks and made the whole atmosphere pretty uncomfortable. I don’t know if this aggressiveness was caused by me pointing out that I was charged too much and too soon, or the fact that I’m gay, or a combination of both. Either way it put a definite damper on my experience of New York City. I did hear him having loud arguments with guests on other occasions also, due to missing reservations and overcharging. For short stays, Morningside is ok as long as you don’t have a disagreement with the manager. For longer stays I would recommend looking somewhere else, or alternatively paying in cash (you don’t get a contract.) When I left I was promised I would be refunded for 5 extra nights I had been wrongfully charged for. I still haven't been, though.

I was kinda nervous because of some of the bad reviews but my friend and I were on a tight budget, so we booked a double for the weekend of Nov. 30th. We found the Morningside to be very nice. The staff was all very helpful and courteous. I don't know what everybody is talking about, but Patrick is a very nice man, I spoke to him on the phone twice to confirm and he checked us in and gave us directions to a bunch of places. Nice guy. The room was average size, no luxuries but very clean and cozy. We had a shared bathroom but it was right next to the room and was also very clean. The only thing we would have liked was a tv in the room. There wasn't one but hey, it's NY! we were so tired from all our walking and sightseeing that when we got back we went right to bed anyway. The hotel is close to the bus and subway, as well as walking distance from many restaurants and supermarkets. It's very well located and a good place to stay if you're on a budget. I'll definitely stay there from now on when I visit NY!!P.S. Visit the catholic church next door, it's beautiful!

Not sure where to start about the Morningside – there’s nothing nice about it. Immediately upon our arrival, we were subject to rude customer service by the entire hotel staff, including Patrick, the hotel “manager” who claimed that we’d canceled our reservation, even though we had CONFIRMED our reservation the night before and had the documents to prove it. After acting like he did us a big favor, he gave us Room #604. What we found were several deficiencies of very basic amenities, from no batteries in the smoke detector to a chain lock that we could simply pull right off the wall to thin, dirty towels. This is in addition to no hot water in the shower and a heating system that turned on once every 12 hours (we slept in our jackets). Mismatched paint on the walls and bird feces inside the windowsill just added to the ambiance within the room.To top off our stay, Patrick again became inexplicably irate after we calmly asked him on our way out the door for the name of the property owner. He then proceeded to follow us out the front door to our waiting cab and physically assaulted me. When the police arrived, 2 eyewitnesses came forward to corroborate the fact that Patrick had smashed my face into the car door. I later required medical attention. It was a long weekend of horror stories at this place, finalized by being assaulted by Patrick. If you are thinking of staying here anytime soon, THINK AGAIN!

Afraid of mixed reviews I still took a chance . I was especially worried they would not hold the room as I was arriving late . Marlene at the desk reassured me when I called. The room was clean, warm , and the little bathroom ample and cute. A lamp did not work but big deal The area.. really nice . Good restos around the corner and even a subway. For the price and area.. a great secret.

I recently stayed at the Morningside Inn in New York City and was absolutely impressed with the staff and the accommodations for such a facility that was not known to me. I was especially impressed with the Managers ability to get me a room on such short notice and have his staff get it ready. I believe his name is Patrick.A great job for a facility not well known.

I stay in NYC a couple of weekends each month, and I have stayed in many different places. Now when I come into NYC I stay at the Morningside Inn exclusively. Comfortable, affordable and adorable, the Inn is located on the gorgeous Upper West Side next to a beautiful Cathedral. The staff, which allows 24 hour check-in, is so friendly and helpful. The owner/operator Patrick has been extremely helpful and accommodating when it comes to booking my stay, but I have also had no trouble booking online. The price can't be beat. They have an accommodation for any traveler's budget.I really recommend this great little Inn.

While we were not expecting deluxe accommodations, for $130 per night, we did expect a safe, comfortable room. Unfortunately, loosing our reservations was just the tip of the iceberg.The manager, Patrick, acted like he was doing us a favor to find us a room. His behavior was rude and disrespectful, telling me to leave him alone so he could get his work done. The spartan furnishings were tolerable, but many other shortcomings were unacceptable: the doors to the room barely latched; the smoke detector had no batteries; the blankets were lightweight and there was no heat to turn on; tepid water arrived only after leaving the water running for 20 minutes. Both my daughter and I were charged for the same room and the refund I was promised "the next day" was not forthcoming by the time we checked out 3 days later. When asked for the contact information of the owners to file a complaint, the manager, Patrick, lost his temper and physically attacked a member of our party as we were trying to leave. Definitely not a safe place with the current management!

The worst hotel I've ever seen: shabby, the people who are working there are totally unreliable and incompetent !!!Even though our room (with private bath) was confirmed by the owner himself, we were given another room (with shared bath) for the night. The next day we were supposed to move to our booked room and stored our luggage in the storage room. When we returned the same evening, they just stared at us and said: "We didn't think you'd come back so we gave your room to somebody else". And all this time our bags were in the storage room and they knew it !!!That' no way to treat anybody, especially not with a small child !

I have just returned from a fantastic trip of New York City. My first stay was at a hotel from hell on 106th Street before my sister introduced me to the Morningside Inn hotel on the Upper West Side. My nearly 3 week stay there was a breath of fresh air compared to the previous hotel. It was clean, quiet the staff was efficient and friendly and the manager is an absolute gem of a person.There was a phone and fridge in each room and a kitchen, fitted with a stove, microwave and cupboards on each floor. The common bathroom was shared by four rooms but that was ok as i never had to wait. The room had window AC which was a bit loud but bearable and the window in the room couldn't open. The location is excellent as it's within walking distance to restaurants, a supermarket, pharmacy, banks, fruit & veg markets, the subway and even a very good jazz bar. There's also some small theatres close by where you can watch live theatre.I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it for the budget conscious traveller looking for good, clean affordable accommodation close to all the major attractions but in a nice quiet area. Also good value for money for long-term stays as the rates are very reasonable. For an unrated hotel i give it two thumbs up. Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Don't go there. The manager is very rude and disrespectful who doesn't care about his customers. After the first night we complained about the condition of our room that sheets were not cleaned, bathrooms are horrible and rooms smells really bad. In answer manager start cussing for five minutes with F words. We decided to leave the hotel because of his attitude. Long story short we left the hotel in the morning and he charged us for that night and I'm still working with my credit card company to get my money back.

I can just say one thing: Don't stay here. The rooms are horrible with cold water showers and broken toilets. The manager is rude and scary when complaining. No internet access available even though it is promised on website. The list goes on and on...

ABOUT US: My gf and me (both of us are from Singapore). I'm 35, she's 29. We are budgeted travellers who just need a clean and quiet place to sleep. After the mixed reviews, we decided to go with the inn based on the budget and location to the subway. We stayed in morningside inn on oct 9th to the 12th. Arrving with an open mind and preparing for the worse, the "notorious" front office was noticibly plain but clean. The young girl working there was nonchalant, but quick to check me in. I paid cash to prevent any future discrepancies. (Although, be mindful that the young girl do not have access to the cashier after office hours, so pls bring exact change! )So far so good. Now the room... I booked a double room with shared showers. The room is really plain but clean. A bed which was made up everyday, a fan with a hanging light, a window which worked. No aircon or heater, but it was autum now, so fresh air suited us fine. I was pleasantly surpised when i found out that there was a sink, a fridge and a phone in the room.The common shower is shared between 2 to 3 rooms each. Wasn't an issue. Most guests there usually have different agendas so no need to wait at all.The location and neighbourhood was quite good. Supermarkets are 3 to 5mins mins away. Eateries are nearby too. Both Absolut Bagels on 107th and Tom's Restaurant (112th), made famous by Seinfeld, are good for breakfast. Subway to downtown is only 5 mins away.One thing I noticed was the inexperienced front office. Other than the big man himself who is present only in the morning, the rest of the young staff seemed clueless about the hotel. I was given 3 keys to my room, and the young girl couldn't tell me what the other 2 keys were for. Another girl couldnt' tell me the rates of making a local call in the room.That didn't bother me too much since my criteria was more cleanliess and location. So overall, Morningside Inn fitted our criteria and I won't mind staying there again.

Convenient location, comfortable, and nice staff. I'd recommend getting a room with private bath. Relatively quiet, but I'd recommend earplugs if you are sensitive to noise. Hotels in NYC are expensive, and this place is a good deal for the price.

Pros: quiet location; very clean room, affordable rates, ceiling fan, air conditioner and room fridge. Cons: no towel racks, no toilet roll holder, poorly installed security chain on door, no peep-hole, broken telephone, no closet or hangers in my room. Ceiling fan only works with the light 'on'. Poor hospitality staff.I booked one month in advance, on-line, for two nights. When I checked in they said only for one night. Twenty minutes later, they found me a room for two nights. It had no bathroom and was not what I reserved on-line. Twenty more minutes later, they found me a room for two nights with a bathroom. It had no closet [see cons above]. I was also required to pay the "upgrade" to the superior room. But it was Morningside's mistake. In conclusion, this is a clean place and reasonably cheap, but it's not a polished hotel in the tradition of hospitality. For instance, if a hotel makes a mistake regarding your reservation, they never make the customer pay the difference in price. But Morningside isn't run by professionals. It's run by one friendly man and his inexperienced staff. The renovation continues and the work is sloppy at best. My friend was staying in room 101 and they installed carpet on the second day of his week there!!Nobody is taking the right amount of care to finish the hotel before somebody stays there. So, if you decide to stay, don't get room 604 until the items I have listed are fixed. At $150 per night, they should have done better.I may not stay here again.

I stayed at this hotel for 4nights a few weeks back with my girlfriend. We booked it without reading reviews, and after reading them i was worried as to what we were letting ourselves in for. However we couldnt have asked for more from the place. Good location, clean room and we found the staff very nice and helpful. People if your getting a good price on the room you have to realise your not going to get anything that is worthy for a king and queen. If you are going to new york for a few days your not even going to be in the room for more than 12hrs a day anyways. Get out and enjoy the place!

The hotel staff was polite and gracious! We continue to visit this hotel because of its cozy location (just blocks away from a train station) and the rooms with kitchenettes which saves us tons of cash. No complaints here! Perfect for budget traveler needs.

TOURISTS BEWARE!!!I'm a young graduate relocating to NY, I had to find a decent accommodation near the university facilities and Moningside Inn looked like something "value for money", but still acceptable...I wasn't expecting anything immaculate, I knew it wouldn't be the Rizt...but I wasn't expecting what was around the corner either: we booked well in advance, well aware of the fact that NY is crowded and everybody wants something cheap but in the city centre...I had my booking confirmation and everything was cool until I got there: they told me they never got my booking, then they told me that instead of 7 days they had a 3 days booking. For the rest 4 days no rooms. No place to stay. I contacted the agency I booked the rooms with, they confirmed my booking...they told me to speak with the manager, but he was nowhere to be found...For the first day of my stay AND the second day...then I got worried: one last day and then I would have been with no room. So on the third day - no manager in sight - I went and looked for a cheap alternative (very hard on a budget, and on such short notice). Evetually I found a good place, not as cheap. When I went back...voilà, the manager was back (apparently after a nasty call from the broker I booked the room with), and insted of APOLOGISING ON BEHALF OF THE HOSTEL, NO!!!HE BECAME ALL DEFENSIVE, AND STARTED ARGUING, saying I should not book anywhere else (even if his coworkers told me there was no booking for me and no available room for the next days)...Can u believe this??? Also, the broker got 10% on seven night, but eventually I was in the Morningside Inn for a shorter period of time...any chance to get my money back? what do u think?Any guess?What kind of service is that? NO SERVICE, NO RESPECT FOR PEOPLE, IS JUST A MONEY MAKING MACHINE, INNIT?Very good for my first 3 days in NYC...I suppose....

I was looking for a budget accomodation for 10 days in NYC and I wanted private bathroom. I managed to find this accomodation at Morningside Inn, in a Superior room.The room was small and the bathroom even smaller, but everything was clean and cleaned up every day at no additional cost. All the appliances worked properly (air conditioning, tv, etc.) as well as the bathroom which was ok.I was a little disappointed when I knew that you have to pay per use to access wi-fi internet (4 bucks per 4 hours, 10 for 24 hours and so on).The surroundings are nice. There are a lot of shops in the area and the subway it's a 5-7 minutes walk.The overall impression is very good. It's not a luxury accomodation, but it is clean, reasonably priced, rich of services, safe and comfortable.I'd definetly go back there again!

I've been meaning to write this for a while. I stayed last October for a week and am not sure I'd stay again. I'm a single woman, middle-aged, fairly well traveled. Don't need luxury, just a clean room & a little service when required.I had the room on the first floor at the front, right on the street. It's a huge room by NYC standards but a bit grungy. The window air conditioner had substantial gaps between the expander panels and the window frame so I asked immediately if something could be done about it. Turns out I had to ask twice a day for the first three days I was there. As a single traveler, this seemed a safety issue even though the staff somewhat dismissed my concerns that it wouldn't be possible for someone to get in thru the window because it was too far from the sidewalk. That may be, but I don't like taking chances or paying to do so.The bed was comfortable & looked new but the sheets weren't changed even once during my week's stay. I"m not even sure if the cleaning staff made it in my room becuase there was a wrapper from a previous occupant that was never removed from the floor. (I left it there as a little test.) The last day I requested that the desk staff call a cab to take me to the airport. I had just enough money for the cab & some airport food but they instead called a car service that cost me quite a bit more. I had barely enough to cover the ride & ended up with almost no tip for the poor driver. I won't make that mistake again. So for a clean cheap room in NYC, it was OK but really nothing more. Oh and I'm really glad I had my earplugs with me -- the springs on the doors are really tight & the other guests always seemed to let the doors slam as loudly as possible at all hours of the night.Lastly, I find it really interesting that whenever a very negative review appears for this hotel, the management's response is inevitably to insult and blame the customer. Not the best way to make amends, I'd say.

We booked our stay at the Morningside Inn using Hostel Times. The inn looked okay when we got there and we checked in using the reservation slip that we printed from Hostel Times. The reservation slip specifically said that we had to pay whatever was outstanding minus the deposit we had made. When we got to check in, we were told that the deposit was taken by Hostel Times and we had to pay tax on top of the deposit we had already paid. Being newbies, we thought this was probably the case and paid everything as we were told. BUT when we went to another hostel in Boston booked using the same hostel times, what we paid was what was listed in the reservation slip. No additions. No bull [--] about how hostel times takes MY deposit. Geez. Don't get conned. When we finally got to the room, I dare say I have NEVER in my life seem such a dingy, run down room before. We had a metal cupboard for a closet that looked like it was used to grow mushrooms, NO TV, a bathroom so small you had to turn on a pivot while you were showering (good luck if you dropped your soap, you had to open the shower door, get our of the shower to have enough space to pick up your soap - we are not exaggerating). The bed was so creaky and thin you had to subconsciously remember not to turn in your sleep, otherwise the creaking springs would wake you. When we tried doing our laundry in the room downstairs, after going thru the hassle of getting 5 quarters, we yank the quarters in the machine (with our clothes and soap all put in) only to find that the damn machine doesn't work! No sign on the door to say don't use the machine, its spoilt. When we went to tell the reception about this, all we got was, "yeah, I guess its spoilt eh?". God, I felt like strangling her right there. Overall, BAD BAD BAD BAD experience. We will NEVER EVER go back there again.

I have meaning to write this review since our (my husband's and my) 5 day stay at the Morningside this last September. Not only was the price phenomenal for the area, but the room was actually very comfortable. And close to everything! There are a number of bus and train stops within a few blocks. The best part was that we used the bus to get there from the airport (JFK). It was so close it was like having our own shuttle! The staff was very, very nice, without being intrusive. I do not know why anyone would not like this place. Granted it is not a luxury hotel, but why travel to New York to stay in your room? We are used to camping, so our expectations may be a lot different from others. If you want luxury, you have to pay for it. I want value, cleanliness, safety, and proximity to the city; Morningside is all of the above and more. Perfect!

When arriving to MORNINGSIDE INN I was greeted by a lovely young ladyby the name of MARGARITA. she was very professional, kind, and helpful she even gave a us a list of great hang out & dining spots inthe area and gave us directions around town, that alone assured me that my stay here would be great. You really get what you pay for I only stood for 5 nights but i would've definately stayed longer, the air conditioned rooms are comfortable, clean, and spacious. Coming toNew York you usually worry about how expensive and how rude people can be but here i got great prices and service. ****NOW THATS A BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!!!****

Found the hotel online..The picture looked great..We had plans in the neighboodhood so the location was great..The outside of the building looks great..Elevator a little shabby but wanted to give it a chance..We had reserved a Superior room..Was given a price of $117 a night..We were charged $130 a night..Hall rug very old and tattered..Room was very small..Too small for a closet so they put a metaql one in it..The frige is plugged into an extension cord..Had to plug in the tv and the oly place is the extension cord with the frige..No chair..No lamp..Bed is ankle high..No headboard..No matress pad..Just a sheet on a very thin mattress..Very noisey bed ..Every time you moved it woke you up..Wanted to set the clock radio to wake us ..Wasn't plugged in..Couldn't plug it in..,It was attached to dresser and cord wouldn't reach extension cord with tv and frige..That was the only outlet in the room...So we decided to call for a wake up call..had to plug in the phone ..After we hung up the phone kept buzzing..Called front desk..They said to dial 3 because we had a message..Dialed 3, no message..Phone kept buzzing..Front desk said to unplug it and they would knock on our door to wake us..No towel bars in bathroom..No hooks or hangers of any kind..No counter space in bathroom..Tiny towels felt like a loofah..No saftey bolt or lock on the door..Had to squeeze by each other to get around...If you like roughing it this is the place for you..But seriously there is no smoke alarm in the room either

Stayed here for 8 nights this month on a city trip.As everybody here we booked the room to save some money to visit the city, its expensive enough. Loved the clean room on arrival, the quiet street between two busy ones (Broadway and Amsterdam), the fridge in the room, the a/c and fan , the cable tv.The bed was a bit small for two adults, the bathroom also, but not to bad overall. Disliked the quality of cleaning during our stay and the late check inn (4 pm) and early check out (11 am), even if you mail you arrive in the afternoon (we did at 3.30 pm after traveling 14 hours and with a six hours time difference) there was nothing to do about it : wait till 4 pm !!Also strange : pay all 8 nights before you even are allowed to check the room. In general : its for NYC a pretty good deal for your money, but its on the limit of accetable price/quality balance. Anyway no real complaints so for travellers who are aware of the price and what you can expect for it, its certainly a good deal.

This was my second stay at Morningside. I had planned a trip w/ for a small group - we needed 4 rooms and arrangements for 10 people for two nights over a weekend. Patrick was very accommodating making the arrangements and confirming them once again about a week before we travelled.We had an issue w/ one of the rooms the first night and had to deal with it b/c the inn was sold out for that night. However, the next morning arrangements for two rooms were taken care of for us by 9:00 am. We moved our luggage etc to the ready room and left for the day. Upon returning in early evening they had made even better arrangments for us AND had our luggage etc. moved for us!Once again, I'll say that this is an old buiding with narrow stairwell, tiny elevator and smallish rooms, but the rooms were clean, ours included air conditioning and private bathroom. We came to tour the city not buy real estate so everyone in our group was satisfied with the rooms, bathrooms, availabilty of towels (bring your own washcloth, they don't have them) and cable (an upgrade from my last stay). We basically were only in the rooms to sleep, so any frownies were insignificant to us since we did not have to spend any great length of time in the rooms. This inn is on a neighborhood street between two churches so it's quiet at night - we were on the first floor and had NO difficulty sleeping.I'll definitely stay again!

I came to NYC for four nights and did not want to spend the fortune that most hotels cost here. The Morningside Inn is a part hostel/part hotel. I requested the Double Deluxe Room and it was really nice for what we paid for it, very affordable. Our room was behind the office right as you enter the building, which was odd, but the room had two double comfortable beds and a fairly spacious bathroom. The window air conditioner works great and kept the room very cool at all times. Also has two dressers and a closet for clothes, plus a mounted tv in the corner of the room. The only problem I had was that the shower water was luke warm at BEST and the shower leaked very slowly onto the carpet right in front of the bathroom.I never saw anything in the hotel besides the entryway, front desk, and our room. This hotel is a bit north of the heart of NYC (it is located on 107th and Broadway), but that doesn't matter at all. The subway at 103rd and Broadway is easily accessible and can take you anywhere! There are great restaurants, shops, flower stands, etc. nearby everywhere!I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are trying to save money to spend elsewhere in NYC!

As a bargain basement kind of hotel, this place would be tolerable if they would just change a few things: 1) give me a wastebasket in my room; 2) put a roll of toilet paper in the shared bath so I don't have to drag one in every time I need to use the facilities; 3) give me a hook and a rack in the bathroom where I can put my clothes and my towel; 4) fix the shower faucets so they don't fall off when I turn them on; 5) put something on the bottom of the tub so I don't slip immediately upon stepping into it; 6) fix the world' s worst caulking job in the showers. These are all small things - not expensive to fix, but they make life easier. And when they're not there - we notice. I could complain about other things - the hotel's dinginess, smelliness, etc., but I was prepared for that going in, despite the pretty pictures on their website. It just looks like they generally don't care and are cynically trying to squeeze every last dime out of that place that they can, because they're dealing (mostly) with a clientele that has few options at the hotel's price point. Me, I'm just a cheap guy who's always looking for a bargain. Maybe somewhere there's a halfway decent hotel in NYC for around $100. But this ain't it.

Actually this hotel is a dump. The unskilled personnel will not do anything without asking "THE MANAGER" first. This manager had with a mocking humor slightly on the edge. I was afraid of him instantly. Hepromised us Internet would be installed in the following days. None of his staff knew even a computer existed in the house. The TV-room resembled a cell in an airless cellar only accessible by an old elevator. To change the channel you had to ask the staff upstairs at the reception, cos only they could change it.The"newly renovated hotel" is still in a state of renovation. Especially in the common zone. There is a strange smell in the room and no way to open the window, because of air-condition. The toilets are dirty and often clogged. The "Manager" charged us the booking fees explaining to us, that we should have taken a closer look at the website where we had booked. Never go there---I recommend the "Wanderer's Inn" hostel, it has breakfast, very nice and helpful staff, a tv in the double-bed room,it's clean and cheap. All the standards the "MANAGER" said "aint happenin' in New York City". Not in his hotel, that's for sure.

We went to New York with six people and I was dreading the cost as wewere somewhat on a budget and in NY, your dollar doesn't stretch thatfar. I booked the Morningside Inn as a compromise and was glad that I did.The location is good, easy for the subway (four blocks walk down to 103rd street - we always took breakfast on the way from one of the decent, cheap restaurants there) and subway is about quarter of an hour into Time Sq. Didn't entirely feel comfortable with the area late at night but you could easily have caught a cab back as its not far out of the city. Tick for location.When we turned up, the manager was unable to satisfy the booking as the internet had only shown my booking as one room not two. Not a problem - the manager sorted out extra beds for the room. While this mmigth not satisfy everyone, we were happy as the rooms were bigger than anything else that I had seen. all our requests (extra towels etc) were met with a smile and staff overall were helpful and happy. I ordered tickets off ebay and they were delivered and held by the fornt desk and given to me without even asking (I had forgotten!!)Rooms were clean and warm (it was five degrees at the time in NYC!!! In April!!) and everything seemed to work. Beds were comfortable and while its no luxury location, it provides good, clean accommodation at a sensible price.I was happy and would happily return. By the way party of six was two girls, four blokes and we ordered a four person suite and a superior room with en suite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to spend their money or more important things in new York but that still want a nice, clean room to return to.

I was fine with the accoidations, but I would not like my wife to stay here. If you are looking to stay for little money this place is great. Not that many ammenities, but close to the subway to get anywhere in town. I felt very safe in the neighborhood. Very upscale part of town. I would stay here again anytime.

It is just an hostel, but I really liked it. We stayed in a superior room, with a private bath. The room was tidy, and it is really closed to the underground. If u want a cheap but tidy place to stay in Ny, go there!

we stayed at this hostel over the new year and can have no real complaints.we were 3 lads just after a place to sleep that was clean and tidy which it was....it was 3 blocks from the subway station and was in a decent area with diners and a bar nearby..just to get us started!!I agree that its hard to get the hot water flowing right in the shower but once you get the hang of it its ok!!! also towels changed daily,bins emptied and sheets changed.Dont come here expecting the hilton.....for $100 a night for 3 we thought it was great value and it left us more money to spend on the important things you dont go away to spend time in your room do you?!!!if you do stay here get the 7 day subway pass its only $24 and well worth it.

I was a liitle bit worried about all the reviews that i read in advance but the price was unbeatable and it was only for 2 nights and i was looking for something in that area for Xmas eve. And the lobby of the hotel is nice and it's brand new but the rest of the corridors, scary lift and almost unlocked doors of the rooms need a quick change.Anyway, the room was accurate for 2 people and pretty clean. The room has got TV, refrigerator and it's ok. The furniture don't match at all (some of the them are made of metal, like in an office) but the bed was confortable and clean. There were some scary cables on the floor but we hid them behind the fridge.So, it worths a cheap price and you must know where you're going. It's not bad at all and i do not think it's dangerous or risky. No bugs, no rats, as i read. It's just a place to sleep but do not go there for a romantic weekend.The staff was friendly and, in case i would not find something better, i would not refuse to come back again for a few nights.

I'm an Australian female, single traveller who has just returned from eight weeks overseas. I stayed at Morningside Inn for about a week during October. The hotel did provide most of what it promised -- helpful staff who would call taxis for you and help you with directions for getting around the city, in particular -- a fridge and microwave in the room (without any utensils to back that up, though) and a laundromat nearby.  I was disappointed mostly by the very uncomfortable bed, the poor quality sheets, the thin, tired pillow, and the single white towel (that was not replaced all week). To be fair, housemaids did find me another pillow and an extra cotton blanket with much ado following my request, but I ended up buying a blow-up pillow from the MoMA to supplement what was being offered.Perhaps the biggest disappointment of all was that I was in the US, the capital of worldwide television and advertising production, and there wasn't a TV in my room (or a joint TV room anywhere in the building) that I could switch on to get the news or some music. These are MUST have requirements when travelling alone. I went to the Radio Shack in the end and bought a portable, battery-operated radio to relieve the silence and compensate for the view of the brick wall outside (which I DID expect to find in NYC!). The internet was out of order for most of the week I was there. By the way, it was an antique anyway -- one of those coin-operated machines that you stand up and operate -- I hadn't seen such a machine anywhere in Australia for at least 10 years (yet the staff seemed to have all the latest equipment on their desk, including pay TV access). Upon checking out of the hotel, I suggested they may like to consider upgrading some of the technology, and at least providing it for single guests, rather than just stating it was available on their website. Sure, there are a couple of internet cafes nearby, but they would be better off promoting that Starbucks has wi-fi access worldwide so bring your own notebook! In the end, I bought a small notebook at a computer store, carried it round the world, and used wi-fi free at almost every destination (with the power adapters to suit each country that the computer salesman threw in). Overall, at least the Morningside Inn was a cheap place to shower and sleep, with staff that offered friendly advice for getting around the place, and if that's all you're looking for in New York and don't expect much more then the hotel is reasonably good value.One final suggestion for the management: a chair or two in the foyer wouldn't go astray so guests could wait inside while keeping an eye out for taxis, instead of having to stand outside on the sidewalk.

I was in the city with a co-wotker for 4 days, with little money and alot to do! I was nervous after reading some of the reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised at how clean everything was. The room was freshly painted, two beds, a chair, dresser,closet,tv, and a very clean bathroom. I use alot of towels, and was given all that I needed. The hot water was alittle hard to figure out, but there was plenty. It was quiet after 11 pm, when the kids who lived across the block went to bed. We saw a few other quests, but rarely heard anyone. The elevator was old and small, but got us up and down just fine. Patrick and the other staff were great, helpful with their diresctions and advice. The location is perfect; 3 blocks from the "1" traiin that goes all the way through Times Square to south St Sea Port. There are great markets and cafes on 110 st, also. We were only in the room to sleep a few hours each night, but we both slept like rocks! We didn't see any bugs or dirt that some of the other reviewer said they saw. I run the kitchen at a private school, and will not tolerate any kind of filth- so I'm glad the Morningside was so clean! I will stay here again.

They were really super nice. Doing everything they can to help in every way. I never once had a problem there. Called cabs and willing to help with just about everything. I cant complain about anything other than i didnt find this place sooner. Thank you guys. You really made my trip enjoyable.

Having read some of the reviews I was a little anxious about this Hotel but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. You have to remember that this is a budget hotel and you get what you pay for and thats why I rate as average however this could very well be an above average budget hotel as my experience of this type of accomodation is limited. I booked a three bed room with private bathroom. After I booked through a third party I emailed the hotel and asked that they confirmed my booking and within 12 hours Patrick replied which was very reassuring. When I checked in the receptionist was very pleasant as were all the reception staff. The room was clean with crisp bedding and clean white towels on arrival. For me, that was all I required as my intention was to see NYC and not spend hours in my room. There were plenty of towels and these were changed daily and the beds made up. I was very surprised how quiet the hotel was also, I was situated on the ground floor. Unfortunately the Internet facility was out of order on the day I needed to check in my return flight to London online however the staff informed me that there was an internet cafe on Broadway which is literally only a few steps away. The subway is also close by and bus stops plus a fantastic deli just around the corner. I would recommend the morningside to anyone who doesnt want to spend a fortune on hotel bills, take my advice, go for it and spend the cash you save on a helicopter trip to see the sights by air...FANTASTIC....Next time I'm in NYC I'll be staying here...thanks a bunch Pat.

Brought my mom to NYC and stayed here Sept 29-Oct 1. Paid a total of $280 for the 2-night stay. Overall, we were very pleased with the accomodations, location, and price. (Booked on lastminute's website.) Upon arrival, there was a mix-up with the reservation. I reserved a Deluxe Double room and was about to be given a different style room we didn't want. I handed over the print-out of my booking to the manager and the error was quickly fixed to our satisfaction. We stayed on the first floor. (I believe room 107?) Our room reminded me of the dormmaster's room back at college that was like a mini-apartment. It was a large place with a separate bedroom where there was a big TV and my mom slept on a very comfortable bed. I stayed in what I thought would have been a living room that had a futon. Sleeping on the futon was as best as a futon gets--you have to position yourself so you avoid the wooden bars that are underneath the cushion. I still can't complain for the price.The bathroom was very decent. The tub was extremely slippery and that'd be our only issue if we had one.The kitchen area was nice too, though we only used the fridge to store water & cold snacks.We kept the shades closed since there wasn't any desirable view from any window. We did wonder about the door and what looked to be a start of a dent as if at some point someone tried to pry the door open.Overall, we'd definitely stay here again as we were very pleased with the stay. Not sure which room they mistakenly had us in originally or what would have happened if the place was sold out and all Deluxe Double rooms were taken before our arrival, but that doesn't matter now.The location was great. Just a short walk from many great restaurants, diners, and the subway station. I felt very safe in the area walking around both day & night.

This small hotel is the cutest place. It made me think of a place I stayed in Paris - only The Morningside Inn is 100 times cleaner. The bed linen was crispy white and the bathroom linen was white and fluffy. Its just wonderful for the location and price. And the staff really cares! What a treat.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!After travelling from west to east in the US, I had to mostly guess and use sites like this to choose my accommodation. Needless to say I had some disapointments. The Morningside Inn was not one of these.....The friendly staff went out of their way to satisfy any needs and the room was cleaned and left with fresh towels daily.The location has a real comfortable feeling, giving a real feel for New York, with all necessities close at hand as well as being only metres from the 110th street subway station.The rooms are freshly renovated with fridge and cable TV.My thanks go out to Big Pat and the beautiful Jennifer for all their help on our stay. The Morningside Inn will definately be seeing return business from this satisfied traveller.

On July 31, 2006, I booked a room at the Morningside Inn in NYC on the internet site www.lodgingNet.us for the weekend of November 3 to 6, 2006 for my participation in the New York City Marathon. I received an e-mailed confirmed reservation. When I arrived at the Morningside Inn on November 3rd at 7:00 pm, I was met by a young woman clerk at the desk who informed me that my reservation had been cancelled by her boss "Patrick" and that he had tried to get a hold of me to let me know. I told her that no one had gotten a hold of me at any time and that I wanted my room immediately because I had Broadway theater tickets for 8:00 pm. She said there were no rooms available and that Patrick was gone for the weekend. I asked the clerk to get me a room elsewhere and she called one hotel next door that was filled and then said she didn't know of any rooms at other hotels. I asked the clerk what I should do and she said she had no idea. My wife and I ended up sleeping on the floor of a relative's place that weekend. Afterwards, I checked my messages on our home, cell and business phones, fax and e-mail address, and unsurprisingly found that no one from Morningside Inn ever made any attempt to let us know that our room had been cancelled. When we were hurrying out of the place, a young man who had overheard our somewhat heated conversation with the desk clerk commented: "You didn't lose anything. This place is a dump." I wholeheartedly concur.

This is a reasonable budget option but don't expect too much. Our room was very basic, slightly shabby and fairly small, but both it and the bathroom seemed clean and not uncomfortable. We certainly didn't have any problems with dirt/vermin etc like some other reviewers (although we didn't go into the kitchen so I can't comment on that).It's definitely not a luxury option, but if you're just looking for a good value place to sleep in between seeing the sights of New York, it hits the spot. The one problem we had was on our first night (of three) with noisy neighbours playing loud music -- it seemed like there were quite a few students there. In fact, the whole place is slightly like a halls of residence. . .
I've stayed in some pits in my time but this place really takes the biscuit.Disgusting. i don't mind shabbyness but this place was just plane dirty. And the staff have a bad attitude to boot.

We were travelling with friends when we booked this hotel. This place was so bad, we only stayed for 2 hours! Our plane was delayed, so we didn't get to the hotel until 4am. We rang the hotel from the plane and found out that there wouldn't be anyone there to check us in. After explaining our situation to the lady at reception, she was kind enough to stay and wait for us. When we got there, we were very dubious about this place (even from the outside). We had originally booked this place for the week, but decided once we got there, that we would find something else. The lady tried to get us to pay for the week up front, but we told her we'd changed our minds, so we had to pay for the night (which was almost over) & we lost our booking fee, so all up it cost us about $160.00 to stay there for 2 hours.. We were exhausted & just wanted to catch up on some sleep, but when we got to our room, we were greeted by a bad smell. There was a transparent curtain over the window & the bed had stains on the bedspread. We decided right then that we weren't even going to use the beds. We would just have a shower to freshen up. Well, we both had to have cold showers because there was no hot water. We then went to our friends room, to wait for them & their room was just as bad. They had found pubic hairs in the sheets! We sat on towels on the bed & waited for them & while we were waiting, my husband got bitten on the ankle by a flea! That was the last straw...we just grabbed our bags & left. I can't stress enough how bad this hotel is. Do yourself a favour & stay well away. It's definitely worth spending the extra money & finding somewhere decent, which is what we did.

It's really surprise me that people think this hotel is dirty and unfriendly. We stayed this hotel for 3 weeks and we really got great time there. The staffs there are really nice and like Patrick he asked me "how's everything??? could I got anything for you???" I can feel I was staying in a happy, comfortable and warm environment. There was a man clean the kitchen every morning(every morning I just tried to prepare our breakfast) and he also clean the bathroom also. There's a lady clean our room every one or two day. If we need towels, cups, hairdryer, matches...we just went to the counter in first floor and we would get everything we need. There're some crazy people next to us(eg. smash the door, drunk people and fight) and we just need to call the counter and we would get the peace in around 5 mins... I had a fabulous time there(budget rate, convenient traffic, good living environment , cozy room, and nice staffs....) Stayed this hotel still a very good memory for us.

Stay away from this place at all costs. I had the misfortune to stay at this place for a week. It is dirty, grimy, roach and rat infested and the staff is very very unprofessional and verbally abusive.The staff was very unprofessional especially the manager Patrick. I was verbally abused for asking for a towel and when I finally got a towel from the cleaning lady 3 days later it was dirty with hair and brown spots all over. A very sexist and verbally abusive manager. He would get upset at guys asking general questions and would reply happily to the same questions asked by a female. If you catch him on a bad day then good luck to you.The stairway is dark and really dirty and grimy. The carpetting in the hallway is very old and extremely dirty. I understand that a hotel has high traffic but this place looks like it hasnt been cleaned in months. The kitchen was always dirty and the stove and microwave had layers of grime on it and they had no plans on fixing it. The bathroom ceiling dripped throughout my stay and the drain in the shower did not even have a mesh plate so if you drop your soap forget about it. The website is very misleading. There is no data port in any room, no internet service is available. The internet terminal downstairs was never functional. Obviously cleanliness and couteous customer service is not even a priority here. Its really not worth the money because you wont get any sleep at all because of rats and roaches and the dirty environment. The verbal abuse and threats from the management is not worth it. You are better off paying a little extra for the peace of mind and a nice and pleasant stay in NYC.

I stayed at the morningside Inn for 3 nights with my husband and son. We had such a good time. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by patrick (the manager)and the two hispanic ladies that work there. They were so friendly and hospitable. My son took such a liking to patrick . he made us feel like we 've known each other for years, and the 2 young ladies that were there were so polite and friendly. they helped us find our way around the city, and even went as far as watching my son for me while i ran out to the store. The atmosphere at morningside inn was great . I recommened this hotel to everyone that is traveling alone or with children. It's like home away from home.

The information on the website is inaccurate: pictures are created by putting together pictures of beds and furniture!! Contrary to the website, there is no 24-hour service reception (desk closes at midnight), there is no security guard, no public or separate sitting areas - the only public space is in front of the Inn where lodgers talk until past midnight (front rooms very noisy as a result!!). The kitchen is not adequately equipped and the cleaning service is DISASTROUS: our sheets and towels were not changed for over 5 days, the trash was never emptied, while the floor carpet is worn out and spotted!! No need to mention that complaining to the staff is unnecessary as customer satisfaction seems to be their lowest priority... To conclude: it is a cheap place to stay, but the service and the attitude you get is still not worth paying such a price!!!!

Checking in: Record of our payment took some time to find on computer. After calling Patrick the manager and after we produced our receipt - receptionists said, "It's Hidden!'"Suitcase worth $820 left in luggage room disappeared and was never found!!!Nakita or Narika (same person) at reception: The lost suitcase was left with her. She said we didn't tell her we were "leaving the suitcase for a couple of days". What we told her was " we are leaving the suitcase... and we are coming back the following Tuesday." We asked her whether it was safe – she said YES.Patrick, the manager: young lodgers say he's "great or friendly". We thought he was nice, too! We trusted him and we LOST our SUITCASE. We asked him twice if we could leave our suitcase while we were visiting friends. He agreed. The evening before we left we asked him again. He agreed! (Please read on...)Tuesday: We came back. - No suitcase! Priscilla at reception checked with him by phone; he told her nobody told him about it. He told he could help us with some amount. / Wednesday: he'd look at video; we should give him 24 hrs. He told the suitcase was taken by mistake; we told him we'll report it to the police; he refused saying we must wait till Friday. / Thursday: he told us he called Narika in Maryland, that the suitcase is in locker; that she had key; she'll be in at 2PM Friday/ Friday: we checked at 4:45 - no Narika; he said she’d be there at 5PM. We checked again after 5PM - No Narika; he said we had until midnight. He said he could help with $200-$300 but…; he then claimed noboody saw the suitcase (Lucia the helper saw it!); he suggested we didn't check it in at all. We never saw him again! We wrote a letter of complaint - he replied: "further correspondence will be forwarded to attorney." Who stole the suitcase???PS: If you have to be there, learn their names and details of faces. If in trouble at the Inn, Patrick will use this against you if you have some uncertainties! Keep receipts; verify signatures to be sure!!!
Disgusting and Dirty! Very rude front desk clerk. Urine scent everywhere!! Gross kitchen and Moldy bathroom! Would much much rather stay at the YMCA, hostel or even the subway.

Morningside was the best of the three budget hotels I visited on a recent trip. The room was clean, fairly large, and had a very comfortable bed. It was also the only one with cable tv. I stayed at hotel 31, and hotel 17 as well ... and morningside offered a much nicer room. I had a private bath, so the only thing I can't rate is the shared bathroom. The location is good for access to Harlem and Central Park ... and you can get a subway to anywhere else. I would definitely stay here again.

The worst coustumer service ever.The manager Patrick, has a very bad attitude. I called to cancel my reservation and several days after he charged my credit card.I called to inquire about the issue and he told me "I would not help you, because I dont want to".Be aware they just still your money.

After reading both sides of the story, I must say that the stay this past weekend at Morningside was absolute wonderful. Patrick- front desk was the greatest with hotel assistance and suggestions for sight seeing and other places. Morningside Inn is a great for those travelers who just need it for one purpose "sleep".... especially with the hustling and bustling of shopping and sightseeing within a 24-48 hr duration. The location was perfect for taxi drives downtown and close walk to the central park. We drove from DC and found a parking spot on 107th a few feet away from the Morningside and use subways, taxi and good ole "pat & turn" walking. Kudos!

Hey ya'll! I actually stayed at Morningside Inn for a total of six months while I was attending school in NYC. I must say that at first I had my reservations about the place, but soon considered it home. Patrick (hotel manager) was amazing! He's super friendly and helpful when needed. I found the staff to also share the same friendliness. The only thing that was a little upsetting the whole time I was there was the fact that the phones were out of commission a lot. It became a little frustrating.But all in all, I felt completely safe there, no major problems with other attendents, great location and would recommend this place to anyone that wants to save money to spend on in that amazing city!

Watch out for the manager. HE charged my visa several times. After a while visa contacted me and took the case to court. Watch out: the hotel can only reached by phone. NO FAX/NO MAIL/ .. If you have a complaint they hang in the line.

The Morningside Inn cancelled my reservations 6 days before my arrival due to a fire. The cancellation came via email, not even a courtesy phone call!! The reservation manager did not even set up alternate accommodations for my party of 6. We had to cancel our whole trip due to their poor hotel skills.

Just returned from 2 nights at the Morningside. The room was very clean. We had a triple room, (one double bed and one single) with private bath. The room had a clean working refrigerator and a window which opened. The hotel staff were helpful and polite. We were not able to get extra pillows- one was provided per person. Although the shower water was not cold- it was never hot enough for us.The room lock was keyed and no dead bolts, chains, or other security features were provided. We added a chair next to the door at night. All in all we were very pleased with the Morningside. Our room cost $88 per night. We were able to spend more money in NYC with the money we saved by staying in this hotel. Don't stay here if you want luxury. If you want a back to basic place to lay your head the Morningside is a fine choice,

I have Just returned from my trip to NY and I have got to say that I enjoyed myself at Morningside Inn.The service there was very good. I was greated with professionalism by the front desk staff. They made me feel comfortable and glad that I picked that Inn to stay at. All my question were answered especially when I asked about places to visit, which made it easy for me to get around and enjoy some sites. The rooms were very comfortable and private. If ever in NY again, I would gladly go there once again for my stay.

The Morningside Inn was not as good as i expected. We had trouble finding a budget hotel in NYC over the weekend, and the Morningside was one of the only ones with rooms but we had to share bathroom facilities. We still paid more than we hoped. The best thing about the hotel is that there was lifts.But the downfalls were the size of the room, which was tiny. The bed was sloped and I kept on rolling onto my husband. The hallways were filled with smoke and being 6 months pregnant I was not happy. There was also hot water pipes in the walls which rattled ever time someone on other floors took a shower or went to the toilet. It was pretty grimy, although the staff were nice enough, but not all that helpful.

I read alot of reviews before staying at the Morningside Inn and was actually having second thoughts about staying there. If you are reading this and are feeling the same way...ignore the bad reviews! I stayed here for a week with three friends and it was great!! Deluxe double room with our own private bathroom, mini refrigerator, cable tv, A/C (though we didn't use it since it was freezing out), windows open, daily maid service, public kitchen, vending machines, 3 short blocks from subway station, close to many restaurants. The manager was awesome and was always willing to help with anything we needed. The only bad thing about our stay was that during the first 3 days they were putting in new tile for the floor (which didn't really matter anyway since we woke up to go out early every morning). I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to visit New York on a budget. Very clean and very affordable.

As early reviewer stated, don't listen to THE WHINERS! I've stayed at this hotel two times and the second time for over three weeks. No, its not your $300 a night hotel, but my room was clean the availbility of the shared restrooms was fine. I didn't have to wait for anyone. Most people just don't understand the concept of NYC hotels. Most hotels under $200 a night have shared restrooms. If you want an expensive hotel then be ready to spend it, but if you're in the city to see the sights, shop and enjoy the nightlife then stay here. NO, not all the shared bathroom hotels are clean as this one, but I'm a very picky person and I wasn't grossed out at all here. Don't stay at the West Side INN next door that was gross!!

I enjoyed staying at the morningside inn during my stay, as soon as I walked in the young lady at the froont desk greeted me with a friendly attitude and was very helpful thoughout my stay when I needed directions on how to get by since this is my first time in New York! all her instructions were right on target. I got my room cleaned about every day and the area is nice and quiet. I also had a room with a bathroom air conditioning and cable tv, even a mini refrigerator(since I understand they also have rooms that dont have bathrooms at a lower price)

You would be safer sleeping in a subways station. I locked myself out of my room and the matienence woman was able to break in with a credit card. I dare you all to google "MorningSide Inn November 7 2003" and see what comes up cause it gets worse.....You will be horrified, shocked, and dismayed.....NYC at its finest! Where was security when people needed them??

This hotel is a bargain compared to other hotels in New York City, but please put things in perspective:1) If you expect things to be like a 4-star hotel, GO TO A 4-STAR hotel. This hotel was clean enough for me. Just like visiting a friend or relative who lives in an old house. Not perfect, but good enough.2) If you are the queasy-type-because-I-can't-shower-pee-etc-in a hallway bathroom, please go (and pay for) a 4-star hotel.Morningside was cheap enough, clean enough for a $75-85 hotel in a city where rooms average two or three times that. Nothing more, nothing less. Would love a TV in the rooms, but otherwise, it was just what I paid for: a place to sleep and shine up.BTW, saw no mice/bedbugs. Just a stray cockroach. Stomped it, lived to tell.
This could be the end of your trip!!!don't go there!! it ids not worth the discount, you'll have the worst vacation ever - read other reviews...

Morningside Inn.......... What can I say???????? Never again. I visited New York with a friend in November and was really looking forward to it as I'd never been before. We booked a really cheap break which (including return flights from London) was £278. I assumed we had a really good deal talking to other friends who had been previously been and paid £400+ for the 3 nights at other hotels. If I has known what I did now, I would have gladly paid the extra money to stay somewhere decent. The place was an absolutely dump!!!!!!! When we arrived the man on the reception said he was giving us one of the "good rooms" but the room we were in was anything but. Firstly I wasn't happy with the security of the place, the door of our hotel room was extremly loose and I was sure it would have come open with a kick which did worry me slightly as we were 2 girls travelling alone. The room itself was dark, dingy and the window looked straight out onto a brick wall and wasn't even the size of a double room. Two small single beds were squeezed into this room along with a fridge and a chest of drawers so there wasn't enough room to swing a cat in there. The bedding did appear to be clean though, which is the only positive thing I can say about the place. To my horror though I found at least 2 small centipeady/beettle type creatures running around in the room!!!!!! And don't get me started on the bathrooms!!!!! Apparently they were cleaned everyday, but they were vile, digusting places. My personal hygeine is very important but even contemplated not using the bathroom for the 3 nights we were there as I didn't want to get in the shower or use the toilet. Also the toilet paper ran out on the 1st night and wasn't replaced in the bathroom throughout the rest of out stay and when we mentioned it at reception they said they did replace it, but it must have been taken by other guests. They did give us our own roll though........ Again insects seemed to have taken up residency in the bathroom (and I'm not talking about the other guests). To put a finer point on it........ If you are going to New York, definitely give the Morningside Inn a miss!!!!!! But I got what I paid for........ If it is a dirty cheap hotel, it is that cheap for a reason!!!!! Because it is nasty.........

I normally hesitate to rate a place as terrible, (since i have stayed in sme pretty bad hostels in NYC) but this is the first time I feel it is justified. My boyfriend booked a room for two nights over spring break and when we got there that night, I noticed that the beds were not made. On closer inspection, there were stains and crumbs all over the sheets. We went to the front desk, but the man there was "just filling in" and had no access keys to get clean sheets. He picked the lock on the linen cabinet, but ther was nothing in there. Also, he would not call the manager in front of us, saying only that he would give him a message from us. We were out of place to stay that night.
